column17: Dille village in Askira Uba Local government of Borno State came under heavy attack at the early hours of the day (6am) when gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram members launched an offensive on residents, killing five people and torching houses, including three churches. Daily Trust claims 38 deaths as result of the attack, others 26, tough these numbers could be included in a military air raid used to repel the attackers following the attack.

Seven persons were killed Monday in an attack by unknown gunmen on Gidandawa village in Maradun LGA of Zamfara State. Police spokesman said that the gunmen stormed the village early Monday and started shooting at the people, leaving the seven dead. He said two other persons sustained serious injuries. Vanguard reports 50 dead in the attack.

At least 11 persons have been feared killed at Zamadede of Pil-Gani district of Langtang North Local Government Area of Plateau State after unidentified gunmen, suspected to be Fulani, attacked the village during the early morning hours.
PDP and APC politicians clash violently at the Zamfara State House after a legislation disagreement. Injuries not known.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram abduct a German national outside his home during the morning hours in the Anguwan Faransa neighbourhood. Demands for his release not known. The abducted is a teacher. Following the abduction two members of a local organized militia group pursued the captors, but were shot and killed as they fled.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Dille, kills the village head and 45 others; several buildings destroyed.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Huyum village, kills nine.

Over 2000 ex-militants and their leaders from Ondo, Edo and Delta states thronged the streets of Bomadi, headquarters of Bomadi Local Government Area of Delta State in protest over the exclusion of proposed Toru-ebe State by the National Conference. They are demanding its adoption by the Confab as one of the three states that would be created from the South-South.

Unknown assailants suspected to be Fulani herdsmen have attacked and killed five persons in Rakung area in the outskirts of Barkin Ladi town. The gunmen reportedly stormed the village at midnight when the residents were fast asleep, and killed their victims.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram attack Sabon Gari during the evening hours, killing twenty residents. Fleeing residents disclosed that many people were seriously injured during the attack, while property worth millions of naira destroyed.

No fewer than four persons were feared dead following a deadly clash between operatives of the Nigerian Security and Civil Defence Corps (NSCDC), Neighbourhood Watch or CPYV and traders in FESTAC Town, Amuwo-Odofin Local Government Area (LGA) of Lagos State. The clash, which occurred in front of the LGA secretariat at 41 Road, FESTAC at about 4pm, started when some traders whose stores were demolished at Alakija, mobilised to protest the seizure of their goods. The previous day members of CPYV had gone on a rampage, targeting civilians.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram abduct a German national outside his home during the morning hours in the Anguwan Faransa neighbourhood. Demands for his release not known. The abducted is a teacher. Following the abduction two members of a local organized militia group pursued the captors, but were shot and killed as they fled.

Police, military and other security personnel confront protesters of impeachment proceedings undertaken by lawmakers at the Nasarawa State House of Assembly (NSHA) against Governor Umaru Tanko Al-Makura. No violence or arrests reported. Similar protest occurred in Keffi, Akwanga and Mararaba the same day.
Protests in Keffi, Akwanga and Mararaba against Nasarawa lawmakers moves to impeach Governor Umaru Tanko Al-Makura.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attack Sabon Gari for a second time the morning following an attack which left 20 dead. Seven killed in the new attack. The attack occurred while residents were burying the dead from the previous evening.
Residents of Lekki protest against the proposed plan by the state government to acquire the their land, from which they would have to vacate. The exact date of the protest is not known.

Unknown gunmen suspected to be assassins, on Wednesday night, killed three young men in Amadi-Ama Community in Port Harcourt City. One of the victims was supposed to contest for the presidency of the communities youth association scheduled to take place later in the week.
Protests in Keffi, Akwanga and Mararaba against Nasarawa lawmakers moves to impeach Governor Umaru Tanko Al-Makura.
Protests in Keffi, Akwanga and Mararaba against Nasarawa lawmakers moves to impeach Governor Umaru Tanko Al-Makura. In Keffi security forces dispersed the protesters.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Nine civilians dead after Boko Haram attacks Huyum village.
Hundreds of secondary school teachers engaged in a peaceful protest against the state governments policy which they claimed had stagnated their career. The group sought an audience with the governor.

Members of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) Project Reloaded, Federal Capital Territory (FCT) chapter, on Thursday, staged a peaceful protest against the Boko Haram insurgency in the country, condemning the circumstances where innocent lives were being wasted by the insurgents.

Police and Army members clash in Awka after a soldier is stopped by police and allegedly harassed while driving a motorcycle - the police were demanding a toll from those driving motorcycles. After complaint from the soldier the two groups clashed, but were dispersed before any injuries were sustained. Meanwhile, a group of motorcycle riders gathered in the are to protest the fee imposed by the police.
Motorcycle riders protest toll fee imposed on them by police.

Property destruction: The private mansion of former FCT Minister, Lt General Jeremiah Useni in Langtang North Local Government Area of Plateau State, was on Thursday attacked by unknown gunmen, who shot sporadically into the air.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Several people are feared killed as gunmen suspected to be members of the Boko Haram attacked Damboa in Borno State Thursday night and continued over several days. The ""Civilian JTF"" defended the city, eventually chasing the attackers away. Causality figures not known, though witnesses say residents were ""piling up corpses."" The Associated Press believes at least 100 deaths occurred as a result of the attacks in total.

Ethnic clashes hinging on politics erupted in Lafia, the Nasarawa State capital, over the impeachment notice filed again Governor Tanko Al-Makura by the House of Assembly. Youths of Eggon and Gwandara ethnic tribes engaged in a fight on the streets. Many were injured, three reported dead, 22 arrested. Reports indicate the incident began as a protest-counter protest that eventually led to the violence. Similar protests occurred the previous day in the city.
Unidentified attackers launched an assault on Fadan Karshi (Fadan Kaibi) during the early morning hours killing five peasants.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Several people are feared killed as gunmen suspected to be members of the Boko Haram attacked Damboa in Borno State Thursday night and continued over several days. The ""Civilian JTF"" clashed with Boko Haram - Causality figures not known, though witnesses say residents were ""piling up corpses."" The Associated Press believes at least 100 deaths occurred as a result of the attack.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram and the BVYG continue to battle in Damboa. No day-specific deaths reported. Fleeing residents have claimed to witness Boko Haram raising their flag above the city, though this may be interpreted as merely a section of the city, as the town was not reported fallen until the following day.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Numbering 300, suspected Boko Haram attack Damboa during the pre-dawn hours, kill at least 40 residents. Several thousand reported to be displaced due to the attack. Following the attack Boko Haram hoisted their flag over the city.
The Federal College of Agriculture, Adabeji, Apata, Ibadan was thrown into chaos following violent clash between the police and some students because of the arrest of a fellow student.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Six are killed when Boko Haram attacks Saha and Bulabuli-Pegi Barawa villages in Gwoza Local Council of Borno State.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Six are killed when Boko Haram attacks Saha and Bulabuli-Pegi Barawa villages in Gwoza Local Council of Borno State.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: No fewer than 60 people from Gaidamgari village, in Bama Local Government Area of Borno State were killed weekend, while many others sustained gunshot wounds when some gunmen suspected to be members of the Boko Haram Islamist sect attacked the community. The attack occurred at 10pm.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram and the BVYG continue to battle in Damboa, eventually causing the BVYG to capitulate and flee. The Associated Press estimates 100 deaths throughout the four-day sedge.
Two groups of the Egbema clan clash over oil production rights. Six feared killed, including a leader of one side.
A mob nearly lynches a woman suspected of stealing children before police save her.
A clash between Fulani herdsmen and indigenes of Owukpa, Ogbadibo Local Government Area of Benue State has led to the death of one person while several others were injured.

column7: NULGE: Nigerian Union of Local Government Employees
column17: A peaceful demonstration was embarked upon by workers of Jos-North Local Council Area of Plateau State to protest against the non-payment of allowances. The protests lasted two consecutive days. NULGE was a key organizer of the protests.

Four persons from Aguleri, Anambra East local government area were killed on Monday, while seven others were seriously injured in a renewed clash between the people of Aguleri and Echeno/Odeke in Ibaji local government area of Kogi State. The two groups were fighting over rights to oil production in the area. It is not clear if the Echeno/Odeke fighters were organized around ethnicity, or simply residents of the area.
Physically challenged persons in Nasarawa State staged a protest against the impeachment move by the state House of Assembly against the over alleged misconduct and mismanagement of state funds.
TVG protests against the plan to impeach the Nasarawa State Governor by the State Legislature.

Thousands of youths in FESTAC Festival Town, Lagos took to the streets of the metropolis protesting against several issues including the delay in the rescue of abducted Chibok girls, incessant killing of innocent people by the militant group called Boko Haram and alleged ""campaign of calumny"" against the Area Commander of the Area E Command.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen shoot and kill five in Damboa, three near the district heads residence and two others nearby.

column7: NULGE: Nigerian Union of Local Government Employees
column17: A peaceful demonstration was embarked upon by workers of Jos-North Local Council Area of Plateau State to protest against the non-payment of allowances. The protests lasted two consecutive days. NULGE was a key organizer of the protests.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A suicide attack near Muhammadu Buharis motorcade in the afternoon causes 50 deaths, plus injuries. Perpetrators not known, though Boko Haram is widely suspected. The General was unharmed, though the death total is suspected to rise.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The village head and 11 others were shot dead during the attack on Garubula Village of Biu area of the state. Authorities believe Boko Haram is responsible. The attack occurred late in the day.
A group of BringBackOurGirls protesters clash over use of money. Police forces broke up the clash.

Workers at the Federal Ministry of Finance protest poor work conditions during a four hour demonstration. They barricaded the main gate of the ministry, preventing visitors and staff from either gaining entrance to the ministry or going out. The protest may have had occurred on 22/07.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: On 23 July 2013, NAF and CJTF tortured prisoners, believed to be Boko Haram fighters, at military barracks in Bama.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: An explosive targeting a prominent Sheikh kills 35 bystanders via suicide vest, including some of the Shieks aids in Ungwan Sarki (Unguwar Sarki). Many other people were injured, among them members of an Islamic aid group. The Sheikh survived. The perpetrators allegiance and identity are not known, though Boko Haram is heavily suspected. The blast occurred shortly after noon.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 23 July 2014, Gunmen suspected to be members of the Boko Haram group killed two people in Gamboru town of Gamboru-Ngala LGA. One of the victims was the vice chairman of a a local armed group, though it is not clear if he was intended target of the attackers. The attack occurred late during the nigh time hours.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Property destruction: Boko Haram members destroyed a bridge at Ngala town of Borno State near the border between Nigeria and Cameroon. As a result of the bridges destruction, business activities between Nigeria and Cameroon around that axis have come to a halt with hundreds.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram detonate an explosive hidden in a refrigerator at a bus stop in the Sabon Gari neighbourhood killing five and injuring twelve others.
Members of the APC protest against a proposed impeachment of the Nazarawa State Government.

Traders marched around their markets in protest against the activities of the Abuja Environmental Protection Board (AEPB), which they said contravenes the President Goodluck Jonathan administrations transformation programme.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks a bridge in Bujimirum Katarko, killing eight. The group also abducted a cleric.

Five have been reported dead (later revised to 35) after the clash between soldiers and adherents of a Shiite Movement at Sabon Gari (Zaria). The clash erupted after the members of the sect abducted two soldiers who were trying to break the procession of sect members who were marking the Qudus day, a day set aside by Shiite movement in Nigeria in support of the Palestinian movement.

Supporters of the All Progressives Congress (APC) governorship candidate, Governor Rauf Aregbesola and those of the People Democratic Party (PDP), Senator Iyiola Omisore in Ilesa engaged themselves in a bloody clash, leaving two persons dead. The clash began after PDP members burnt APC billboards.
Following a clash which coast the lives of the Shiites several members of the sect protested the violence.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram gunmen attack Shaffa killing two and inuring several.
A leadership struggle in an oil community becomes violent causing the destruction of property. Causalities or injuries not known.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Zani village during the late morning hours, shooting 17 dead indiscriminately. This Day Media claims 30 dead, with the attack occurring in Mubeng.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: In addition to Zani in Hing LGA, Boko Haram attacks Lubu and Mubeng killing a total of 30 in the LGA. Note: conflicting causality reports from various sources given to each town.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Local sources said four soldiers were killed in Garkida, Gombi LGA, during a fierce gun battle that lasted many hours between the members of the sect and soldiers while many civilians who were caught up in the crossfire were also killed. The numbers of civilians killed were not articulated.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attack several locations in Madagali LGA (names not provided) killing ""many"". Food items and cattle were also taken by the attackers.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: In addition to Zani in Hing LGA, Boko Haram attacks Lubu and Mubeng killing a total of 30 in the LGA. Note: conflicting causality reports from various sources given to each town.

Kano witnessed fresh bomb attacks as twin explosions targeted at worshippers at Saint Charles Catholic Church, Sabon Gari, and a police check point in Kano killed six persons. The dead included a soldier, two women, a man, a child and a female suicide bomber. Five were killed at the church (later raised to seven), one at the police checkpoint.

Kano witnessed fresh bomb attacks as twin explosions targeted at worshippers at Saint Charles Catholic Church, Sabon Gari, and a police check point in Kano killed six persons. The dead included a soldier, two women, a man, a child and a female suicide bomber. Five were killed at the church (later raised to seven), one at the police checkpoint.
Defusal: A bomb is discovered planted in a mosque by police and detonated safely.

An explosive detonates at a shopping centre, marking the third bombing in Kano in two days. Though there were injuries, only the suicide bomber has died. The group responsible was not speculated on by the media. The attack occurred in the Buhari Square area of the city.

A faction clash in the oil producing area of Ugborodo spills over to nearby Warri when one group destroyed the home of another. It is not mentioned if any one was harmed, or if the attackers engaged the property owners physically.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Following an attack on 25/07 on a bridge in Katarko, Boko Haram fighters return for a second attack the following Monday, as well as an attack on nearby Gulani (perhaps Gujba). Causalities not known in either town.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Following an attack on 25/07 on a bridge in Katarko, Boko Haram fighters return for a second attack the following Monday, as well as an attack on nearby Gulani (perhaps Gujba). Causalities not known in either town.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram members bomb a bridge in Katarko for a third time on the morning of 29/07, causing the entire structure of the bridge to collapse. It was also reported Boko Haram had ""taken over the town."" The bridge linked Yobe to Biu town.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Property destruction: Boko Haram destroyed the Katarko (also known as Bujimirum) Bridge in Gujba local government of Yobe State which linked dozens of communities with southern part of Borno and Adamawa States. The recent destruction of bridges is believed to be a method of tactically disrupting military supplies to the area. No injuries or causalities reported.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Thirteen people died an 35 injured in attacks on two mosques by two suicide bombers in Potiskum during the evening hours. The attacks were targeted at worshippers during the evening prayer around 7:30pm local time. They attacked the Alkali Kalli mosque, a few metres away from the Emir of Fikas palace and the Sakafa mosque, located at the busy Potiskum central market. Perpetrators not known. Authorities suspect Boko Haram.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: On 29 July 2013, NAF and CJTF shot and killed 35 prisoners at military barracks in Bama

Armed men abducted the 90 year-old-mother of Senator representing Bayelsa Central Senatorial district and killed an official with the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency. The Senators mothers driver was shot in the arm during the attack. The demands for release are not known.

Youths numbering over 200 from Alor-Uno in Nsukka Local Government invaded the neighbouring Amaogbo community allegedly destroying property worth millions of naira. It was learnt that the youths, who chanted war songs, carried with them other dangerous weapons descended on any property in sight as they marched round the community. The violence is believed to have stemmed from a dispute over land between the two towns.

A leadership tussle plaguing the oil-rich Ugborodo community in Warri South-West council area of Delta State manifest itself on 30/07 night when youths said to belong to the faction led by a prominent chief allegedly burnt down two luxury cars belonging to youths of a former council boss. It was not reported if the automobiles owner was involved or present when the cars were destroyed.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Property destruction: Five churches in Kwajaffa, Tasha Alade and other surrounding communities (not named) in Hawul Local Government Area of Borno have allegedly been set ablaze by suspected members of Boko Haram during the night-time hours. No causalities reported - it is not clear Boko Haram engaged any person physically. The Hawul LGA is a predominantly Christian area.

There was protest on Wednesday during the election of executive officers for the Association of Spare Parts Marketers and Dealers Association (ASPMDA) Trade Fair unit in Lagos. The group called for the cancellation of the election on the belief that it may be rigged.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Property destruction: Five churches in Kwajaffa, Tashan Alade and other surrounding communities (not named) in Hawul Local Government Area of Borno have allegedly been set ablaze by suspected members of Boko Haram during the night-time hours. No causalities reported - it is not clear Boko Haram engaged any person physically. The Hawul LGA is a predominantly Christian area.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A suicide bomber killed six people at a college campus in Kano. The source notes this is the fourth attack in Kano since the weekend, the suicide attacks all female. The number of dead vary from source to source. Several other injured.

Parents of secondary students enrolled in a public school in Osogbo protest at the office of the headmaster for improved boarding facilities. The group gave a five-day ultimatum before embarking on a mass protest.

Fourteen, including a teenage girl were reportedly killed in a communal clash between the Jukuns and Hausas in Jalingo of Ibi Local Government Area of Taraba State. Also, no fewer than 40 houses, vehicles and other properties worth millions of naira were destroyed in the bloody clash which erupted at about 4.30a.m. but was later brought under control by a combined team of soldiers and police that were drafted to the area to maintain peace. The clash may have stemmed from a robbery that had been seen a ethnically based earlier in the week.

On or near 2 August 2014, a local armed group shot and killed a traditional medical practitioner in Nkpor (Idemili North, Anambra) for allegedly possessing some substances suspected to be charms and fresh animal parts.

At least one soldier and two police officers are dead following a clash between the two. Witnesses said the incident was due to an argument between a Divisional Police Officer (DPO) and a soldier, who was alleged to have overtaken the cop with his motorcycle. Further details vague. The exact date of the clash not known.

Youths of Biseni clan in Yenagoa Local Government Area of Bayelsa State have shut down five oil wells in Idu Oil Field operated by the Nigerian Agip Oil Company. The protesting youths from, Egbebiri I and II and Akudonu, carried out the action on Sunday following the alleged refusal by Agip to provide a generating set for them one year after the oil company promised to do so. The youths were said to have erected blockades on the roads leading to wells 3, 6,8,11 and 12 chanting solidarity songs.

At least one person was killed and several others injured when unknown gunmen opened fire on worshippers during Sunday service at a Catholic Church in Ungwar Pau-Pau in Kachia Local Government Area of Kaduna State. The incident happened in the early hours of Sunday when the gunmen invaded Catholic Church during service, shooting sporadically.

Gunmen in the early hours of the day abducted the younger brother to the Speaker of Bayelsa House of Assembly. The abduction comes at a time when as House Speaker in enduring possible impeachment proceedings.

About eight persons were shot dead by unknown gunmen while two others were injured in Port Harcourt metropolis, Rivers State. The incident occurred less than eight hours after a cleric was killed during a clash between the people of Deeyor and Deken communities in Gokana Local Government Area of the state. The reason for the clash between the two communities not known.

Members of the Nigerian Human Rights Community (NHRC) took to the streets of Lagos State in large numbers to protest the Nasarawa State House of Assemblys plot to impeach Governor Umaru Tanko Al-Makura. Along with the NHRC, several other groups protested. The demonstrators protested along several streets throughout the state (specifics not known). Included in the protest was a sentiment of displeasure of the state of the nation.

About eight persons were shot dead by unknown gunmen while two others were injured in Port Harcourt metropolis, Rivers State. The incident occurred less than eight hours after a cleric was killed during a clash between the people of Deeyor and Deken communities in Gokana Local Government Area of the state. The reason for the clash between the two communities not known.
Traders lynch two thives in Ogbogonogo market, Asaba.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces in Borno State recapture five areas in Borno State, including Damboa, Delwa, Wanga, Manga and Mustafari. Delwa, Wanga, Manga may be unincorporated areas. Dates unknown or vague: the military operation began ""early in the week"" and occurred over a 48-hour period. 50 reported BH dead, two soldiers.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces in Borno State recapture five areas in Borno State, including Damboa, Delwa, Wanga, Manga and Mustafari. Delwa, Wanga, Manga may be unincorporated areas. Dates unknown or vague: the military operation began ""early in the week"" and occurred over a 48-hour period. 50 reported BH dead, two soldiers.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces in Borno State recapture five areas in Borno State, including Damboa, Delwa, Wanga, Manga and Mustafari. Delwa, Wanga, Manga may be unincorporated areas. Dates unknown or vague: the military operation began ""early in the week"" and occurred over a 48-hour period. 50 reported BH dead, two soldiers.

Retired armed forces personnel staged a peaceful protest in Abuja over the non-payment of their pension by the Federal Government from 2010 till date. The retired soldiers carrying placards with various inscriptions were however prevented from having access into the presidential villa by armed soldiers and police men who mounted a road block.

Some aggrieved people of Biseni clan in Yenagoa Local Government Area of Bayelsa State shut down five oil wells in Idu Oil Field operated by the Nigerian Agip Oil Company in protest of ""neglect"" by the company after promised incentives were not met. This is the second protest in the area in three days.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces in Borno State recapture five areas in Borno State, including Damboa, Delwa, Wanga, Manga and Mustafari. Delwa, Wanga, Manga may be unincorporated areas. Dates unknown or vague: the military operation began ""early in the week"" and occurred over a 48-hour period. Causalities not known.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Kirawa, unknown casualties. The attack may be in conjunction with an attack at nearby Gwoza.
Unidentified gunmen attacked a boat conveying passengers from Dampar village in Ibi council of Taraba State, killing three persons in the process. The reason for the attack is not known.
Three University of Calabar students are shot and killed by security forces after the group began a protest over a local election issue. Witnesses reported the killings may have been unintentional.
A 70-year-old woman led a group of protesters over the last months murder of her son. The group called for re-opening of a police investigation.
The coalition of aggrieved veterans of the Nigeria armed forces protested in Abuja over the non-payment of their pensions by the Federal Government.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram gunmen attacked the north-eastern town of Gwoza leaving ""dozens"" dead and a local leader missing in a pre-dawn attack. The attackers also burnt down the divisional police headquarters, the local government secretariat and other public buildings in the town. There was no reported resistance from village militia. Boko Haram gained control of the town following the attack. Later reports claim 100 deaths.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Five soldiers were killed by Boko Haram fighters in an ambush at Limankara village.

A fresh attack by suspected Fulani gunmen on Gimi Dogara village in Sanga Local Government Area has claimed four lives with 15 houses burnt down. The attack, which was launched around 11 p.m. on Thursday (07/08) night, left the villagers scampering to different directions for safety.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Residents of Gujba LGA report Boko Haram has overtaken three military camps at Buni Yadi, Buni Gari and Goniri. The date(s) of the territory exchange are not known, though it is known the attacks happened sometime following the bombing of the Katarko Bridge by the insurgents on 25/07. Causalities not known.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Residents of Gujba LGA report Boko Haram has overtaken three military camps at Buni Yadi, Buni Gari and Goniri. The date(s) of the territory exchange are not known, though it is known the attacks happened sometime following the bombing of the Katarko Bridge by the insurgents on 25/07. Causalities not known.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Residents of Gujba LGA report Boko Haram has overtaken three military camps at Buni Yadi, Buni Gari and Goniri. The date(s) of the territory exchange are not known, though it is known the attacks happened sometime following the bombing of the Katarko Bridge by the insurgents on 25/07. Causalities not known.
Students at the Federal University of Petroleum Resources Effurun, FUPRE protest the killing of a fellow student at the hand of armed robbers.
Wives of soldiers protest their upcoming deployment to fight Boko Haram in Gwaza.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram abducted about 100 persons from a Borno community, Doron Baga. Of the abducted ten were killed, while many of the young men were forcibly conscripted into the sect.
Property destruction: Members of the PDP destroyed the local government party secretariat of the APC in Akuku Toru. No reported to violence to APC members.

A group of woman and youths protest the alleged exclusion to them by Shell Oil to not hire members of their community for employment with the company. The military made a presence in the area, but there is no reported violence between they and the protesters.
Suspected Fulani attack Yelwa, kill 14 and make off with 200 head of cattle. Earlier reports suggest five deaths and 400+ cattle stolen.

PDP supporters attack a group of APC celebrants following an election. The source reports a ""clash,"" but does not detail any APC retaliation. Injuries not known. PDP members later attacked and damaged properties belonging to the father of the Executive Secretary of Ife South Local Government in the Gbodo area.
Two factions of the PDP clash at a party meeting. One reported death, along with numerous minor injuries.
Students again protest the death of a fellow student at the hands of a suspected thief. The group had originally protested on 07/08.
Unknown gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen attacked Babayo-Zarazong village in Jos East Local Government Area, killing two persons and burning down several houses.

Wives of soldiers protest their upcoming deployment to fight Boko Haram in Gwaza. The women burnt tyres along the streets, accusing army commanders of exploiting the war on terror for pecuniary gains. The group also blocked the main gate of the 21 Armoured Brigade. This is the second such protest in several days.

Former workers of the Nigeria Telecommunications Ltd (NITEL) and Mobile Telecommunications Ltd (MTEL) shut the companies premises in Abuja, preventing staff and visitors entry or exit in protest against governments failure to pay them entitlements.

Over 500 indigenes of Okpe Kingdom in Delta State protested to the state House of Assembly over alleged embezzlement of public fund by the Secretary, Delta State Board of Internal Revenue (DSBIR). The protesters held various place cards describing the Secretarys alleged corruptions.
The BringBackOurGirls held a peaceful demonstration on the streets of Abuja.
Protesters of the NLC protest at the headquarters of a bank over its debt.

Members of the APC blame the PDP for an attack against the home of the Minister of State for Education, which left seven people injured. The attack is believed to be in relation to several other disturbances between the PDP and APC around the Port Harcourt metro on 13/08.

Business and commercial activities were disrupted in parts of Port Harcourt, the Rivers State capital following clashes between supporters of the All Progressives Congress (APC) and the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), ahead of the planned visit of Governor Chibuike Rotimi Amaechi to Rumueprikom community in Obio/Akpor local government area of the state. The clashes were said to have started at the popular Wimpey Junction along Ikwerre Road in Port Harcourt, and later spread to Rumueme, also in Obio/Akpor local government area, and Diobu, in Port Harcourt City local government area. Several injuries reported.

Business and commercial activities were disrupted in parts of Port Harcourt, the Rivers State capital following clashes between supporters of the All Progressives Congress (APC) and the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), ahead of the planned visit of Governor Chibuike Rotimi Amaechi to Rumueprikom community in Obio/Akpor local government area of the state. The clashes were said to have started at the popular Wimpey Junction along Ikwerre Road in Port Harcourt, and later spread to Rumueme, also in Obio/Akpor local government area, and Diobu, in Port Harcourt City local government area. Several injuries reported.

Business and commercial activities were disrupted in parts of Port Harcourt, the Rivers State capital following clashes between supporters of the All Progressives Congress (APC) and the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), ahead of the planned visit of Governor Chibuike Rotimi Amaechi to Rumueprikom community in Obio/Akpor local government area of the state. The clashes were said to have started at the popular Wimpey Junction along Ikwerre Road in Port Harcourt, and later spread to Rumueme, also in Obio/Akpor local government area, and Diobu, in Port Harcourt City local government area. Several injuries reported.

Protest for and against the announcement for fees reduction by the Ogun State government turned bloody as students of the Olabisi Onabanjo University (OOU), Ago-Iwoye and those of Moshood Abiola Polytechnic (MAPOLY), engaged in a free for all fight. About four students were injured in the clash, which caused a traffic gridlock along the Abeokuta-Sagamu road. The students from the polytechnic had staged a rally in support of the fee reduction by the government while the university students staged a protest against the move.

Youths in Southern Kaduna (Unguwan Wakili) have protest against the endorsement of President Goodluck Jonathan for the 2015 Presidency by Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) and top government functionaries from their area. It is not clear if the youths identified with the PDP themselves. There was a police presence at the protest site, which restricted the group from entering a PDP convention hall.

A group men protested against the killing of two persons by a policeman attached to the Iba Police Post at Iyana School Bus Stop. The protesters, who chanted war songs and held dangerous weapons, remained on the streets for more than three hours, threatening to set the police station on fire. The police maintain they were attacked by criminals, causing the killing.

column7: PHCN: Power Holding Company of Nigeria
column17: PHCN members protest at Sapele power station over unpaid back wages.

Protesting students clash with police, leaving four people hospitalized. The protest which was staged by the students of the Olabisi Onabanjo University, Ago-Iwoye, was for further reduction of school fees after government had reduced the fees. The students had earlier in the week stormed the entrance of the Governor's Office, Oke-Mosan, protesting the reduction of school fees in all the state-owned institutions. The situation turned chaotic on 15/08 when the students attempted to block the Ibara Government Reservation road, in order to ground vehicular movement.
Unknown gunmen have invaded Bara on motorcycles killing two persons, destroying Local Government Secretariat, Local Government Lodge, EPI Office, Court and Local Government Staff Quarters.
Students of Osun State University riot violently after it is learned that several of their fellow students may be punished following a recent accident.

Suspected PDP militia attack four Rivers State communities, Okomoko, Egwi and Ulakwo 1 & 2 in an effort believed to be motivated by the desire for the political supremacy of Etche LGA. An Air Force officer and solider were believed to have been killed in the attacks and fighting. Exact date(s) unknown. Attacks occurred ""at the weekend.""

Suspected PDP militia attack four Rivers State communities, Okomoko, Egwi and Ulakwo 1 & 2 in an effort believed to be motivated by the desire for the political supremacy of Etche LGA. An Air Force officer and solider were believed to have been killed in the attacks and fighting. Exact date(s) unknown. Attacks occurred ""at the weekend.""

A clash between supporters of the state governor, Rochas Anayo Okorocha, and that of the deputy speaker, House of Representatives. Hon. Emeka Ihedioha is reported of a local festival in Ahiazu Mbaise LGA - no exact location provided. The clash is attributed to the contest for power between the two politicians ahead of the 2015 general elections. No injuries reported. The clash took place ""at the weekend.""

Suspected PDP militia attack four Rivers State communities, Okomoko, Egwi and Ulakwo 1 & 2 in an effort believed to be motivated by the desire for the political supremacy of Etche LGA. An Air Force officer and solider were believed to have been killed in the attacks and fighting. Exact date(s) unknown. Attacks occurred ""at the weekend.""

Two persons have been reportedly killed in the early hours of the day by unknown attackers at Rafin Bwaunan Noma community in Bassa Local government Area of Plateau State. The victims included a 41 year old man and a young girl.
Suspected insurgents (not named) ambushed and burnt down a police patrol vehicle at Tumu village in Akko Local Government Area of Gombe State. Injuries reported, no causalities.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Ala in a suspected coordinated attack that extends ""between Dikwa and Marte towns."" Causalities reported, but are not town specific and are not enumerated. Date is vague.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Alabanya and Kaje in a series of coordinated attacks throughout the region. Fatalities are reported, numbers not known (coded as 10). Exact date is not known, ~17/08.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A security official reports seeing corpses (numbers not known, coded as 10) in Marte on 17/08. It is not clear when the date of the attack was. Boko Haram is blamed for the attack.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Mafa, date not known, ~17/08. The attack may have been in conjunction with an attack on Dikwa.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Riding motorcycles, members of Boko Haram attack Dikwa. ""They killed many people (numbers not known) and destroyed many houses."" The attack is believed to be in revenge for the town rising up against Boko Haram by mobilising vigilante militias. Date of the attack is vague.

Members of an Anglican Church protest the destruction of their sanctuary by ""thugs"", which occurred late last week. The protest occurred in various locations in Onitsha, though the church building itself is in nearby Oyi LGA.
The BringBackOurGirls Group protests at Asokoro junction for the release of the abducted Chibok girls.
A group of 100+ youth protest the killing of a man by the anti-robbery police division.
Hundreds of doctors took to major streets in Lagos, Ibadan, Akure in Ondo State, to protest against the purported sacking of 16,000 resident doctors.

column7: NMA: Nigeria Medical Association; Health Workers (Nigeria)
column17: Members of the Lagos State chapter, Nigeria Medical Association (NMA) at the Teaching Hospital, Idi-Araba staged a protest over the sacking of 16,000 resident doctors in the country by the federal government.
Hundreds of doctors took to major streets in Lagos, Ibadan, Akure in Ondo State, to protest against the purported sacking of 16,000 resident doctors.

Meat sellers protest low patronage due to the outbreak of Ebola disease. The women under the aegis of Bushmeat Sellers Association lamented that since the announcement that the deadly disease could be caused by eating bush meat, spell had been cast on their sales. The protest took place at the governors office.
Hundreds of doctors took to major streets in Lagos, Ibadan, Akure in Ondo State, to protest against the purported sacking of 16,000 resident doctors.
A gathering of APC and PDP supporters degenerates into violence when a controversial PDP lawmaker arrives to move forward with a gubernatorial impeachment vote. Four killed, one critically injured.

column6: MASSOB-Uwazuruike: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra (Uwazuruike Faction)
column8: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: Two factions of MASSOB clash at a headquarters in Okwe over internal political strife. Four believed dead.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attack and overtake Buni Yadi, raising their flag over the town. Of any deaths three are known - two villagers were executed for smoking cigarettes, a third for dealing drugs. Many other residents have fled to neighbouring towns. Date(s) of the attack not entirely known.
Youths in Patani Local Council took to the streets protesting the alleged imposition of a council chairmanship candidate who opposed President Johanthan, who they support.
Hundreds of traders in Abuja staged a peaceful protest against imposition of multiple taxes on them by Abuja Municipal Area Council (AMAC).

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram insurgents have taken over the Police Mobile Training camp - a police academy - in Limankara village. It was gathered that there was heavy fighting between the insurgents and troops before the camp finally fell. It is believed Boko Haram targeted the facility after reported attempts from security forces to dislodge Boko Harams control from Gwoza, which had fallen under BH control several weeks earlier. Numerous trainees (""scores"") were killed or seriously injured by the attackers, no numbers provided. It was later determined by Vanguard that 35 officers were declared missing following the attack. Following the takeover a video was released by the group declaring a caliphate in the area.

Inhabitants of Igbei community in Auchi, Etsako West Local Government Area of Edo State on Thursday (21/08) took to the streets to protest alleged state government take over of their land, despite a court order.
Residents protest the poor state of local roads in Abule Ado.

column7: CISLAC: Civil Society Legislative Advocacy Centre
column17: CISLAC gathers to protest a tax.
Unidentified gunmen attack and kill three at a police checkpoint at Tillei location. The attack occurred during the night-time hours.
Okada riders, believed to be mostly Chadian, clash with police during a protest. The reason for the protest is not known. Much of the property in the area was reported destroyed.

Fulani and Eggos militias clash in various unarticulated locations over several days in Lafia and Obi LGAs. Though the battles began at the beginning of the week details of the clashes become more detailed on 26/09 and 27/08. Causality details unknown.

Fulani and Eggos militias clash in various unarticulated locations over several days in Lafia and Obi LGAs. Though the battles began at the beginning of the week details of the clashes become more detailed on 26/09 and 27/08. Causality details unknown.
Unidentified gunmen, likely Fulani, attack Bishu village of Wukari killing six.

Fulani and Eggos militias clash in various unarticulated locations over several days in Lafia and Obi LGAs. Though the battles began at the beginning of the week details of the clashes become more detailed on 26/09 and 27/08. Causality details unknown.

Fulani and Eggos militias clash in various unarticulated locations over several days in Lafia and Obi LGAs. Though the battles began at the beginning of the week details of the clashes become more detailed on 26/09 and 27/08. Causality details unknown.
Property destruction: Unidentified attackers burn down a church in Sabon Garin Hyanbula - a location in Jigawa State. No causalities or injuries reported.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks and overtakes Banki. Many military members managed to escape and fled towards Amhide villages before they entered Cameroon for safety. Causalities not known, however, sources said many casualties were recorded including Boko Haram, security operatives and civilians who were caught up in the crossfire.

No fewer than 17 people were reported killed and scores injured in a renewed clash between Fulani herdsmen and Eggon farmers at Fadaman Bauna, Achigogo in Lafia LGA. The attack occurred during the evening hours when Eggon youths attacked the Fulani village. The attack is believed to be motivated revenge for past Fulani attacks.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill a police officer after trailing him to his home from a mosque.
Youths in Emohua community of Rivers State have protest against the setting up of an Ebola quarantine centre in their area by the state government for fear of outbreak.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram takes over Madagali town of Adamawa State, including a Catholic Church building. ""Dozens"" killed. Exact date not known.

Gunmen attack Nwuban (Wumban), Muba (Jikun) and Nbishi villages of Wukari LGA. 13 reported killed 50 houses destroyed. Some sources claim 20 dead plus 85 injured. The identities of the attackers are believed to be Fulani.
A group of traders protest the destruction of their structures by the government.

Two villages in Wukari LGA are attacked by suspected Fulani gunmen. The attack caused villagers to flee and the destruction for their crops, causalities not known. The twin attacks comes only a day after two other villages in the area were attacked.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attack and overtake Gamboru and Ngala towns, along the border with Cameroon. The attack began on a base in Gamboru, causing the 480 members of the military to flee into Cameroon, fifteen deaths reported. The also caused all military forces in nearby Ngala to flee as well, allowing Boko Haram to enter that town without resistance. In a response to the attacks, the Nigerian Air Force jet later dropped a massive bomb in the middle of Gamboru after hovering for several minutes in the air. The jet then left while the militants began a house-to-house raid in Gamboru. The attack occurred early in the morning. The attackers later attempted to destroy a bridge linking Nigeria with Cameroon.

Fulani and Eggos militias clash in various unarticulated locations over several days in Lafia and Obi LGAs. Though the battles began at the beginning of the week details of the clashes become more detailed on 26/09 and 27/08. Causality details unknown.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attack and overtake Gamboru and Ngala towns, along the border with Cameroon. The attack began on a base in Gamboru, causing the 480 members of the military to flee into Cameroon, fifteen deaths reported. The also caused all military forces in nearby Ngala to flee as well, allowing Boko Haram to enter that town without resistance. In a response to the attacks, the Nigerian Air Force jet later dropped a massive bomb in the middle of Gamboru after hovering for several minutes in the air. The jet then left while the militants began a house-to-house raid in Gamboru. The attack occurred early in the morning. The attackers later attempted to destroy a bridge linking Nigeria with Cameroon.
A group of lawyers protest the continued failure of a government server to function property, causing a backlog of work.

Two villages in Wukari LGA are attacked by suspected Fulani gunmen. The attack caused villagers to flee and the destruction for their crops, causalities not known. The twin attacks comes only a day after two other villages in the area were attacked.
One person is killed and another injured by unidentified gunmen following an attack on Ungwan Mallam in Sanga LGA.
Six are killed in Kafin Hausa by unidentified attackers.

Fulani and Eggos militias clash in various unarticulated locations over several days in Lafia and Obi LGAs. Though the battles began at the beginning of the week details of the clashes become more detailed on 26/09 and 27/08. Causality details unknown.
A group of doctors protest their dismissal by the federal government following a prolonged strike.

Commercial tricycle operators in Bayelsa State, popularly known as Keke Napep, protested against the alleged excessive use of force and extortion by policemen. The protest comes after police are believed to have mishandled a pregnant woman.
Two House of Representatives aspirants and their allies or supporters clash in Ibadan, at least ten injuries.
Supporters of the APC hold a protest in support of the removal of a council chairman.

A range of forty to sixty reported dead in a clash between Fulani/Alagoa (Fulani mercenaries) and Eggon militias in Tudun-Ababu, Wamba, Akwanga, Nasarawa Eggon - the source records the deaths exclusively at Tudun-Ababu. It was also gathered that all the inhabitants of Assakio, Tudun Adabu and Dedere have deserted their homes as a result of the crisis in the areas. Victims of the troubled areas were seen moving their children and property to Lafia town. Clashes in the area between the two groups has been occurring since 23/08.

A range of forty to sixty reported dead in a clash between Fulani/Alagoa (Fulani mercenaries) and Eggon militias in Tudun-Ababu, Wamba, Akwanga, Nasarawa Eggon - the source records the deaths exclusively at Tudun-Ababu. It was also gathered that all the inhabitants of Assakio, Tudun Adabu and Dedere have deserted their homes as a result of the crisis in the areas. Victims of the troubled areas were seen moving their children and property to Lafia town. Clashes in the area between the two groups has been occurring since 23/08.

A range of forty to sixty reported dead in a clash between Fulani/Alagoa (Fulani mercenaries) and Eggon militias in Tudun-Ababu, Wamba, Akwanga, Nasarawa Eggon - the source records the deaths exclusively at Tudun-Ababu. It was also gathered that all the inhabitants of Assakio, Tudun Adabu and Dedere have deserted their homes as a result of the crisis in the areas. Victims of the troubled areas were seen moving their children and property to Lafia town. Clashes in the area between the two groups has been occurring since 23/08.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Miringa, destroys communication and snatched a sports utility vehicle belonging to the Borno State chairman of the All Progressives Congress.
Residents of the Downs-Quarters area of Kaduan protest the placing of a Ebola isolation centre in their area.

A range of forty to sixty reported dead in a clash between Fulani/Alagoa (Fulani mercenaries) and Eggon militias in Tudun-Ababu, Wamba, Akwanga, Nasarawa Eggon - the source records the deaths exclusively at Tudun-Ababu. It was also gathered that all the inhabitants of Assakio, Tudun Adabu and Dedere have deserted their homes as a result of the crisis in the areas. Victims of the troubled areas were seen moving their children and property to Lafia town. Clashes in the area between the two groups has been occurring since 23/08.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram attack and overtake Dalwa. It appears this was done by the same group and the same operation as the excursion into Jibwhiwhui. Fourteen dead between the two towns.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram attack Jibwhiwhui village (and its immediate areas) over two days, killing 14.

Scores of residents of Unity Estate, Igbogbo-Baiyeku Local Council Development Area, LCDA, protested to (or at, not known) the Lagos State House of Assembly over incessant violence against the community by some land grabbers popularly called ""Omo-Onile.""

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram captures Dikwa and Marte town, raising their flag above the cities, with ""very little resistance from military forces."" The initial gunfire caused many of the residences to flee. Casualties not known. The attack occurred during the evening hours.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram reportedly takes over Wulgo. Date(s) unknown, violence unknown.
University of Port Harcourt Teaching Hospital (UPTH) workers protested against the storage in their morgue of the body of a doctor who died of the Ebola Virus Disease (EVD) for fear of outbreak.

Unidentified gunmen attack an army post in a Bauchi suburb. The sources describes the attacks as ""insurgents,"" but does not further attempt to identity the attackers. One soldier reported dead, another injured.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram captures Dikwa and Marte town, raising their flag above the cities, with ""very little resistance from military forces."" The initial gunfire caused many of the residences to flee. Casualties not known. The attack occurred during the evening hours.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: After gaining control of Gamboru from government forces on 25/08 residents report Boko Haram had been tracking residents who had fled the area and killing them. Residents said 42 people have been killed while many others have been abducted - many forcibly conscripted into the military. Dates of the specific killings not known.

Two persons were killed while many others were displaced in Shangev-Ya district of Kwande Local Government Area of Benue State, following a communal clash ""at the weekend"" between Dzev and Mbakyaa communities.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram attack Jibwhiwhui village (and its immediate areas) over two days, killing 14.

Youths believed to be members of a faction of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Isoko South Local Government Area of Delta State forced the shutting down of the Erhioke Flow Station over the politics of the management company.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen attack and kill two police at Magama Gumau station in Toro LGA.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram members reportedly took over Bama town - the second largest town in the state - and hoisted the sects flag, following a gun battle between they and Nigerian soldiers. ""Scores"" killed before soldiers fled the city alongside civilians - thousands displaced. Military sources who spoke to journalists in Maiduguri said the soldiers were able to kill about 70 of the militants and injure about 30 others. Some reports have the death total as high as 130. The number of soldiers and civilians killed are not known. Despite several sources reporting the fall a Bama to Boko Haram, Xinhua and This Day (Lagos) reports the military repelled the attack, the latter describing the battle as Boko Harams ""Waterloo."" It is possible Boko Haram retreated, regrouped, and attacked again. A military airstrike was involved in the battle.
BringBackOurGirls supporters marked the 140 days of the abduction of Chibok schoolgirls in a protest condemning government inaction.
A group of Coca dealers protest at a local Ministry of Agriculture office over a levy directed at them.

During the early hours of the day unidentified gunmen burn a brewery and shoot sporadically. Witnesses place the death total between 50-55, others 18, though official reports hold the total at seven. Wukari is mainly Jukun, and it is believe the origin of the attack is related to the removal of the traditional ruler of the area.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram overtakes Bara without violence. Many residents flee into Cameroon.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill the Chief Magistrate for Enugu South at his home, specific location unknown.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram overtakes Banki during the evening hours without violence. Many residents flee into Cameroon.
55 are reported killed following a Fulani attack on the Nasarawa-Eggon communities of Agbolagu, Kampani and Fadama-Bona.

column7: NANNM: National Association of Nigeria Nurses and Midwives; Health Workers (Nigeria)
column17: The National Association of Nigeria Nurses and Midwives (NANNM) staged a protest over alleged poor working conditions.

column7: NULGE: Nigerian Union of Local Government Employees
column17: Nigeria Union of Local Government Employees, NULGE, Kabba-Bunu branch protest non-payment of salaries.
Six are killed in a Fulani attack on a Eggon settlement. The attack occurred mid-morning. Some sources have the death total as high as 31.
Students demonstrate along Benin-Ore federal highway outside Igouriakhi in protest over poor infrastructure and unpaid salaries of their lecturers.
Members of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Ilorin-west Local Government Area of Kwara State protested the inauguration of a factional party chairman in the area.
Residents of Otuoke protest, forcibly shutting down nearby Federal University. The protesters were angry that the management of the institution denied them employment and admission opportunities.

Residents of Sabo-Oke area of Ilorin, Kwara State attacked workers of the Ibadan Electricity Distribution Company (IBEDC) who went there to disconnect electricity supply over unpaid debts. No reported injuries.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks and overtakes Gulak in the early hours of the day, causing residents to flee. Several residents from surrounding villages also fled. Causality not known.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks and overtakes Duhu, Shuwa Kirshinga and ""other towns"" on the night of 05/09 or the morning of 06/09. Causality numbers not provided.

At least six persons were allegedly killed and five others injured as a result of an attack on Lamba Gyambar community in Wase local government area of Plateau State. The unidentified assailants attacked the community around 11pm shooting sporadically and setting homes ablaze.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks and overtakes Duhu, Shuwa Kirshinga and ""other towns"" on the night of 05/09 or the morning of 06/09. Causality numbers not provided.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks and overtakes Duhu, Shuwa Kirshinga and ""other towns"" on the night of 05/09 or the morning of 06/09. Causality numbers not provided.

A group of members of Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Kwara State staged a protest against the state leadership of the party over alleged imposition of a candidate as the parties chairman in Ilorin West Local Government Area.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces launched an attack on Boko Haram in Kawuri, killing 50 of its members. The attack was pre-emptive, as information was gathered that Boko Haram was planning an attack on nearby Konduga. Following the operation soldiers went on patrols in Konduga.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Michika, ""making strong gains"" in several parts of the city. Boko Haram later claimed they had gained control over the entirety of the city. Causalities not known.

Unknown assailants attack several villages in Gusau LGA including Kofa, Kundubau, Wonaka, Fura Girke, Fegin Mahe, Gangara, Kukar Gandu, Kanawa, Lafiya, Gora, Akuzo, Zamfarawar Girke and Damba Model Primary School. Twenty deaths reported. Conflicting reports as to where the majority of causalities occurred.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: ""Fierce"" fighting between Boko Haram and military forces in Mubi. ""Scores"" of [Boko Haram] killed in the fighting, soldiers reported injuries. Exact date is not known.

Unknown assailants attack several villages in Gusau LGA including Kofa, Kundubau, Wonaka, Fura Girke, Fegin Mahe, Gangara, Kukar Gandu, Kanawa, Lafiya, Gora, Akuzo, Zamfarawar Girke and Damba Model Primary School. Twenty deaths reported. Conflicting reports as to where the majority of causalities occurred.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Twenty members of Boko Haram are killed (some sources claim 21) in an attempt to overtake Buratai and target a military commander. The attack took place during the morning hours. A school building was also razed.

Unknown assailants attack several villages in Gusau LGA including Kofa, Kundubau, Wonaka, Fura Girke, Fegin Mahe, Gangara, Kukar Gandu, Kanawa, Lafiya, Gora, Akuzo, Zamfarawar Girke and Damba Model Primary School. Twenty deaths reported. Conflicting reports as to where the majority of causalities occurred.

Unknown assailants attack several villages in Gusau LGA including Kofa, Kundubau, Wonaka, Fura Girke, Fegin Mahe, Gangara, Kukar Gandu, Kanawa, Lafiya, Gora, Akuzo, Zamfarawar Girke and Damba Model Primary School. Twenty deaths reported. Conflicting reports as to where the majority of causalities occurred.

Unknown assailants attack several villages in Gusau LGA including Kofa, Kundubau, Wonaka, Fura Girke, Fegin Mahe, Gangara, Kukar Gandu, Kanawa, Lafiya, Gora, Akuzo, Zamfarawar Girke and Damba Model Primary School. Twenty deaths reported. Conflicting reports as to where the majority of causalities occurred.

Unknown assailants attack several villages in Gusau LGA including Kofa, Kundubau, Wonaka, Fura Girke, Fegin Mahe, Gangara, Kukar Gandu, Kanawa, Lafiya, Gora, Akuzo, Zamfarawar Girke and Damba Model Primary School. Twenty deaths reported. Conflicting reports as to where the majority of causalities occurred.

Unknown assailants attack several villages in Gusau LGA including Kofa, Kundubau, Wonaka, Fura Girke, Fegin Mahe, Gangara, Kukar Gandu, Kanawa, Lafiya, Gora, Akuzo, Zamfarawar Girke and Damba Model Primary School. Twenty deaths reported. Conflicting reports as to where the majority of causalities occurred.

Unknown assailants attack several villages in Gusau LGA including Kofa, Kundubau, Wonaka, Fura Girke, Fegin Mahe, Gangara, Kukar Gandu, Kanawa, Lafiya, Gora, Akuzo, Zamfarawar Girke and Damba Model Primary School. Twenty deaths reported. Conflicting reports as to where the majority of causalities occurred.

Unknown assailants attack several villages in Gusau LGA including Kofa, Kundubau, Wonaka, Fura Girke, Fegin Mahe, Gangara, Kukar Gandu, Kanawa, Lafiya, Gora, Akuzo, Zamfarawar Girke and Damba Model Primary School. Twenty deaths reported. Conflicting reports as to where the majority of causalities occurred.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Following an assault on Michika by Boko Haram, military forces launch a campaign to liberate the city, which included an air assault. During the battle, one known causality of note was the son of a former politician, all totalling 24. Boko Haram causalities not known - the fighting was reported as ""fierce."" As a result of the attack, the army has moved sensitive weapons from Mubi. Despite an early report the military had retaken the city, it was later learned Boko Haram maintained control of the area.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 08/08 military officials announced they had retaken Bama following a air bombing campaign. The dates of the bombing runs, causalities, and the actual transfer of territory were not reported. Despite the alleged takeover, later reports suggest that many of the villagers have died or are dying of starvation.
Protesters marched in and around Agbor over a missing voter register for the area. The demonstration was peaceful.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Bazza village. Date vague, causalities unknown.

No fewer than six persons sustained various degrees of injuries while about 15 houses were destroyed as youths attacked residents of Ogbetiti/Okeluche village in Ikenga Ogidi community, Idemili North Council Area. The attack is believed to have been motivated over the control of land.
A riotous mob attacked the vigilante group (not identified) guarding the Main Market for allegedly killing a labourer over a SIM Card dispute.
An explosive went off at the Okaka Estate, Yenagoa, Bayelsa State, causing panic among the residents. Although nobody died, one person was reportedly injured.
Staff of Nigeria Export Processing Zones Authority (NEPZA) protested at the organisations headquarters in Abuja over alleged poor welfare.
A group of youth in the Ode-Ugborodo community attack a group of sailors during the early morning hours after ordering them to leave the area. Two injuries reported.
Retirees protest the non-payment of their pensions in Asaba.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: No fewer than 75 members of Boko Haram have reportedly been killed by local hunters in Michika and Madagali local government areas of Adamawa state. Date(s) unknown.
Retirees of the Power Holding Company of Nigeria (PHCN), protested in Lagos against the non-payment of their accumulated pension benefits.
BringBackOurGirls supporters protest in Abuja for the removal of presidential aids.

column7: Former Military Forces of Nigeria; Police Forces of Nigeria (1999-2015)
column17: Retired military personnel protest over irregular pension payments in Abuja.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: No fewer than 75 members of Boko Haram have reportedly been killed by local hunters in Michika and Madagali local government areas of Adamawa state. Date(s) unknown.
Retired soldiers, numbering 100, protested in Benin City over the non-payment of pensions. The group threatened guerrilla warfare if their demands were not met.
Workers of the Federal Polytechnic, Ado Ekiti, have staged a protest and called for the removal of the Rector of the institution after several employees salaries had been cut.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram launches a ""massive"" attack on Konduga, 35km from Maiduguri, causing a three-hour battle with military forces. Reports indicate Boko Haram suffered heavy causalities before fleeing. Military forces captured several pieces of heavy equipment and weapons from the attackers. Xinhua places the death number of Boko Haram at 100, others place it as high as 120. Later reports suggest the causality total with as high as 250, with four injured military. A air force jet was downed during the operation - the pilot was later captured by Boko Haram, who nearly a month later released a video of his beheading.

column7: PENGASSAN: Petroleum and Natural Gas Senior Staff Association of Nigeria
column17: PENGASSAN workers strike and protest at the Group Managing Director office in Abuja.
Anglican Church leaders and petitioners protest the destruction of their church building.
Protesting students of Federal Polytechnic clash with police over power outages. Causalities, injuries not known.

Young people believed to be students of the Federal Polytechnic, Ado-Ekiti, went on rampage as they protested power outage in Erifun community where many students of the institution are known to reside. The protesting students stoned the vehicle of legal luminary and also attempted to vandalise one of the hostels in Afe Babalola University. The violent protest also carried over into nearby Erifun.
Fulani gunmen attack Mbar in Bokkos LGA killing five with machetes. The attack occurred during midday.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram abducts a group of 50 women and children from Gulak. ""[Boko Haram] started loading our women and children into their vehicles, threatening to shoot whoever disobeyed them. Everybody was scared,"" a witness stated. The date of the attack was not included in the report, but is likely to have occurred on 13/09 or 14/09.

No fewer than twenty persons have been feared dead and scores of others injured when Fulani herdsmen allegedly invaded Tunari village in Wukari Local Government of Taraba State. The attackers were said to have stormed the village at 10 am and set houses ablaze while most residents were attending a church service.

Students of Lagos State University (LASU) External System stormed the Governors Office, Alausa, Ikeja, in protest over various complaints, including high fees, extended academic calendar, delayed issuance of results, among others.
11,000 aggrieved pensioners of Power Holding Company of Nigeria (PHCN) embarked on peaceful protest to demand payment of their entitlements.
A group of ex-militants protest in Bomadi over the proposed creation of a lopsided number of polling units in their area campared to other areas of the country.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two Boko Haram commanders and 15 of their fighters are killed in a pair of clashes with military forces in Baaza and Michika.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two Boko Haram commanders and 15 of their fighters are killed in a pair of clashes with military forces in Baaza and Michika.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram again attempts to overtake Konduga. Military forces retaliate, killing an estimated 100. The battle is believed to have lasted over twelve hours.
30 women in the Watt Market, Calabar protest at the Cross River house assembly over what they describe as double taxation by the state government.

A group of villagers attempt to lynch a Nigerien national on the suspicion of involvement in an alleged ritual murder of a young girl. The police intervened, however, drawing ire from the larger community, many of whom later attacked the police station. Four rioters were killed when the police launched a defence, 89 arrested.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces fight through a Boko Haram ambush, capture a senior leader, identity unknown. One soldier was reported dead after the battle.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Following an extensive battle the previous day, Boko Haram again returns to Konduga (presumably to retrieve their dead) and is engaged into another battle. Sixty reported Boko Haram deaths, military forces wound and kill a notable commander, later revealed to be Abubakar Shekau, though Shekau may have been captured in nearby Benisheikh. A matter of dispute: some believe this may have been a been a body double. It was gathered that when the militants discovered that Konduga was a no go area, they headed to nearby Benisheikh and laid ambush for troops on patrol duties.

A group of villagers attempt to lynch a Nigerien national on the suspicion of involvement in an alleged ritual murder of a young girl. The police intervened, however, drawing ire from the larger community, many of whom later attacked the police station. Four rioters were killed (some sources claim eight) when the police launched a defence, 89 arrested.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attempts to take over the Kano-Maiduguri highway in Ngamdu, and are dramatically pushed back by military forces who report to have killed 150 or more in the ensuing battle.
Trader protest levies at Eke-Awka market.
Various groups protest a ban on Okada-motorcycle business in the area.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram kill the Governor of Adamawas uncle during a raid on his Madagali residence. The attack was an apparent targeted assassination. Following the attack it was reported a Boko Haram commander was residing in the residence.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two suicide bombers and a gunmen enter a university campus, kill 15. Boko Haram was later blamed for the attack. Among the dead were the two suicide bombers.

Fulani gunmen ambush a group of soldiers on a patrol between Fadan Karshi (Fadan Kaibi) to Karshi Daji. One soldier killed, four injured. The gunmen split into three groups, one continuing into Fadan Kaibi, where they killed 12 villiagers, burnt down 20 houses and injured scores. Another group (or the same, later) went to Karshi Daji, killed 20 people and burnt down several houses. The third group attacked Unguwan Ganye, though casualties are not known.

Fulani gunmen ambush a group of soldiers on a patrol between Fadan Karshi (Fadan Kaibi) to Karshi Daji. One soldier killed, four injured. The gunmen split into three groups, one continuing into Fadan Kaibi, where they killed 12 villiagers, burnt down 20 houses and injured scores. Another group (or the same, later) went to Karshi Daji, killed 20 people and burnt down several houses. The third group attacked Unguwan Ganye, though casualties are not known.

Fulani gunmen ambush a group of soldiers on a patrol between Fadan Karshi (Fadan Kaibi) to Karshi Daji. One soldier killed, four injured. The gunmen split into three groups, one continuing into Fadan Kaibi, where they killed 12 villiagers, burnt down 20 houses and injured scores. Another group (or the same, later) went to Karshi Daji, killed 20 people and burnt down several houses. The third group attacked Unguwan Ganye, though casualties are not known.

Fulani gunmen ambush a group of soldiers on a patrol between Fadan Karshi (Fadan Kaibi) to Karshi Daji. One soldier killed, four injured. The gunmen split into three groups, one continuing into Fadan Kaibi, where they killed 12 villiagers, burnt down 20 houses and injured scores. Another group (or the same, later) went to Karshi Daji, killed 20 people and burnt down several houses. The third group attacked Unguwan Ganye, though casualties are not known.
Police open fire and kill two vigilantes as they attempted to lynch a group of suspected armed robbers.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Fighters from Boko Haram stormed the northeastern town of Mainok, attacking civilians, sparking a gun battle that killed at least 36 people and continued into the following day. Among the dead were civilians.
Gunmen wearing military uniforms attack Tadabale village, kill two people and steal cattle.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Fighters from Boko Haram stormed the northeastern town of Mainok, attacking civilians, sparking a gun battle that killed at least 36 people and continued into the following day. Among the dead were civilians.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Dressed as customers, suspected Boko Haram attack a market in Monguno, killing 9 and injuring 10. The attack occurred ""at the weekend.""
A vigilante group lynches three suspected kidnappers.

Unidentified gunmen attack a Kogi police station at Adogo, stealing weapons and a armoured vehicle. No causalities or injuries reported. Police later reported the attack had been foiled by their forces.
