A group of women throw mud and stones at the convoy of Governor Yero at Fadan Karshi (Kaibi). The group was upset the governor had not visited their town following a series of recent attacks.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Agreement: Ten Boko Haram commanders surrender to military forces at Kawuri. Their capitulation comes days following reports Abubakar Shekau was found KIA.

Urhobo youths, under the aegis of Coalition of Urhobo Youth Organisation, CUYO staged a peaceful protest at the Delta State Government House against what they described as the victimisation of Urhobo candidates who applied for the position Vice Chancellor of the Delta State University.
A group of Eggon youth attack a Nasarawa Eggon village and burned a house belonging to a relative of the state chairman, who may have been Fulani - motivation not known. Injuries not reported.
Players of a Kaduna-based football team protest the government over non-payment of salaries.
Disengaged workers of the defunct Power Holding Company of Nigeria (PHCN) in Kano staged a peaceful protest over the non-payment of their entitlements by the Federal Government.
Ten Eggon people were killed when a large number of Fulani gunmen invaded the Gidan Gambo settlement of Lafia-East. The attack may be related to a Eggon-led attack on a village in the area.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 23 September 2014, military forces and a local armed group arrested between 50 - 150 fleeing members of Boko Haram in Biu (Biu, Borno). The group is believe to have fled from fighting in Konduga last week.
Supporters of Ekiti State governor-elect, Ayo Fayose staged a peaceful protest against a potential court ruling that would potentially truncate his authority as governor.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Some suspected members of the Boko Haram sect attacked Shaffa and Shindiffu villages killing a pastor and a teacher at Government Girls Secondary School Shaffa as well as 18 others, mostly Christians. The group also burned several churches in the two day attack. Following their attack on Shindiffu, military forces caught up with the attackers, killing most of them, numbers unknown.

column7: RTEAN: Road Transport Employers Association of Nigeria
column17: Over one hundred zonal chairmen of Lagos State branch of RTEAN stormed the national headquarters of the association in Abuja, protesting what they called an attempt to impose a candidate by the state government as their chairman. The date of the protest is vague - it may have occurred on 25/09.

Supporters of Ekiti State governor-elect, Ayo Fayose staged a peaceful protest at the Ado Ekiti High Court, against the trial of the governor-elect on his eligibility to contest the June 21 governorship election. This was the second such protest in Ado-Ekiti in as many days.

column7: SKIPFO: Southern Kaduna Indigenes Progressive Forum
column17: Members of the Southern Kaduna Indigenes Progressive Forum protest the presence of Governor Yero at Fadan Karshi (Kaibi), accusing the governor of neglect following an attack on the village. The protest comes days following a similar protest in the area.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: More than 40 Boko Haram insurgents have been killed in three locations of Borno State in battles with military forces. Eleven soldiers were also reportedly killed in the battles. Date(s) vague - the source claims the clashes occurred between 25/09 and 26/09.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: More than 40 Boko Haram insurgents have been killed in three locations of Borno State in battles with military forces. Eleven soldiers were also reportedly killed in the battles. Date(s) vague - the source claims the clashes occurred between 25/09 and 26/09.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: More than 40 Boko Haram insurgents have been killed in three locations of Borno State in battles with military forces. Eleven soldiers were also reportedly killed in the battles. Date(s) vague - the source claims the clashes occurred between 25/09 and 26/09.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Some suspected members of the Boko Haram sect attacked Shaffa and Shindiffu villages killing a pastor and a teacher at Government Girls Secondary School Shaffa as well as 18 others, mostly Christians. The group also burned several churches in the two day attack. Following their attack on Shindiffu, military forces caught up with the attackers, killing most of them, numbers unknown.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Some suspected members of the Boko Haram sect attacked Shaffa and Shindiffu villages killing a pastor and a teacher at Government Girls Secondary School Shaffa as well as 18 others, mostly Christians. The group also burned several churches in the two day attack. Following their attack on Shindiffu, military forces caught up with the attackers, killing most of them, numbers unknown.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Some suspected members of the Boko Haram sect attacked Shaffa and Shindiffu villages killing a pastor and a teacher at Government Girls Secondary School Shaffa as well as 18 others, mostly Christians. The group also burned several churches in the two day attack. Following their attack on Shindiffu, military forces caught up with the attackers, killing most of them, numbers unknown.
A leading supporter of the PDP Ekiti State Governor-elect is assassinated in an Ado-Ekiti hotel by unidentified gunmen.
Two factions of the PDP clash over a leadership position at the capital building in Awka. Injuries unknown, though the source described the fight as a ""melee.""

One person was killed while about 1,200 others were displaced in Etteh Community in Olamaboro Local Government Area of Kogi State, following attack by unidentified gunmen suspected to be from Enugu State.
The village head of Ungwan Muazu in Zazzau Emirate Council is killed by unknown men in Nariya, Kabala West area of Kaduna.

Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen attacked the Tse Shima, Mbatsoho community of Mballagh council ward in Makurdi local government area of Benue State, raping women and killing four persons. The armed herdsmen also destroyed farmlands, just as scores were declared missing. The incident occurred at about 3pm when the villagers had gone to their farms.

Gunmen suspected to be Fulani herdsmen attacked the Tse Shima, Mbatsoho community of Mballagh council ward in Makurdi local government area of Benue State, raping women and killing four persons. The armed herdsmen also destroyed farmlands, just as scores were declared missing. The incident occurred at about 3pm when the villagers had gone to their farms.

A clash between a Muslim group (the KMS) and traditionalists worshipers (likely Igbo) caused severe injuries of a Ogundeji, a traditionalist, who was beaten and burnt. The tension began when the KMS began a nearby counter-festival to that of the annual traditionalist Egungun Festival, which was already occurring.

No fewer than three persons were injured following students violent protest that crippled activities at the Uyo campus of the Akwa Ibom State Polytechnic. The students were protesting against a management decision not allow a student union on the campus.
A group protests after a court adjourned judgment on a suit challenging the ban on hijab in public primary and secondary schools in Lagos State till mid October.

No fewer than four persons were injured following violent students protest that crippled administrative and academic activities at the Campus of the Akwa Ibom State Polytechnic at Ikot Osura (Ikot Esurua). The students were protesting the schools policy toward the student union.

column7: RTEAN: Road Transport Employers Association of Nigeria
column17: RTEAN members protest at their headquarters over the imposition of a candidate.
A group of truckers protest an alleged assault of a fellow driver by soldiers at a traffic stop.
Injuries and destruction of property during a melee between motorcyclists and traders after a rider allegedly struck a woman.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: No fewer than 540 houses were completely destroyed in the villages of Kubi and Watu in Michika Local Government Area of Adamawa State by members of the Boko Haram sect in a fresh attack. ""Scores"" speculated killed, though no numbers were provided. The eyewitness lamented that many of those killed were trapped in their homes, resulting in their being burnt to death.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: No fewer than 540 houses were completely destroyed in the villages of Kubi and Watu in Michika Local Government Area of Adamawa State by members of the Boko Haram sect in a fresh attack. ""Scores"" speculated killed, though no numbers were provided. The eyewitness lamented that many of those killed were trapped in their homes, resulting in their being burnt to death.
Unemployed youth gather in Warri to protest high unemployment. The march was organized under the Youth Democratic Alliance International.

column7: CAMON: Citizens Arise Movement of Nigeria
column17: Over 500 protesters under the aegis of Citizens Arise Movement of Nigeria (CAMON) staged a protest at the Eagle Square in Abuja to register their displeasure over the alleged insensitivity of the federal government to the plight of the missing Chibok girls. The protest was led by notable civil rights campaigner Dino Melaye.
A group of oil workers protest over 21 months of unpaid salaries at the state house assembly building in Owerri. Protesters held a twin protest in Ohaji, where the company is located.

A group of oil workers protest over 21 months of unpaid salaries. Their company is located at Ohaji in Ohaji/Egbema Local Government Area of Imo State. The protesters also visited the Imo State House of Assembly in Owerri.
Gunman, suspected to be Fulani, attack the villages of Lwa, Dum, Rachit and Dyang in Riyom. One soldier, 12 civilians reportedly killed.

Over 100 youths working for a Chinese company, Linda Manufacturing Company at Agege protested to Lagos State House of Assembly over the death of their colleague. The protesting workers alleged he was denied medical treatment after he complained of stomach pain.

Fulani gunmen attack the Berom villages of Lwa, Dum, Rachit, Dyang, Sharbutu, Rachi, Diyan, Rakweng, Chengye, Fang, Rim and Shonong in Riyom over ten consecutive days (2/10 - 11/10). Several killed (varying reports), 80 houses razed over the course of the ten days. It is not clear which villages were attacked on which date(s), with the exception of Rim and Shonong which are known to have been attacked on 09/10.
Unidentified gunmen kidnap the brother of the monarch of the of Kolokuma Kingdom, their demands not known.

One is dead and several others injured in a clash between student protesters of a security guards at their university. The clash began after the demonstrators had gathered to protest an alleged assault of a fellow students at the hands of security personnel the previous day. The school was later closed indefinitely due to the violence.

Fulani gunmen attack the Berom villages of Lwa, Dum, Rachit, Dyang, Sharbutu, Rachi, Diyan, Rakweng, Chengye, Fang, Rim and Shonong in Riyom over ten consecutive days (2/10 - 11/10). Several killed (varying reports), 80 houses razed over the course of the ten days. It is not clear which villages were attacked on which date(s), with the exception of Rim and Shonong which are known to have been attacked on 09/10.

Suspected Fulani mercenaries invaded Ome community in Obi, shooting sporadically and destroying houses. Despite the destruction of the town, no deaths were reported. It is thought the shooting was to merely frighten the residents into fleeing.
Fulani gunmen attack three teen-aged girls in Zongo, killing two and severely injuring this third. The girls were from the Makurdi area.

Fulani gunmen attack the Berom villages of Lwa, Dum, Rachit, Dyang, Sharbutu, Rachi, Diyan, Rakweng, Chengye, Fang, Rim and Shonong in Riyom over ten consecutive days (2/10 - 11/10). Several killed (varying reports), 80 houses razed over the course of the ten days. It is not clear which villages were attacked on which date(s), with the exception of Rim and Shonong which are known to have been attacked on 09/10.

Fulani gunmen attack the Berom villages of Lwa, Dum, Rachit, Dyang, Sharbutu, Rachi, Diyan, Rakweng, Chengye, Fang, Rim and Shonong in Riyom over ten consecutive days (2/10 - 11/10). Several killed (varying reports), 80 houses razed over the course of the ten days. It is not clear which villages were attacked on which date(s), with the exception of Rim and Shonong which are known to have been attacked on 09/10.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces attack and liberate Michika and Gulak, both under Boko Haram control since 07/09. 22 reported deaths between the two villages. Once liberated, military forces reported that several churches had been destroyed in the two towns while the town was in Boko Haram control.

Gunmen kidnap a 80-year old monarch, the Waziri of Jajere, Hussaini Biriri, on the night of 10/06 - 11:00 p.m. in Biriri town of Tarmuwa Local Council of the state. The demands of the abductors are not known.
Twelve unidentified gunmen attack and kill two members of a security detail at the University of Jos before escaping.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Mobbar village, killing ""several village [leaders]."" No specific numbers provided.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Ngamdu village, beheading at least seven prominent businessmen. ""They did not attack everyone in Ngamdu; they just selected some top business merchants there and killed them in the early hours of today (Monday)"", said a witness.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram fighters killed at least 70 soldiers in a fierce battle between they and Nigerian troops for control of the towns of Bazza and Vimtim in Adamawa State. Nigerian forces report they have killed more than 300 Boko Haram fighters during the battle, though this number was not confirmed at the time of the report. It is not clear if military forces gained control of the village at the end of the fighting, though it was learned that many of the towns churches were destroyed during the time of Boko Haram control.

Fulani gunmen attack the Berom villages of Lwa, Dum, Rachit, Dyang, Sharbutu, Rachi, Diyan, Rakweng, Chengye, Fang, Rim and Shonong in Riyom over ten consecutive days (2/10 - 11/10). Several killed (varying reports), 80 houses razed over the course of the ten days. It is not clear which villages were attacked on which date(s), with the exception of Rim and Shonong which are known to have been attacked on 09/10.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces attack and liberate Michika and Gulak, both under Boko Haram control since 07/09. 22 reported deaths between the two villages.

Fulani gunmen attack the Berom villages of Lwa, Dum, Rachit, Dyang, Sharbutu, Rachi, Diyan, Rakweng, Chengye, Fang, Rim and Shonong in Riyom over ten consecutive days (2/10 - 11/10). Several killed (varying reports), 80 houses razed over the course of the ten days. It is not clear which villages were attacked on which date(s), with the exception of Rim and Shonong which are known to have been attacked on 09/10.
Unidentified gunmen attack and severely injure a PDP lawmaker. The motive may be related to the lawmakers recent defection from the APC to the PDP.

Fulani gunmen attack the Berom villages of Lwa, Dum, Rachit, Dyang, Sharbutu, Rachi, Diyan, Rakweng, Chengye, Fang, Rim and Shonong in Riyom over ten consecutive days (2/10 - 11/10). Several killed (varying reports), 80 houses razed over the course of the ten days. It is not clear which villages were attacked on which date(s), with the exception of Rim and Shonong which are known to have been attacked on 09/10.

Protesters stormed the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) office in Abuja calling for the removal of Akwa Ibom State chairman of the party. It is not clear if the protesters were fellow members of the PDP, as supporters of the chairman called the demonstrators a ""rented crowd.""

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces engaged Boko Haram at in Bulabulin Ngaura village ""last week"" (report dated 12/10) reporting ""huge successes."" A ""competent source"" reports a high number of causalities on behalf of Boko Haram.

Fulani gunmen attack the Berom villages of Lwa, Dum, Rachit, Dyang, Sharbutu, Rachi, Diyan, Rakweng, Chengye, Fang, Rim and Shonong in Riyom over ten consecutive days (2/10 - 11/10). Several killed (varying reports), 80 houses razed over the course of the ten days. It is not clear which villages were attacked on which date(s), with the exception of Rim and Shonong which are known to have been attacked on 09/10.

One person is feared dead and three others seriously injured following a bloody clash between two rival policing forces, each asserting their authority to distribute tickets and other fines to street traders. Police and soldiers dispersed the two groups with teargas.
Limousine and taxi cab operators protest at Lagos Airport over their removal from the park allotted to them at the international wing.

Fulani gunmen attack the Berom villages of Lwa, Dum, Rachit, Dyang, Sharbutu, Rachi, Diyan, Rakweng, Chengye, Fang, Rim and Shonong in Riyom over ten consecutive days (2/10 - 11/10). 26 killed, 80 houses razed over the course of the ten days. It is not clear which villages were attacked on which date(s), with the exception of Rim and Shonong which are known to have been attacked on 09/10. Later reports suggest 27 were killed in the area by the attackers on 09/10 (The Nation).
Youths under the aegis of ACT staged a protest against a registration fee introduced by the National Youth Service Corps (NYSC) for prospective members.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed the Secretary of Bayelsa State Independent Electoral Commission (BYSIEC). It was gathered that his assailants shot him on the head as he alighted from his car near his residence, off Otiotio Road at about 10.pm.
A prison riot kills ""scores"" and injured 12 when police respond. The riot, which began as a protest over the confiscation of an inmates cooling fan.

Fulani gunmen attack the Berom villages of Lwa, Dum, Rachit, Dyang, Sharbutu, Rachi, Diyan, Rakweng, Chengye, Fang, Rim and Shonong in Riyom over ten consecutive days (2/10 - 11/10). Several killed (varying reports), 80 houses razed over the course of the ten days. It is not clear which villages were attacked on which date(s), with the exception of Rim and Shonong which are known to have been attacked on 09/10.
A group of ex-Ogun State political appointees protest the non-payment of pensions.

Fulani gunmen attack the Berom villages of Lwa, Dum, Rachit, Dyang, Sharbutu, Rachi, Diyan, Rakweng, Chengye, Fang, Rim and Shonong in Riyom over ten consecutive days (2/10 - 11/10). Several killed (varying reports), 80 houses razed over the course of the ten days. It is not clear which villages were attacked on which date(s), with the exception of Rim and Shonong which are known to have been attacked on 09/10 - - Shonong is attacked again on 11/10 causing six deaths.
Soldiers Saturday night stormed Durumi settlement area in Abuja where they shot three Gwaza refugees while arresting others. The reason for the raid is not clear.

Ahead of the opening of Delta State's Revenue House in Warri on 14/10, hundreds of indigenes of Okere Urhobo Kingdom, stormed the premises , protesting alleged refusal of the chairman to grant them audience on employment and other community relations matters.

Unknown gunmen in Anguwan Mallam area of Obi Local Government in Nasarawa State reportedly killed three persons after ambushing a passenger bus travelling from Alushi. A police officer was also wounded in the attack and is now missing. It is not clear if the officer a target of the attackers, or a bystander. Some locals suspect the perpetrators to be Eggon youths, but this is still left to be determined.

Scores of lecturers from the Adeniran Ogunsanya College of Education (AOCOED), Ijanikin, staged a protest to the State House, Alausa, over what they termed as failure of the Lagos State Government to remit over 17 months deducted funds to their pension accounts and non-payment of retirees benefits for three years.
Bring Back Our Girls supports hold a protest in Abuja to mark the 6-month anniversary of the Chibok abduction.

column7: APGA: All Progressives Grand Alliance Party
column17: Over 5,000 members of the All Progressives Grand Alliance (APGA) from 21 Local Government Areas in Anambra State gathered Nnewi, to protest the defection of former State Governor to another political party.

Unidentified armed youth attack a truck carrying ""cattle and humans"" near the government house in Lafia. Government forces respond, beginning the 30 minute gun battle. Two killed, five injured, many others fled.

On 14 October 2014, an armed clash between Fulani gunmen and a local armed group at Kankara market (Kankara, Katsina) caused five deaths and scores of injuries. Following the battle, the local armed group launched a patrol to find any remaining Fulanis in the area.

A group known as the Delta State League of Online Registration Agents, protested their members withdrawal as online registration agents by the Joint Admissions and Matriculation Board (JAMB), believe the removal ""arbitrary."" The group protests at the JAMB officer and later at the Delta State house assembly building.

Thousands of Christians, members of various church denominations protest in Ilorin early hours of the morning to protest the taking over of their schools by Kwara state government, demanding that they want their schools back in their control. The school takeover is related to the areas Ebola outbreak.
Members of CAN protest against the planned disinvestment of a cement manufacturing facility by the Benue State government, believing the state economy would be harmed.

An unnamed private security officer attached to the Jos University Teaching Hospital (JUTH) was shot dead by unknown gunmen. The gunmen stormed the hospital at about 12:30a.m and were about forcing their way into the premises but were stopped by the security men for routine stop and search exercise before being allowed in.
Ten are injured in a clash between two PDP factions in Lafia. The clash stemmed from a disagreement of who should represent the party in an upcoming election.

The Nigerian Human Rights Community (NHRC) staged a protest against what it called the rising wave of unemployment and hunger in the country. The protest began at the Ikeja Under-bridge at about 10am, and ended at the Lagos State Government House.

Supports of the APC protest the arrest of several fellow APC lawmakers of the Edo State house after it was alleged they had forged signatures of their PDP colleagues. The protesters called the arrests part of a PDP ""witch hunt"".
Nursing students protest the state of non-accreditation of their school.

Members of the APM protest the second term bid of the lawmaker representing Aba North and South in the House of Representatives, believing the lawmaker had served long enough and did not property represent their constituency properly.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Agreement: The government of Nigeria claims they have reached a ceasefire agreement which would allow for the release of the Chibok girls. Despite these the security spokesman of the Nigerian government said that no deal had yet been reached on releasing the girls.
The people of Nchanawa village in Ezzeagu protest the revocation of a portion of their land by the Enugu State Government.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram gunmen attack a Lake Chad community in Abadam LGA, killing 10.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Madagali and Michika killing three residents between the two towns. The assaults are believed to be part of a larger operation in the area, which also included Sina over two days.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram abducts 60 following an attack on Waga Mangoro and Garta villages in Madagali Local Government Area. 40 women were said to have been abducted from Waga Mangoro, 20 were forcibly uprooted from their homes in Garta. No reported dead.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram abducts 60 following an attack on Waga Mangoro and Garta villages in Madagali Local Government Area. 40 women were said to have been abducted from Waga Mangoro, 20 were forcibly uprooted from their homes in Garta. No reported dead.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram launch an attack against Shaffa (some sources report Dzur) in Hawul, kill eight.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Sina over two consecutive days, killing two and burning property. This is believed to be part of a larger attack on the Michika and Madagali area of Adamawa over the weekend, which claimed the lives of five total.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Madagali and Michika killing three residents between the two towns. The assaults are believed to be part of a larger operation in the area, which also included Sina over two days.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Sina over two consecutive days, killing two and burning property. This is believed to be part of a larger attack on the Michika and Madagali area of Adamawa over the weekend, which claimed the lives of five total.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: At least 25 members of the Boko Haram sect died in a shoot-out with soldiers at Damboa town in Borno State [northeastern Nigeria] on Sunday evening [19 October] as the insurgents attacked the area, breaking a reported ceasefire.

Suspected Fulani-Hausa gunmen killed at least 25 people in an attack on Sondi and Gindin Waya villages in Wukari LGA of Taraba State. The village is majority Christian, and the victims included at least two church leaders. Some reports declare at least 30 dead.

Suspected Fulani-Hausa gunmen killed at least 25 people in an attack on Sondi and Gindin Waya villages in Wukari LGA of Taraba State. The village is majority Christian, and the victims included at least two church leaders. Some reports declare at least 30 dead.
A factional leader of the Fulani community in Bwari Area Council was killed by unidentified armed men after they besieged his home around Barangoni community at the outskirts of Bwari town.
Personnel of the Ministry of Information stage a protest at the entrance to the Radio House over alleged maladministration and embezzlement during the tenure of the Secretary.
Youth suspected to support different local factions withi the APC clash in Ilaro at a political rally. One death reported.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacked a group of military forces travelling along the Maiduguri-Biu highway, not far from Damboa. One soldier reported dead. The attack is believed to be a retaliation for an earlier attack in Damboa.
No fewer than 15 people dead in suspected Fulani attack on Kompany village in Lafia East Local Government Area of Nasarawa State. The attack occurred around 2am.
The women's wing of All Progressives Congress protest the non-release of the Chibok girls by Boko Haram,

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram detonates an explosive at a motor park bus station in Azare, killing five persons and injuring several others, may critically. Some reports claim 10-15 deaths.

Villagers protested an attempt by a land speculator to take their communal land. One is reportedly dead after a police officer fired a weapon in error. Date not known. Source dated 30/10 cites ""last week.""
Sapele branch of Nigeria Bar Association in Delta State stormed major streets in the city, protesting the kidnap of one of their colleagues on 19/10.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: About 30 people comprising teenagers, adult males and females were reportedly abducted by suspected Boko Haram gunmen in villages around Mafa. Additionally, 17 were killed in the attack. It is believed the men and boys were abducted in an effort of forced conscription into their fighting forces.
Staff of the Adeniran Ogunsanya College of Education (AOCOED), Ijanikin, Lagos protest the non-implementation of their demands by the state government and the college management.
A group of protesting merchants attack a group of tax collectors Onitsha, causing a melee, 50 injured.

column7: COEASU: Colleges of Education Academic Staff Union
column17: Members of COEASU, Senior Staff Union and Non-academic Staff Union engaged in protest. The workers are protesting non-payment of wages, non-remittance of pensions and cooperative fund, and poor funding of the institution.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram members invaded Pelachiroma village in Hawul council, killing four persons, stealing animals and torching several churches and houses.
Protest broke out in some centres especially in Delta South and Central Senatorial Districts over alleged disappearance of result sheets from the election materials. Exact locations not known.
Hundreds of supporters of Ekiti State Governor (PDP) trooped to the streets to protest alleged plan by members of the state House of Assembly to impeach the governor.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Ndongo village, near Mafa, killing ""many"" people. Mafa had recently been the victim of a Boko Haram abduction raid.
A lecturer at the Taraba College of Education (COE) Zing, was burnt to death in a mob action after he allegedly hit and killed five primary school pupils with a vehicle he was driving.
Military forces shoot six, kill two when residents not complying with an environmental order refuse arrest.
Ten are injured and twenty cars destroyed after prominent chief allegedly sent ""thugs"" to disrupt an election ballot inspection.

A suspected burglar was in the early hours of killed by a mob after he was allegedly caught carting away bottles of wine and alcoholic beverages from the shop he and his accomplices burgled. The victim was still alive when he was taken to hospital.
A PDP candidate for Nasarawa governor is abducted from his home several hours after he and two others were attacked by fellow PDP members who were displeased with his candidacy.

PDP Eggon youths violently protest their parties nomination for a governorship seat outside the palace of the local Eggon ruler. Many of the youths lit fires and forcibly pushed themselves through the gate of the palace. Anti-riot soldiers dispersed the crowd. The governorship contenders were unhurt, though one was kidnapped by unidentified armed men several hours later.

Staffers of Adeniran Ogunsanya College of Education (AOCOED) stormed Lagos State Secretariat and the office of the state Governor to protest against alleged ""anomalies"" in the institution, which included the non-payment of pensions.
Medical students at Kaduna State University protest the non-accreditation of their faculty.

column7: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column17: Members of the NURTW protest after a commercial bus driver dies after being assaulted by a mob of LASTMA official while on the job - apparently, their request for an extortion payment had been refused. Several automobile were destroyed during the protest. Police forces dispersed the crowd. No injuries reported.
PDP factions clash at the parties secretariat in Jos over the nomination of candidates. No injuries reported.
A group of patients who were denied candidacy for treatment at the specialist hospital protest.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Gunmen suspected to be Boko Haram invaded Kukawa town setting ablaze the Kukawa police station, government lodge and other public buildings in the town and over 250 vehicles. A resident of the town said the insurgents stormed the town in several Hilux vehicles and motorcycles and moved straight to the police station and started shooting sporadically targeting residents, using Rocket Propelled Launchers and AK47 rifles. Causalities reported (""many""), numbers not known.
""Thugs"" stormed an APC venue and began assaulting observers and delegates, causing many to flee.

column9: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column17: A mob of LASTMA beat up and pushed NURTW a conductor to death after he refused an extortion payment. In turn NURTW members riot in anger.
Protesters in Calabar protest a roads dilapidated state.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram launches a large attack over two days on Mubi, eventually killing 200+ and taking over the village on the second day.

At least two people were killed in what indigenes say is a land dispute clash between Iregwe and Rukuba speaking nationals of Bassa Local Government Area of northern Plateau state, exact location not known.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram fighters launched a major attack in Adamawa State, capturing the commercial town of Mubi, where they killed many people (later reported as 200 dead over two days) and released inmates from a prison. Many military forces had fled the area prior to the attack, leaving only a few, who were quickly overrun. Causality specifics not known. Boko Haram militants have also hoisted the sects flag and imposed a curfew in Mubi.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: In a coordinated effort to overtake Mubi, Boko Haram also captures Mararaba Hildi and the entirety of Borno States Uba LGA. No reported violence in the latter two.
Rioting youths besiege a police station to protest the killing of a protester last week in Ndikpa. The protesters demanded compensation for their loss. No reported violence.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: In a coordinated effort to overtake Mubi, Boko Haram also captures Mararaba Hildi and the entirety of Borno States Uba LGA. Boko Haram reportedly kill 5 civilians in Uba.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Artillery fire reported in Gaya during a Boko Haram sacking of nearby Mubi, which Boko Haram overtook. Causalities/injuries not known.
Edo State workers under the Coalition of Unions of Edo State Owned Tertiary Institutions took to the streets to protest non- payment of their five months salaries and poor condition of service.
One person is dead and two are in a coma after two factions of the PDP clashed during a disagreement as who were to make list of the delegates.
Students of National Open University demonstrated at one of their study centres over poor internet connectivity.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram overruns and captures Vimtim, near Bazza. Causalities not known. Vimtim is the home town of the Chief of Defence Staff, but it is not clear if Boko Harams effort coincidental.
Following a clash between two groups of NURTW in Ibadan, a group protests, asking demanding to be removed from the union.

column7: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column9: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column17: Two groups of the NURTW clash in the Ekefa area of Ibadan over fees. No casualties, several injuries. The clash sparked a protest from another group who wanted to be removed from the union.

Boat drivers under the Maritime Workers Union protest in several areas along the coast of Bayelsa State, including Brass town, and along the waterways and coastline of Nembe, Southern Ijaw and Ekeremor local government councils. The group was protesting against increased pirate activity in the region.

More than 30 people died and many got injured on Friday morning when a bomb went off at a popular motor park in Gombe. Perpetrators not known, though three were captured by police as they attempted to flee.
Unidentified arsonists set the PDP party secretariat alight in Port Harcourt. No injuries reported.

Boat drivers under the Maritime Workers Union protest in several areas along the coast of Bayelsa State, including Brass town, and along the waterways and coastline of Nembe, Southern Ijaw and Ekeremor local government councils. The group was protesting against increased pirate activity in the region.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces and the ""Civilian JTF"" kill 41 members of Boko Haram in a gun battle in Gur. One members of Boko Haram was captured alive. Following the battle soldiers severed the heads of the deceased Boko Haram combatants.

Boat drivers under the Maritime Workers Union protest in several areas along the coast of Bayelsa State, including Brass town, and along the waterways and coastline of Nembe, Southern Ijaw and Ekeremor local government councils. The group was protesting against increased pirate activity in the region.

Boat drivers under the Maritime Workers Union protest in several areas along the coast of Bayelsa State, including Brass town, and along the waterways and coastline of Nembe, Southern Ijaw and Ekeremor local government councils. The group was protesting against increased pirate activity in the region.
Fulani raiders kill a man, kidnap two women and three boys in Umuachi-Afor.

Boko Haram (actor not confirmed) attacks a prison in Koton Karifi, overpowers security forces and frees 145 inmates. Two deaths reported, both security forces. Several fugitives were recovered by police in the following days.
Residents of Tambuwal and Kebbe local government areas protested the withdrawal of the security aides of the Speaker of House of Representatives.
A group of widows protest the impeachment of a female local council boss.
The Federal Polytechnic , Ado Ekiti, was shut down following a protest staged by students against a hike in tuition fees payable in the institution.

Victims of various bomb attacks around the Federal Capital Territory, Abuja, protested alleged negligence by the Federal Government. They also claim abandonment in various hospitals, as well as failure to offset the bills that had accrued in the course of their treatments.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber detonated explosives in the midst of a Shiite religious procession in Potiskum, Yobe, killing himself and 15 others. Some reports claim 32 dead.

column7: NEPWHAN: Network of People Living with HIV/AIDS in Nigeria
column17: NEPWHAN barricade the doors of National Agency for Control of AIDS in Abuja over inadequate government funding for their treatments. The group vowed to protest for an extended period.

Hawkers shut down the ever-busy Aba/Port Harcourt Expressway in protest of the death of their colleague who was killed by a motorist. The situation caused severe gridlock in the capital city, as other motorists scampered for safety following a hot chase with stones by the hawkers. No reported injury.
Street sweepers protest over the non-payment of salaries.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Air Forces bomb Fika town, known Boko Haram stronghold. Causalities, damage unknown.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A convoy of suspected Boko Haram gunmen carrying grenade launchers attacked a bank, a cement factory and a political party office in Nafada. The gunmen moved into the town, where eleven were killed.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen carrying grenade launchers attacked the security services in Nafada. The attack in Gombe state came just after midday and began with a gunfight at a military checkpoint on the outskirts of Nafada town, causalities not known.
Hawkers protest after a colleague is killed in a street accident.
Staff of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs staged a protest over unpaid salaries and allowances in the premises of the ministry in Abuja.
The casual workers at Midland Rolling Mills, an Indian-owned company based in Abeokuta, protested poor work conditions.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks the headquarters of a French-owned cement company, steals money, trucks and dynamite. The attackers killed five soldiers at a checkpoint, as well as four civilians.
A university student is hacked to death with an axe by an unknown assailant. The reason for the attack is not known.
Youths stormed the National Assembly and demanded that lawmakers reconvene plenary in the next 10 days or face further, possibly violent, demonstrations.
Members of the PDP protest in Abuja seeking the disqualification of a party candidate whom they believe would bring disrepute to the party.
Cross River chiefs and other members of the Boki local government protest UN visit to demarcate land. Date and specific location not known. Source dated 10/11.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram clashed with military forces in Malam Fatori (Bisagana), causing 21 civilian bystander deaths. It was later reported Boko Haram had taken over the village.
Unidentified attackers, suspected to be from a neighbouring village, attack Afam Uku, kidnap two and destroy buildings. The attack is believed to have been motivated in reprisal for an unknown issue.

Former councillors and political appointees in Cross River State local government system took to the streets of Calabar, the state capital in protest over what they said was the non-payment of their severance allowances.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A bomb concealed in a plastic bag detonated in a bank line causing fourteen death and scores injured. Boko Haram is believed to be responsible.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram invades Gashaka, demanding to know the whereabouts of three retired generals who hold residence in the town. After not receiving the information they demanded the attackers set fire to a church and shot a civilian.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill the head driver of the state governor at Tudun Adabu village in Obi LGA.

Suspected Fulani gunmen ambushed and killed 25 persons (one report hold death total at more than 39) returning from a peace summit convened by the traditional ruler of Arikya chiefdom. The gunmen, numbering over 50 were said to have struck around 3pm at Soni Arikya where they barricaded the Nasarawa Eggon/Arikya road, killing most of the people who attended the peace summit as they made their way back to Nasarawa Eggon.
Kwara State APC members protest at the home of the party leader, alleging alleged marginalisation in the distribution of elective positions.
Residents of Danare, a border town with Cameroon, protest a proposed UN boundary demarcation which would cede parts of the area to Cameroon.
Unidentified gunmen have kidnapped the younger brother to the former Chairman of the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) and governorship aspirant in Adamawa State.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A suspected member of Boko Haram, dressed in a school uniform, detonates a suicide ordinance at a all boys school in Potiskum, killing 47. The figure was raised to 58 in passing days, with 117 injured (AFP).

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram invades Maiha town in the late afternoon, firing on military forces as they fled with the residents. Soon after the takeover Boko Haram raised their flag above the city. No causalities reported.

A group of human rights activists and civil society practitioners known as ""The Nucleus Group"" flooded Lagos State Governors Office and Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) in the state to protest failed distribution of permanent voters cards.
Residents of Ifaki protest a prolonged power outage in their area.

Aggrieved members of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Egor Local Government Council protested the alleged screening of an aspirant of the party for the House of Assembly seat in Egor, who was last week remanded at Oko prison for alleged attempted murder.
A school administrator is attacked and killed by a group of students after disiplinary measures were seen as unjust.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram overtakes Pella from military forces. The attack is believed part of a coordinated effort which included Gombe and Hong. Causalities not known. Exact date is not known.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 12 November 2014, Boko Haram clashed with a local armed group of hunters in Maiha (Maiha, Adamawa), killing no fewer than 75 Boko Haram militants and Maiha recaptured by local hunters. Of the dead, 10 may have been civilians Boko Haram executed while fleeing. Maiha had been overrun and captured by Boko Haram just days earlier.
Members of the PDP and Labour Party attack each other during a local government rerun election after ballot boxes were alleged to have been stolen. Four reported dead, plus other injuries.

column7: PASAN: Parliamentary Staff Association of Nigeria
column17: National Assembly workers under the aegis of Parliamentary Staff Association of Nigeria (PASAN) staged a peaceful protest over unpaid salaries and accumulated allowances due to them at the lobby of NASS.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Nigerian forces recapture Mubi, causing much of the Boko Haram population to flee. Several Boko Haram deaths claimed by residents, though specific number were not provided.

A group of PDP youths numbering over 400 picketed the state secretariat of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Cross River protesting the withholding of the delegates list that was the outcome of the parties ward congresses.
The University of Lagos (UNILAG) was temporarily disrupted on Wednesday morning as lecturers staged a protest around the campus over what they described as harsh working conditions.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A female Boko Haram suicide bomber killing at least three people at a teachers college in Kontagora, northwest Nigeria.

Hundreds of aggrieved traders in Awka protested at the state police command headquarters, protesting alleged extortion and intimidation of their members and customers by policemen from the command. No reported incidents.
Unidentified gunmen kidnap the son of a former PDP chairman.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram members attack Hong, razing a police station and raising their flag about the home of a military general. Causalities not known.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram shoots two and burns a police station in Gombi. The attackers were initially repelled by security forces, but came back soon after to overtake the city. The attackers are believed to be part of the band which was recently ousted from Maiha.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Chibok during the early evening, shooting sporadically, causing many residents to flee.""Many"" killed - exact numbers not known. Following day Boko Haram declared control of the city. The attack is believed to be a retaliatory response for a military capture of Mubi.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram detonates a suicide blast at a Kano JTF base, killing the bomber and 5 security operatives.
Protesters ""overran"" the local Headquarters of the Independent National Electoral Commission over alleged voter disenfranchisement. Traffic was also reported disrupted.

Hundreds of youths protested in the state capital for the removal of Imam of the Jimeta after the Imam criticised the governments attitude toward ongoing Boko Haram insecurity in the area. The Imams palace was burned down by the protesters.

A group of women from Irete community protest insecurity in their area after an increased report of sexual assaults. The group protested along the Owerri/Onitsha express way, causing traffic problems. Police in the area dispersed the protesters.
There was commotion during the afternoon hours in Ibadan, Oyo State, as a large number of youths protested the alleged killing of an unidentified young man in the custody of the police.

Unidentified persons attack a voter registration centre in the Oke-Efon area of Abeokuta. The area was filled with tension, as about ten persons were seriously injured by the group who attacked the venue with guns and other weapons.

Over one thousand women from Okirigwe and Amukpe communities in Sapele Local Government Area of Delta State weekend stormed Amupke Flow station of SEPLAT Petroleum Development Company in protest against alleged non-compliance of the company with a non-compliance of a law. The protest occurred ""at the weekend"" - exact date not known.

Itsekiri youths protest the groundbreaking of a Export Processing Zone (EPZ), giving seven-day ultimatum to President Goodluck Jonathan to reschedule the date of ceremony to comport with local ethnic sensibilities vis a vis those of neighbouring Ijaw.

column7: QOAN: Quarry Owners Association of Nigeria
column17: Members of the Quarry Owners Association of Nigeria (QOAN) in Ondo State ""at the weekend"" protested what they described as ""unlawful collection of multiple taxes by the government"". The group confronted government tax collectors along the Ifon-Benin Expressway near Elegbeka. No violent incident was reported.
Members of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Ilorin staged a protest over an alleged attempt to manipulate the delegates list for the forthcoming governorship primaries.
Twenty are believed dead while 56 were injured as a suicide bomb blast hit an Azare market during the evening hours. The source does not speculate on the responsible party.
Kanberi and Eggon youths clash over communal disagreements in Lafia. Causalities not known.
A journalist is abducted in Abia State, location unknown. The man was later released.

Suspected Fulani gunmen attack Alakyo (unknown location) and nearby Shabu, Nasarawa State during the early hours of 16/11. Persons displaced by the fresh violence gave two different account of the situation: The first version says gunmen suspected to be Fulanis stormed Alakyo in their numbers, killing many, and razed properties worth millions of naira. The second version said the Fulani gunmen attempted to enter Alakyo, but were repelled by gunmen, suspected to be Eggon. Specific causality number not known.
Military forces shot and killed one, injured three others, when they opened fire on a group of protesters who were protesting against military infighting.

An Ijaw leader is kidnapped in Ethiope East LGA while returning from Kokori following a conference. Many in the Ijaw community blame Kokori residents for his disappearance, and threaten to ""invade"" the town. Despite the circumstantial evidence the perpetrators are not officially known.
Two union groups (MTUN/OWAN) attack a police station after it was alleged one of their members was shot by an officer. No reported injuries.

Unidentified gunmen attacked a popular hotel in Abonnema, Akuku Torlu LGA of Rivers State, killing two persons and injuring three. A witness described the incident as ""barbaric and inhumane."" It could not be ascertained what led to the shooting, even as no group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Eggon youths engage a group of soldiers who were attempting to disperse a clash between they and Kanberi youths. Seven Eggon deaths reported. At another place in the city the soldiers shot and killed four Eggon youths who were blocking a road.

A clash between people from Okrika, in Okrika Local Council and Onne, in Eleme Local Council of Rivers State has left at least two persons dead and several others injured. The clash began after people from Onne and Ogu communities attacked a group of protesters from Okrika, which led to an intense fight.
Okrika people staged a protest over alleged refusal of the Federal Government to recognise them as a host community to the seaport.
Kanberi and Eggon youths clash in Lafia for a second day - twelve deaths reported among to two sects, 30 houses destroyed in the Farin Kasa area of the city - many other residents were displaced.

Angered at what they considered as the bleak lot of the kidnapped Chibok girls, impunity and discriminatory law enforcement, leaders of the All Progressives Congress (APC) marched on Louis Edet House, headquarters of the Nigeria Police Force in Abuja. No report of police response.

Non-violent activity: Police fired tear gas at opposition members (APC mainly) of the Nigerian House of Representatives as they tried to enter their legislative chamber, attempting to stop them from convening. Despite the gas, the lawmakers entered the building, calling for the impeachment of President Johathan. No reported injuries.
""Overzealous"" soldiers killed eight civilians in the Shinge area in Lafia, apparently mistaking them for members of the Ombatse militia.
A mob attacks and sets alight a man they suspected to be a suicide bomber.

Students of state-run institutions protest along the Benin-Ore expressway at Dawson Road in Benin City over a prolonged government strike. The students, who carried placards with various inscriptions, barricaded the two dual carriage roads with used tyres, benches and plastic chairs, leaving motorists stranded for hours. They also attempted to storm the state Ministry of Education in Iyaro before they were dispersed by security operatives. No reported injury.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military leaders report they have forcibly regained three areas lost to Boko Haram the previous week: Gombi, Pelia and Hong, killing ""many"" (10 confirmed in Gombi) members of Boko Haram. Specific date(s) not known.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military leaders report they have forcibly regained three areas lost to Boko Haram the previous week: Gombi, Pelia and Hong, killing ""many"" members of Boko Haram. Specific date(s) not known.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military leaders report they have forcibly regained three areas lost to Boko Haram the previous week: Gombi, Pelia and Hong, killing ""many"" members of Boko Haram. Specific date(s) not known.
Members of the APC protest in Abuja, accusing the President Jonathan and the PDP of ""playing politics with Boko Haram.""
Enrolees of the public work scheme in Kwara State staged a protest over non-payment of their three-month stipends in Ilorin.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks the village of Azaya Kura in Mafa LGA, killing 45 residents. Additionally, the attackers destroyed houses, stole food and livestock.

Nigerian security forces fired teargas on opposition (APC) lawmakers inside the parliament complex as they attempted to enter for a key vote on emergency rule in the northeast. Members of Tambuwals All Progressives Congress (APC) party have described the state of emergency first imposed in May last year as a failure because of escalating violence and have argued it should not be renewed. No injuries reported. A similar attempt against APC lawmakers occurred two days prior.

Two persons were feared killed in a clash between supporters of the Chairman of the Community Development Association (CDA) and chairman of youth association in Aruogba community in Oredo Local Council of Edo State over a tussle for the chairmanship position of the communities association. Some houses were also reportedly razed.

Gunmen, suspected to be Fulani mercenaries launched an offensive attack at Digan Dogo in Kadarko community of Keana Local Government Area of Nasarawa State, leaving scores dead and injuring many people. Specific numbers not provided.

A senior district head in the Bauchi Emirate Council was shot by unidentified gunmen in Bauchi. He was on his way home after the Ishai prayer at a nearby mosque. The wounds were not deemed to be life threatening.
A group of Ora Ara indigenes protest against the Minister of State, warning her not to appoint a non-indigene to a local position of power.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Soldiers and vigilante members began to take control of Mubi, Adamawa State as Boko Haram militants fled the town after suffering a heavy defeat. The preceding battle lasted over two days, but soldiers did not enter the heart of the city, gaining control, until 26/11. ""Many"" Boko Haram deaths reported.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks two areas near Chibok, killing 20 and destroying property.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks two areas near Chibok, killing 20 and destroying property.
No fewer than 10 PDP supporters were injured over a inter-party leadership struggle. The clash began at the party secretariat.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram seizes Damasak after a early morning battle with military forces. Details on casualty were not clear at press time, but sources said the militants went to the centre of the market brandishing their assault rifles. Many of the residents fled into nearby Cameroon.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Soldiers and vigilante members eventually took complete control of Mubi, Adamawa State as Boko Haram militants fled the town after suffering a heavy defeat. The preceding battle lasted over two days, but soldiers did not enter the heart of the city, gaining control, until 26/11. ""Many"" Boko Haram deaths reported.

Students of the University of Jos besieged the Bauchi road campus of the institution protesting alleged increment in school fees. They also called on the Vice Chancellor to rescind his decision or resign.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram reportedly killed 48 people in an attack on fish sellers at Abadam near Baga in northern Borno State near the border with Chad. Witnesses said those killed were traders ambushed while on their way to buy fish. Some had their throats slit while

The secretariat of the Cross River State chapter of PDP was rocked by explosion suspected to be a bomb blast. The incident happened as the party was gearing up to distribute materials to hold its ward congress. No life was lost, though the building was damaged. Injuries not known. Perpetrators not known.

""""Hoodlums"""" stormed Iyana-Idikan, Agbaje, and Ayeye communities of Ibadan, areas looting, breaking, burning and carting away goods and products of traders in the market. According to traders in the market, the rampage started around 10pm on Monday till about 5am on Tuesday and it was alleged that frantic calls were made to the police, but to no avail. No reported injuries.
Suspected cattle rustlers attack Lilo, killing fifty. The attackers were also alleged to have burnt some houses and destroyed other property worth millions of naira.

Military forces battle with a group of kidnappers on an Ijaw leader who was abducted on 16/11. The leader was freed as a result of the shootout. Causality figure not known. The identities and motives of the kidnappers remain unknown.

column7: ASUU: Academic Staff Union of Universities; Teachers (Nigeria)
column17: Academic Staff Union of Universities, ASUU, Delta State University, Abraka, stormed Asaba in protest against the kidnap of one of its members and called on their abductors to release them unconditionally. The protesters also went to the Nigeria Television Authority, NTA, Asaba station, and the state police headquarters. The details of the kidnapping itself are not known.

A pair of teenaged female suicide bombers detonated at a market in Maiduguri during the mid-morning hours, at least 45 deaths plus injuries. The source does not articulate any suspicions as to the perpetrator, but many suspect Boko Haram.

Over 200 traders staged a peaceful protest in Awka over alleged imposition of levies and invasion of their market at Igbo-Ukwu in Aguata local government area by alleged hoodlums. The protesters, who stormed the Anambra Government House, Awka, at about 2pm carried placards some of which read ""we want peace at Igbo-Ukwu main market.""

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Soldiers and vigilante members took complete control of Mubi, Adamawa State as Boko Haram militants fled the town after suffering a heavy defeat. The preceding battle lasted over two days, but soldiers did not enter the heart of the city, gaining control, until 26/11. ""Many"" Boko Haram deaths reported.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Insurgents suspected to be members of Boko Haram struck at Maraban Mubi area of Adamawa State where they killed 35 persons following a roadside bomb explosion. The targets included a group of soldiers and local hunters.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: At least 30 Boko Haram fighters were killed by operatives of the Civilian-JTF (BVYG) when the insurgents attempted to attack Kareto and Gubio villages in Mobbar Local Government Area of Borno State.

Thousands of Ogoni youths protest the APC parties decision to nominate a particular candidate for governor. They said [the party] deceived the Ogonis into thinking that he would give the governorship ticket to them. [The protesters] blocked major junctions of the East-West Road at Eleme, Akpajo and Tai in the early hours of the day before heading to the main gate of Government House, Port Harcourt, where they lit tyres and other incendiary materials and sang war songs. Two protesters (some accounts report 10) were injured by police gunfire when they intervened at the government house.

Thousands of Ogoni youths protest the APC parties decision to nominate a particular candidate for governor. They said [the party] deceived the Ogonis into thinking that he would give the governorship ticket to them. [The protesters] blocked major junctions of the East-West Road at Eleme, Akpajo and Tai in the early hours of the day before heading to the main gate of Government House, Port Harcourt, where they lit tyres and other incendiary materials and sang war songs. Two protesters (some accounts report 10) were injured by police gunfire when they intervened at the government house.

Thousands of Ogoni youths protest the APC parties decision to nominate a particular candidate for governor. They said [the party] deceived the Ogonis into thinking that he would give the governorship ticket to them. [The protesters] blocked major junctions of the East-West Road at Eleme, Akpajo and Tai in the early hours of the day before heading to the main gate of Government House, Port Harcourt, where they lit tyres and other incendiary materials and sang war songs. Two protesters (some accounts report 10) were injured by police gunfire when they intervened at the government house.

Thousands of Ogoni youths protest the APC parties decision to nominate a particular candidate for governor. They said [the party] deceived the Ogonis into thinking that he would give the governorship ticket to them. [The protesters] blocked major junctions of the East-West Road at Eleme, Akpajo and Tai in the early hours of the day before heading to the main gate of Government House, Port Harcourt, where they lit tyres and other incendiary materials and sang war songs. Two protesters (some accounts report 10) were injured by police gunfire when they intervened at the government house.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: At least 30 Boko Haram fighters were killed by operatives of the Civilian-JTF (BVYG) when the insurgents attempted to attack Kareto and Gubio villages in Mobbar Local Government Area of Borno State.

About five persons were killed while properties estimated at millions of Naira were razed when Fulani herdsmen allegedly attacked Abugi community in Lokoja Local Government area of Kogi State. The attack is believed to be reprisal for an earlier incident.
Doctors at the Lagos State University Teaching Hospital (LASUTH), Ikeja, staged a peaceful protest to express their grievances over the non-payment of their salaries by the government.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: At least 200 people were killed and 270+ others wounded when two suicide bombers detonated themselves and gunmen opened fire during weekly prayers at the mosque of one of Nigeria's top Islamic leaders. The mosque is attached to the palace of the Emir of Kano Muhammad Sanusi II, Nigeria's second most senior Muslim cleric, who last week urged civilians to take up arms against Boko Haram - the group is suspected here. The fatality count is expected to rise.

Students of Obafemi Awolowo University (OAU), Osun State protested over President Goodluck Jonathan's visit to their institution, demanding that he addresses them concerning educational funding (among other topics) before his departure. There was violence reported when two groups of students clashed, leaving five injured.
Defusal: Police discover and dismantle two IEDs placed at Gamboru market and nearby Jumaat mosque, apparently targeting residents. Perpetrators not known.
Two policemen on patrol were ambushed and killed by unidentified gunmen along Wamba road in Akwanga Local Government Area of Nasarawa State. The attack occurred around 9:00 am near Baku village.
Students of the Adeyemi College of Education protest the deaths of two fellow students when they were struck by vehicle. The protesters marched in several areas of the city.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram took over Lassa town in Askira/Uba local government council, Borno State, leaving many persons dead, many places of worship and residential houses burnt down. The attack, according to reports from Lassa, was resisted by the villagers who engaged the attackers with locally made rifles, bows and arrows. Numbers of the fighting dead not known.
Two factions of PDP supporters clash over two aspirants to the Darazo House of Assembly. Three injuries reported, four arrests.
A PDP group protests against a PDP primary process which they claimed was not transparent.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected members of Boko Haram sect invaded Shani town of Borno State and opened fire on residents, resulting in the death of scores. The incident also left many residents of the town injured, with many of them forced to flee into the bush for safety. The attack occurred around 8pm.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 1 December 2014, Boko Haram clashed with police and a local armed group at a police post in Damaturu (Damaturu, Yobe) during the early morning hours. The local armed group (not identified) claimed the killed 40 members of Boko Haram in retaliation. Police/civilian/vigilante deaths not known.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks a crowded market with two suicide bombings, more than 45 dead, plus injuries. The market was the same site struck a week ago.
A federal prison in Ado-Ekiti is bombed and assaulted in a two-day operation that freed several inmates. At least one guard was killed in the attack.
PDP protests in Ika North East LGA over the results of a disputed primary election. Locations in the LGA to known.

A mob set a Police station ablaze in Shinkafi local government area of Zamfara state over what people described as refusal by police to hand over a suspected gun-runner to them for vigilante justice. No injury reported.
The police in Kaduna disrupted a peaceful protest against Boko Haram killings in the North by a coalition of youth groups, Arewa Liberation Movement.

Scores of residents of Badagry area besieged the office of the State Governor in Alausa over an alleged renege of promise made by the Governor and the Speaker to intervene in a demolition of 1,500 houses belonging to the protesters by Nigeria Police Force.
A Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) Senatorial aspirant survived an attack by gunmen who killed his nephew and police orderly near his residents in Benin City.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Nigerian troops in Konduga, Borno State, destroyed a vehicle laden with improvised explosive devices (IEDs) meant for suicide bombing operations by [Boko Haram]. [The source] gathered that between 40 and 70 members of Boko Haram were killed in the operation - no military personnel or civilian was affected in the incident.

Armed PDP protesters gather at the parties secretariat to accuse the party leadership of acting in cahoots with former Minister of State for Education to impose candidates ahead of next years elections. Despite the protesters being armed there were no reports of any violent incidents occurring.
Retirees of Bayelsa State Government under the aegis of Nigeria Union of Pensioners, NUP took to the streets of Yenagoa demanding the payment of their gratuities and pension arrears.
Unhappy with the expected result of a electoral primary, aggrieved members of the APC disrupt elections in Lafia, causing elections to be postponed. No reported injury.

Members of APC, unhappy with the expected result of an election primary, shot dead four in Garaku, headquarters of Kokona LGA where the Kokona-West exercise was held. Many others, according to witnesses, were injured. It is not clear if the victims were of a rival APC faction.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Air Force jets bombed an Boko Haram location at Garin Itace, 20km south of Damaturu. Intelligence reported indicated Boko Haram was re-grouping at that point to launch an attack on Damaturu. Causalities of the operation not known.
An APC leader narrowly escapes death by residents of Ikosi-Isheri LGA when they believe him to be a thief.
Fulani fighters ambushed residents of Ashige community in Lafia East Development Area of Nasarawa State, killing nine women and five others, majority of whom were Koro by tribe.

The workers of the Kaduna Electricity Distribution Company, on Thursday morning, staged a protest ahead of the hand-over of the company to its new owners on the same day. The protesters had concern the new owners would not honour unpaid allowances to the employees.
Defusal: A student discovers, and police safely remove an IED placed at a school. Perpetrators not known.
Ijaw demonstrators chase away workers of a flow station in protest of an alleged broken agreement of the company and the local community. No reports of injuries.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attack Bajoga and Ashaka, attacking government offices, party offices (political affiliation not identified) and banks. Military forces fought back against the attacks, killing 67 in Bajoga. Ten soldiers reported dead in Ashaka.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A ""number"" of Boko Haram fighters killed in battle with military forces at Kwanta, Yobe location. No military deaths reported.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attack Bajoga and Ashaka, attacking government offices, party offices (political affiliation not identified) and banks. Military forces fought back against the attacks, killing 67 in Bajoga. Ten soldiers reported dead in Ashaka.
Workers at a brewery protest over unpaid allowances.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Police forces intercept and defuse a suspected Boko Haram explosive at Jumaat mosque.
A Ijaw group protesting an oil spill overtake a flow station in Escravos. The group had chased away workers from a flow station the previous day.

Suspected PDP ""political thugs"" raid the Bayelsa State Secretariat of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) ostensibly to hijack materials for the conduct of the Federal House of Representatives primaries in the state. Upon encountering police, the group was fired upon. It is not clear if the raiders, who were also armed, returned fire.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram and military forces again clash in Ashaka, 10 soldiers KIA, 70 Boko Haram. The source indicates the battle lasted several hours. The two actors had previously battled in the town two days prior.
Soldiers attack and raze a Buchi village over two days while in pursuit of Boko Haram. Six civilians killed, many buildings destroyed.

Civil rights groups protest planned release of the Russian Cargo plane laden with munitions impounded by the Military with out due process. The protest occurred at Malam Aminu Kano International Airport.

Some All Progressives Congress (APC) aspirants for the House of Representatives in Kogi State staged a protest at the parties secretariat over alleged hijacking of election materials by some party stakeholders.

Unidentified gunmen attack a prison, freeing more than 200 inmates. Boko Haram had been blamed for two recent prison breaks in the country, though no blame had been laid in this event. Causalities not known.
Soldiers attack and raze a Buchi village over two days while in pursuit of Boko Haram. Six civilians killed, many buildings destroyed.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Twenty members of Boko Haram are killed in joint operation in Lame village and the Balmo Forest reserve (which is part of Sambisa). At least six soldiers were wounded in the encounters. Date(s) ambiguous - source dated 09/12.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Twenty members of Boko Haram are killed in joint operation in Lame village and the Balmo Forest reserve (which is part of Sambisa). At least six soldiers were wounded in the encounters. Date(s) ambiguous - source dated 09/12.

The All Progressives Congress (APC) Senate primaries in Kogi State was marred by protest over poor distribution of election materials. Though the source suggests several protests throughout the state it only one in Kabba is cited.
Factions of the PDP clash at Yard 158 Event Centre over a candidate in Lagos governorship primaries. Two including a reporter were injured in the melee. Police dispersed the two groups.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Seven members of Boko Haram are dead following a military operation in the Hildi area of Mubi. A large cache of weapons were recovered. Date ambiguous - source dated 09/12.

Delegates and supporters of the PDP stage a ""rowdy"" demonstration in protest of the labelling of ballot boxes used in a state primary contest. The source did not articulate where in the state the protest(s) took place.
There were protests among factions of the PDP in parts of Akwa Ibom State (locations not reported) following the result of a primary election.
Loyalists to Senator Otuprotest (PDP) protest the result of his primary defeat in Calibar.

Many protesters stormed the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) national headquarters in Abuja over what they described as irregularities in the parties House of Representatives primary election for Southern Ijaw Federal Constituency.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two female suicide bombers, suspected to be Boko Haram, killed at least four people at a busy market in Kano. Over the following hours the death count was raised to ten.

Post-graduate students of the University of Nigeria, Nsukka, UNN, barricaded the office of the Vice-Chancellor in protest against hike in their tuition fees. The placard-carrying protesters, numbering over 200, marched round the school and barricaded the VCs office.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen killed 11 people in an attack on the remote town of Gajiganna. Eleven killed, plus injuries, houses destroyed.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram continues a siege on Gajiganna over several days, battling either military forces or local militia as their attempts at taking over the town had been unsuccessful as of 13/12. Causalities not known between the dates of 11/12 - 13/12. Residents fled for safety throughout the end of the week.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: At least 31 people were killed as twin bombs exploded during the evening hours in the central Nigerian city of Jos. Boko Haram is believed to be responsible.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram continues a siege on Gajiganna over several days, battling either military forces or local militia as their attempts at taking over the town had been unsuccessful as of 13/12. Causalities not known between the dates of 11/12 - 13/12.

Two are killed in a communal clash over several days (12/12 -15/12) in Lagelu and Egbeda LGAs. The fighting resulted from disputed rural land surveys that demarcated land for those from Lalupon. Violence became a series tit-for-tat attacks over the several days. Two deaths recorded, one on Sunday and the other on Monday.

Two are killed in a communal clash over several days (12/12 -15/12) in Lagelu and Egbeda LGAs. The fighting resulted from disputed rural land surveys that demarcated land for those from Lalupon. Violence became a series tit-for-tat attacks over the several days. Two deaths recorded, one on Sunday and the other on Monday.
