Workers in Ishielu, Ohaukwu, Ebonyi, Afikpo North, Ezza North and Izzi local government areas of Ebonyi State protested what they described as governments insensitivity to the plight of civil servants and plans to cut their salary."" Protest were believed to be held in all areas.

Workers in Ishielu, Ohaukwu, Ebonyi, Afikpo North, Ezza North and Izzi local government areas of Ebonyi State protested what they described as governments insensitivity to the plight of civil servants and plans to cut their salary."" Protest were believed to be held in all areas.

Workers in Ishielu, Ohaukwu, Ebonyi, Afikpo North, Ezza North and Izzi local government areas of Ebonyi State protested what they described as governments insensitivity to the plight of civil servants and plans to cut their salary."" Protest were believed to be held in all areas.

Workers in Ishielu, Ohaukwu, Ebonyi, Afikpo North, Ezza North and Izzi local government areas of Ebonyi State protested what they described as governments insensitivity to the plight of civil servants and plans to cut their salary."" Protest were believed to be held in all areas.

Workers in Ishielu, Ohaukwu, Ebonyi, Afikpo North, Ezza North and Izzi local government areas of Ebonyi State protested what they described as governments insensitivity to the plight of civil servants and plans to cut their salary."" Protest were believed to be held in all areas.

Workers in Ishielu, Ohaukwu, Ebonyi, Afikpo North, Ezza North and Izzi local government areas of Ebonyi State protested what they described as governments insensitivity to the plight of civil servants and plans to cut their salary."" Protest were believed to be held in all areas.
People affected with leprosy protest government neglect in Agbor.
Mobs kill two suspected motorcycle thieves in Akwanga.
Protesters went to the National Assembly complex in Abuja to register their displeasure over Amnesty International report on rights abuses by the Nigerian military.

column7: KAROTA: Kano Road and Traffic Agency
column17: Commercial drivers and members of KAROTA clash over an illegal motor park. Injuries reported.
Unidentified gunmen attack Zaki Biam yam market, kill 10 and injure others.
Unidentified gunmen riding motorcycles storm Zaki-Biam, Ukum local government area of Benue State, killing eight.
A Boko Haram suicide attack kills eight in Maiduguris Gamboru market.
Ten are dead after Boko Haram attacks Kukuwa-Gari village of Gujba on 31/07.

Elderly women and youths marched through major streets of Obubra Local Government Area of Cross River State to caution the incumbent chairman of the council not to attempt making a come back with a second term.

Students blocked the Akure/Owo Expressway over a spate of accidents along the road. The students called on the Federal Government to create an alternative routes for trucks and trailers on the road or ban them from moving during the day time.
Two factions of the Ekiti State PDP fired shots at each other at the states party secretariat. A leader of one of the factions was injured in the shootout.
Some youths in Kuje Area Council, Federal Capital Territory (FCT) staged a protest over the impeachment of the councils speaker on 31/07.

column7: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column17: 44 suspected arrested and two police injured following union unrest.
Boko Haram and military forces battle in Bama LGA, 13 killed and 27 wounded. Additionally, military forces freed 178 hostages being held by Boko Haram, and arrested a prominent commander.

Military forces carry out a series of air attacks on Boko Haram positions in Bita (Bida), Borno State. A ""large number"" of causalities. The strikes were in response to a Boko Haram planned offensive on the village, for which they were mobilising.

column7: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column9: RTEAN: Road Transport Employers Association of Nigeria
column17: Disagreements between two unions results in violence, one dead.
Boko Haram attacks Kolbachuwa location in Madagali LGA, killing between five and eight on 02/08.
Arrests: Military forces arrest 30 owners of businesses in Benisheikh and Mainuk for their aid and abetment of Boko Haram.
Seven are killed in a Boko Haram attack on four Konduga LGA, including Malari.
Suspected Fulani attackers attacked a rival Fulani settlement in Obi, killing eight in injuring five.
Several corps members in the Federal Capital Territory (FCT) protested over what they described as extortion of certain amount of fees charged for a government programme.
Boko Haram kills nine fishermen at Baga village on 04/08.

column9: APGA: All Progressives Grand Alliance Party
column17: Members of the PDP and APGA parties clash in Umariaga at an election petition tribunal.
Numbering in the hundreds, youths protest the planned prosecution of a Synagogue after its building collapsed in 2014.
Unidentified gunmen attacked a mosque in Anguwan Katako, Barkin Ladi Local Government Area on 04/08. Causalities not known. Locals blamed Berom youth, though the validity of this claim is not known.
Boko Haram attacks Tadagara and Dumbulwa villages in Yobe State, killing nine residents.
Boko Haram attacks Tadagara and Dumbulwa villages in Yobe State, killing nine residents.

Two are beheaded and four injured in an attack by Kogi State communal militants on farmers at Eziagulu Otu in Anambra East LGA over ownership of Orient Petroleum Resources Plc. The attackers, who were heavily armed, took the farmers unawares and as many of them ran into the river, the attackers caught six of them, killing two and injuring four.
Demonstrators protest at the national assembly over a loan request by the Edo State government.
Students blocks roads in Damaturu, protesting the sale of handouts by teachers, who insist students must buy them before passing examinations.

column7: NDWPD: Niger Delta Women for Peace and Development; Women (Nigeria)
column17: The women under the aegis of Niger Delta Women for Peace and Development (NDWPD) from several states protested for the release of a government official being held over the conduct of the governorship election in the state. The location(s) of the protest not known.
Police and military forces clash in Benin City. The clash stemmed from a series of incidents between the two groups earlier in the day. Fifteen reported injuries, including those from bystanders.
Commercial drivers violently protest after a colleague is shot by police after refusing to pay a bribe.
A commercial driver is shot and killed by police after he refuses to pay a bribe. The shooting caused two days a violent protests.
Three are killed by unknown gunmen in Makurdi on the evening of 08/08.
Four are dead following a violent protest against unpaid salaries.
Suspected sea pirates attacked a military post at Ogbolomabiri in Nembe local government area, killing five. It is believed the pirates are attempting to gain control of the area.
Protest against government corruption ""at the weekend"" in Uyo.

Over 2000 people from Abagana Community in Njikoka Local Government Area of Anambra State, embarked on a peaceful protest against the alleged illegalities of the Local Government Chairman in the area as well as unpaid salaries.

Commercial drivers and their sympathisers violently protest for a second day in Port Harcourt. The reason for the protest is related to the killing of driver by police the previous day. The reason for the police killing is believed to be related to the offering of a bribe.
Youths forced the temporary closing of a church during a protest which accused its Bishop of corruption.
Boko Haram abducts six and kills four in Nwajurko village in Damboa local government area of Borno State.
Unknown gunmen on motorcycle killed three people including a former lawmaker in Zaki-Biam, Ukum LGA of Benue State.

At least six persons including a security agent with the Special Task Force (STF) sustained injuries when unknown gunmen attacked Bisichi community on 10/08. The shooting lasted long enough for security forces to respond.
Protesters gather at the national assembly to demonstrate against alleged federal interference of Rivers State elections. The group threatened further protests if their demands were not met.
Members of a Fulani militia reportedly attack and kill a suspected cattle thief in Ikare-Akoko.
Teachers protest over the non-payment of salaries.
Boko Haram targets a market in Sabon Gari, killing 47 and injuring dozens in a large explosion.
Boko Haram attacks Bale Mamman near Maiduguri on 11/08. Six killed, four abducted.
Unidentified gunmen attack and kill a man while travelling to Bukuru.
The bodies of three Fulanis are discovered near Sho. Both the date of the attack, as well as its perpetrators are not known. Source dated 11/08.
Gunmen from Odekpe and Echeno communities attack Aguleri ""recently"", date not known. Four dead, three abducted.
Women and youth groups in Omu-Aran, Kwara State protested over high electricity bills on 11/08.
Unidentified gunmen attacked and killed three men in Kassa.
Students in Idadan protest for two consecutive days following the death of a colleagues after a collision with a motorist.
APC supporters are tear gassed by security officials as they protested at the electoral commission in Abuja.
Seventeen members of Boko Haram were killed on the evening of 12/08 by local youth militia group in Lahou village (Askira/Uba), Borno state.
A local monarch leads a protest against persistent electricity outages in Aramoko-Ekiti. The protesters blocked a highway during a demonstration.
Students in Idadan protest for two consecutive days following the death of a colleagues after a collision with a motorist.

Boko Haram attacks Kukuwa Tasha village, Gujba local government area of Yobe state on 13/08, battles military forces. Initial reports claim four members of Boko Haram, one civilian dead, though some witnesses claim eight were shot. Later reports from witnesses claim the attack and subsequent fighting was on intense the civilian population fled, 150+ drowning in a nearby river - Boko Haram may have facilitated the drowning. Further, one witness claims Boko Haram, upon entering the village, indiscriminately began opening fire on the villagers. The military, however, disputes these claims, though have confirmed a Boko Haram commander was killed in the fighting.

Boko Haram reportedly killings the inhabitants of a remote village in Gujba LGA. Residents report as much as 150 dead after Boko Haram fired upon civilians and chased them into a lake. Local authorities say that as many as 50 may have died while the mil
Youths protesting the detention of a group of suspected thieves attempt to burn a police station before they are arrested themselves. Date not clear: source dated 13/08.

Youths and kinsmen of former President Goodluck Jonathan in Ogbia, Bayelsa State protested an alleged plot by the Nigeria Content Management Development Board (NCMDB) to relocate a project in one of their communities, the politics of which were not articulated.
A Boko Haram suicide attack on a market in Rumurigo village of Askira/Uba LGA kills the attacker and injures a security official.
Nigerian air forces launch an air raid on Boko Haram locations in Sambisa Forest. Causalities not known.
Workers of the Nigerian Institute for Social and Economic Research protest over an appointee of a leadership position of the organization.
Youths violently protest prolonged power outages at an electricity company headquarters, destroying company property and barricading its entrance.

Commercial printers, traders and artisans occupying shops along Lokoja, Gwari and Muri Roads in the Kaduna metropolis held a demonstration on 17/08, protesting plans by the state government to demolish their shops.
A vigilante mob set an alleged thief alight in Apapa.
Boko Haram raided the village of Awonori, a farming and herding village near the fishing town of Damasak, killed seven residents, carting away food supplies and livestock.
Health workers protest pay in Yola.

column7: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: MASSOB supporters protest marginalization by the Igbo governor in Onitsha. There were reports of military and MASSOB members clashing during the protest; MASSOB claims two of its members were killed, a claim the military denies.
Youths of Unuagwo and Umuapu communities in Ohaji/Egbema Local Government Area of Imo State blocked the Owerri - Port Harcourt expressway in protest of its disrepair.
Vigilantes kill two suspected motorcycle thieves.

The Nigeria Labour Congress Private Sector (NLCPS), and the National Union of Electricity Employee (NUEE), Cross River State chapter, on 18/08 prevented workers from entering the premises of the Calabar Office of the Port Harcourt Electricity Distribution Company (PHEDC) in protest of poor working conditions.
Following a aerial bombardment on Boko Haram positions in Sambisa, the fleeing militants were engaged by soldiers at Gwoza. Military forces recovered weapons, and killed ""many"" members of the sect.
Sex workers protest the demolition of brothels in Amansee. Many structures in a nearby market were destroyed when the protest became violent.
Locals forcibly shut down Otorogun Gas Plant in Ughelli South Local Government Area of Delta State in protest of ""the marginalisation of host communities.""

Nigerian Air Forces launch an aerial bombardment of Sambisa Forest for the second time in a week. Military forces report the deaths ""of a number of them."" Other Boko Haram equipment was also reported destroyed. A military patrol engaged at Gwoza the militants as they fled.
Supporters of the APC are attacked and chased out of their homes by members of the PDP in Okworike Amagu in Ikwo LGA. Date of the attack not clear: source dated 19/08.
Following a court judgement following a land ownership dispute members of the winning side take the awarded property by force, killing one person.

column7: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
column17: Members of NANS locked the entrance of Lagos State University to demand the reopening of a building.
NLC and National Union of Electricity Employees (NUEE) members protest outside an electricity company headquarters over alleged unfair labour practices.
NLC and National Union of Electricity Employees (NUEE) members protest the Port Harcourt Electricity Distribution Company over alleged unfair labour practices.

column9: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column17: Officers of the Federal Roads Safety Commission (FRSC) and members of the National Union of Road Transport Workers (NURTW) clashed in Osogbo, the Osun State capital, with many people sustaining various degrees of injuries and seven vehicles destroyed. The fracas began after a member of the FRSC impounded a vehicle belonging to the NURTW.
Military forces dislodge Boko Haram from Gudumbali on 21/08, killing ""many"" enemy fighters. Two soldiers reported dead.
Two Nigerian soldiers died during an advance through Dikwa when they stepped on a land mine buried by Boko Haram.
Unidentified gunmen shot dead two farmers (Premium Times claim seven dead) and injured twelve others in Kortse village in Gassol Local Government Area.
Suspected Fulanis attack and kill two in Barikin Ladi LGA. The motive for the attack is not known.
A vigilante mob killed a man for stealing a pot of soup in Calabar.

Hundreds of Ogoni youths in Rivers State blocked the Akpajo end of East West Road, protesting the location of the office United Nations Environment Programme. The protesters blocked the road for several hours.
The members of Organised labour and pensioners on 25/08 demonstrated in Owerri over the non-payment of pensions and salaries owed them by the Imo government.

About 100 youths employed under the Subsidy Reinvestment and Empowerment Programme (SURE-P) on 25/08 staged a peaceful protest at the state secretariat of the Nigerian Union of Journalists (NUJ) protesting non-payment of their seven months salaries.
Boko Haram attacks Marfunudi in Damboa LGA on 25/08, kills 24 people.
Three are dead following a violent incident between police and tanker drivers blocking a Chediya highway in protest of a police checkpoint.
Seven dead (including the bomber) and many others injured when a child bomber with suspected links to Boko Haram targeted a Damaturu bus station on 25/08. Some sources report a twin blast.

Suspected Boko Haram attacks at a military check-point in Maiduguri with a pair of suicide blasts, causing the death of an Air Force officer and a civilian, four total. Conflicting report - Vanguard reports the attack occurred the evening of 25/08.
Members of the Bakassi community protested at the government house in Calabar over non-payment of a monthly stipend. Security forces dispersed the protesters.

Soldiers storm the premises of Evbuoriaria Magistrate's Court, Benin to free four suspects brought for arraignment by officials of the Edo State War Against Indiscipline. The soldiers allegedly assaulted the staff of the agency in their bid to rescue the arrested suspects. The reason for the soldiers actions are not known.
Residents of Majidun and Ogolonto community of Ikorodu protested a killing of three by an inebriated Naval Officer in their community in Ikeja.
A chieftain of All Progressives Congress (APC) in Akoko- Edo Local Government Area, Edo State is shot and killed by unidentified gunmen along the Igarra-Okpe road on 27/08.
Boko Haram attacks Kafa on 27/08, killing four people.
Several vehicles were set ablaze in Misau, Bauchi State as protests greeted the appointment of the Secretary to the State Government (SSG), Alhaji Ahmed Suleiman, as the new Emir of Misau.
Mounted on horseback, Boko Haram attacks Baanu village, Nganzai LGA. Differing reports put the fatalities at 56 and 68.
Students and teachers barricade the entrance of the Alvan Ikoku Federal University of Education in protest of a rumour the institution would be downgraded.
Boko Haram attacks Karnuwa, Nganzai on 29/08, killing four, including the chief imam of the village.

Residents of Ilepa, Onihale and Pakodo in Ifo Local Government Area of Ogun State ""at the weekend"" protested alleged plan by the state government to commence demolition of houses in the area. The protesters gathers at a section of the Lagos/Abeokuta Expressway.
A woman is beaten to death, and other members of the Accord Party injured ""at the weekend"" by police when they accused her of ""shielding a criminal.""
Boko Haram attacks Hambagda, Nganzai on 30/08, killing seven and injuring five others.
Boko Haram killed ""dozens"" in an attack on Fatawe village near Gwoza on 31/08. The attackers arrived on horseback.
A landlord burns his tenants son to death in Ijako for unknown reason.
Fulanis attack and kill three farmers at Okuke during a dispute over farm land. Date not known - source dated 31/08.
Residents from many areas around Plateau State blocked the Old Bukuru bypass demanding an end to what they described as incessant killings in communities and highways in Riyom and Barkin Ladi areas.

Students of the University of Port Harcourt on 31/08 violently protest the death of a fellow student they claim at the hands of doctor neglect. The students, who chased away doctors, nurses and workers at the hospital barricaded the East-West road and chanted solidarity songs.
While in route to Jos to protest a number of killings in their area four are killed by unknown individuals while travelling in Barakin Ladi.
Health workers protest pay in Kaduna.
Former lawmakers protest a non-payment of a severance package at the National Assembly.
Protest at Nnamdi Azikiwe Airport over a management arrangement.
Military forces retake Gambaru, Ngala on 01/09. The source alludes to a battle. Causalities not known.

Mounted on horseback, Boko Haram attacked Kolori and its neighbouring village Baana-imam, both of Damboa LGA late in the day of 01/09. Between twenty-four and twenty-six reported dead between the two villages, though the majority of deaths (18) occurred in Kolori.
Workers of Costain West Africa Plc in Lagos protested over unpaid salaries on 09/02.
Youths protest in Asaba a spate of killings, arson and kidnappings by the ""White Ladders"" cult group in Sapele.
Telecommunication subscribers protest in several locations in Abuja over persistent loss of service.
A women's group protest a lack of female government appointees by President Buhari.
PDP supporters from Kogi protest at the parties secretariat in Abuja over their displeasure over the conduct of the ward congress of the party.
At least five civilians have been killed and four others injured from a Boko Haram attack on Mainari (Mairami).
Boko Haram attacks Kirawa, killing 53 and injuring many others.
Unidentified gunmen attack and abduct a monarch in Gbarantoru.
A Boko Haram suicide bomber attacks a market in Askira, 30 dead. Date not known - source dated 05/09.
A women's group protest a lack of female government appointees by President Buhari for the second time in two days.
A group leads a protest to the Lagos State House of Assembly over an alleged illegal eviction of residents of former school of Nursing in Ikoyi. Date not known - source dated 05/09.
Unidentified gunmen ""at the weekend"" abduct an Anglican bishop along the Onicha Ugbo/Ewhohimi road in Edo State.

column8: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: Arrests: Police raid a MASSOB headquarters and make 200 arrests.
Military forces kill three suspected ""militants"" (origin unknown) in Odimodi, recover weapons.
Two community leaders are discovered dead outside Namnai village, Gassol LGA on 06/09. Perpetrators unknown.
Sanitation workers protest over the non-payment of salaries at the Lagos State house assembly.
Victims of Boko Haram protest in Abuja to demand improved treatment from the government.
Members of the NLC hold a protest again corruption in Lagos.

column9: PDP: Peoples Democratic Party; Aid Workers (Nigeria)
column17: Five unidentified gunmen kidnap the political aid of the PDP governor of Bayelsa.
An Israeli national working for a construction company in a community known as ""WASA"" is shot and killed during a kidnap attempt. The motive for the kidnapping is not known.
The University of Lagos students force the closure of the school, barricading the entrance following the death of a fellow student.
Members of the NLC hold a protest again corruption in Abuja.
A prominent doctor is kidnapped in Abakaliki. The demands of the kidnappers are not known.

column7: ASUP: Academic Staff Union of Polytechnics
column17: Members of ASUP protest insecurity following the murder (details unknown) of a priest.
Police and commercial motorcyclists clash in Ikorodu following an attempt at impounding several of their vehicles. One death reported.
Protesters gather at the Lagos State Governors Office to demonstrate against government corruption.
A female suicide bomber of unknown origin kills twelve, including herself in Madagali on 11/09.
Between three and ten (varied by source) are killed in a suicide blast at a refugee camp for those displaced by Boko Haram. Perpetrators not identified or known.

Unidentified gunmen kill a vigilante leader and a family member at his home in Kankara. The gunmen entered the village late in the evening and began firing their weapons into the air before targeting the leader.
State police and a group of herdsmen clash at an unknown location in Anambra state. Casualities reported, numbers not known (coded as 3). Date not clear: source dated 11/09.
Three members of a four-man robbery gang are beaten to death by a band of vigilantes in Yenagoa ""at the weekend.""
Suspected Fulanis attack Zakupwang community, Foron District and Fan village in Fan District of Barkin Ladi Local Government council on 13/09. Twenty dead between the two towns.
Rival groups clash over rights of a church building. No reported injuries.
Suspected Fulanis attack Zakupwang community, Foron District and Fan village in Fan District of Barkin Ladi Local Government council on 13/09. Twenty dead between the two towns.

A Muslim group violently protests the mounting of a roadblock in Tudun Wada, police open fire on the group and later clash. Four injured. There had been tension between Muslim and Christian groups in the area, and the protesting group evidently believed the road block would unfairly restrict their movement.
Graduates engaged by the Subsidy Reinvestment and Empowerment Programme, (Sure-P) took to the streets of Makurdi in Benue State, to protest the non-payment of their stipends.
700 employees of a company protest in Lagos their recent termination.

column7: ASUU: Academic Staff Union of Universities
column17: Members of ASUU protest the non-payment of several months of salaries.
Students protest in Yenagoa over the use of fees used for studying abroad by an Amnesty Programme.
A group violently protest arrests by Federal Road Safety Commission by destroying several of their vehicles and attacking reporters covering the event along the Abuja-Lokoja road.

column6: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: Members of MASSOB abduct a Catholic priest in Onitsha, force him to conduct a mass. Police later arrested some of the perpetrators. Date of event vague: at least on or before 14/09.
Teachers at Adeniran Ogunsanya College of Education, Ijanikin, protest over an alleged planned move by the Lagos State government to cut their salaries.
Teachers of Adeniran Ogunsanya College of Education protest an proposed salary cut.
Fulanis attack a Tiv village in revenge of an earlier attack (details not known) from the Tiv. Nine reported deaths.
Students protest over a tax in Oshogbo on 15/09.
Workers of an oil company protest, blocking roads in a labour dispute.
Suspected Fulanis attack mainly Christian Kadunung village during the mid-afternoon, killing 19 people and destroying several houses.
Arrests: Military forces capture 200 members of Boko Haram in Adamwa, making the announcement at Mubi. The date(s) of capture is not known, announcement made on 16/09. No violence reported.
Road maintenance workers protest non-payment of salaries in Katsina.
Protesting labourers block a road in Koton Karifi.

column7: SSANU: Senior Staff Association of Nigerian Universities; Teachers (Nigeria)
column17: Members of SSANU barricade the main gate of the University of Lagos in protest of their wages.
Civil rights groups protest the drowning of a military cadet during a training exercise.
Oshogbo students protest for an improved tax status. A similar protest took place in the town two days earlier.
Boko Haram attacks two passenger buses on 18/09 near Mainuk, killing ""scores.""
Following the killing of a farmer over an unknown disagreement, a group of youths attacked the suspected perpetrators (a Fulani) home, setting it ablaze.
A series of four suspected Boko Haram suicide bomb blasts on 20/09 causes 117 deaths (as counted over several days) and numerous injuries in Maiduguri.

Students of Osun State owned tertiary institutions protested at the government secretariat in Osogbo over continued strikes by their lecturers due to non-payment of salaries. The students blocked the entrance to a government building, preventing the governor from entering.
Healthcare workers protest for a more favourable pay structure.
Students in Osun State protest a prolonged teacher strike in the state. The protest took place at the state government secretariat.
Protest over schools in Isolo is led by an elderly woman.
Public service workers protest non-payment of salaries at the government house in Ajure.
Suspected Fulanis killed 35 people, including a policeman and a village chief in Alawa on 22/09.
Twenty-eight traders killed and 50 injured in a deadly suicide attacks at a market in Monguno town. Perpetrators not known.
The workers of Delta Steel Company in Ovwian, Delta State staged a protest at the companies premises over non-payment of salaries and retirement emoluments.
Aviation workers protest over salary and the indebtedness of several airlines at Murtala Mohammed International Airport outside of Lagos.

Students protest the continued closure of several campuses forcibly prevent the deputy governor from entering the Government Secretariat. The protest lasted for over an hour. This was the second consecutive day of protesting.
Military forces overrun the Boko Haram areas Janguoriri and Bulatori, rescuing 241 women and children and capturing a top commander (Bulama Modu) and 42 others. Casualties not known.
Military forces overrun the Boko Haram areas Janguoriri and Bulatori, rescuing 241 women and children and capturing a top commander (Bulama Modu) and 42 others. Casualties not known.
Military forces capture Bamki from Boko Haram, several militants (numbers not known) were killed and several others captured alive.

Groups celebrating Eid violently protest over salaries in Ilorin. The protesters threw objects toward the direction of government officials as well as a traditional ruler, who was physically assaulted.
Boko Haram attacks the Madagali communities of Sabon Gari, Kafin Hausa and Bakin Dutse over three days, leaving scores dead and 50 houses destroyed.
Unidentified gunmen attack Obrikom and Omoku communities in Rivers, kill 13.
Unidentified gunmen attack Obrikom and Omoku communities in Rivers, kill 13.

Former vice chairman of Patani local government area was abducted by gunmen and whisked away to an unknown location. The victim was abducted along Isoko Road, close to Uloho Avenue junction. The reason for the abduction is not known.
Unidentified gunmen attacked the office of the Department of State Security in Lokoja. Police at the facility engaged the attackers in a shootout, one police death reported.
Pensioners protest in Abuja over an exclusion from bailout.
Boko Haram attacks the Madagali communities of Sabon Gari, Kafin Hausa and Bakin Dutse over three days, leaving scores dead and 50 houses destroyed.
A suspected rapist is attacked and beaten by a vigilante group.
Boko Haram attacks the Madagali communities of Sabon Gari, Kafin Hausa and Bakin Dutse over three days, leaving scores dead and 50 houses destroyed.

Unidentified gunmen launched an attack on an office of the Department of State Security Service for unknown reason. Three members of the perpetrator group were reported killed, along with one security officer. The attackers were referred to as ""thugs"" and ""gang members"" by the source.
Agreement: 200 members of Boko Haram surrender to government forces in Banki, a day following the capture of the town by military forces. Date unknown - announcement made on 26/09.
Boko Haram attacks Mailari village in Konduga Local Government Area (LGA) of Borno killing between 9 and 20 and destroying several homes.
Military forces attack a Boko Haram group in the Kwatarha and Torikwaptir general area of Gwoza, killing a wanted leader and injuring others, all of whom escaped.

Pro-Saraki Supporters barricade the national assembly in support of the Senators recent political actions. Some of the groups in the protest are: Ohanaeze Ndi-Igbo Youth Movement (ONYM) and the Coalition of Civil Society and Market Executive for Policy Stability (COCMEP) and New Nigeria Agenda.
University of Lagos protest an insect infiltration at one of their residence halls.
Residents of Akure protest insecurity after a local leader was abducted by suspected Fulani gunmen.
Unidentified gunmen decapitate two people at their home in Igbo-Eze North LGA. Following investigation, it was determined no valuables were removed from the property.
Traders protest government threats of relocation.
APC and PDP supporters clash at a court tribunal in Abeokuta.
Four are dead in a Boko Haram attack on Bitiku and Kubu, Hong LGA.
Fulani gunmen abduct the traditional ruler of the traditional ruler of Apaa-Bunu community in Kabba-Bunu Local Government Area of Kogi State. The motive of the abductors is not known.

Property destruction: Boko Haram reportedly poison the water source for Kangallam village along Marte and Abadam axis in Borno State, leading to the deaths of a number of cattle. No human death yet reported. The date of the attack was not reported, the military made the announcement on 30/09.
Four are dead in a Boko Haram attack on Bitiku and Kubu, Hong LGA.
Maritime workers protest unsafe working conditions in Lagos after the death of a colleague.
At least seven explosions detonate in Maiduguri on 01/10, killing a ""number"" of people. Boko Haram are the suspected perpetrator. The army later confirmed 14 dead, 39 injured.
Seven are dead in a Boko Haram attack on Kirsinga.
No fewer than four persons have been confirmed dead in an attack by Fulani herdsmen in Kwanan Mariga, Rafi local government area, Niger State.
A group of workers and their supporters protest against government policies they call ""anti-people."" Protest took place in Lagos and Oshogbo.
Students protest ""anti-education policies"" of the governor.
A group of workers and their supporters protest against government policies they call ""anti-people."" Protest took place in Lagos and Oshogbo.
Students protest in Ibadan over the """"poor"""" state of education in the country.
A pair of Boko Haram suspected suicide bombers target Kuje and nearby Nyanya, both in suburban Abuja. At least 18 dead and 41 wounded. Boko Haram officially claimed responsibility over the next days.
Over 200 persons from different parts of Lagos assembled at the Lagos State House of Assembly to protest after being defrauded of a sum of money in a housing scheme.
A pair of Boko Haram suspected suicide bombers target Kuje and nearby Nyanya, both in suburban Abuja. At least 18 dead and 41 wounded. Boko Haram officially claimed responsibility over the next days.
Residents of Ilasamaja block the entrance of the Eko Electricity Distribution Company (EKEDC) in protest of frequent electricity blackouts.
Residents of Badia and Amukoko areas of Lagos, took to the streets ""at weekend"", to protest an electricity tariff.
Students of the Federal Polytechnic Ede staged a protest to Ibadan Electricity Distribution Company over frequent power outages. The protest occurred ""at the weekend.""
Multiple explosions in Maiduguri on 04/10. Perpetrators unknown, ten deaths reported.
Midwives protest unpaid state salaries at the Lagos State house assembly on 05/10.
Residents of Ila Orangun in Osun State protest at the city hall of Igbonibi over the governors intention to merge a group of schools.
Youths of the APC violently protest their parties gubernatorial candidate selection. Many of the protesters vandalized a party headquarters.
Retired teacher protest outside the office of the Enugu Speaker of House after non-payment of pensions.
Two suicide bombers suspected to be members of Boko Haram detonated explosives in a mosque in Gubio town of Borno State, killing a dozen worshippers during an early morning prayer session.
Property destruction: Soldiers of the 21 Brigade destroy Boko Haram camps near Bama. No reported human violence.
A series of multiple, coordinated attacks during the morning hours in Damaturu, 18 dead. Boko Haram are the suspected perpetrators.
Members of the NLC ""stormed"" industrial locations in Lagos, protesting for greater worker rights. No reported violence.
Following their attack on Geidam, Boko Haram forces encounter military forces at nearby Ngollom village. Ten Boko Haram dead and others wounded.
100 Boko Haram fighters are gunned down when they attempted to attack a military position in Goniri. Weapons were recovered as well. Seven soldiers also killed.
Employees of a Daily Independent protest the closure of an office in Ogba, Ikeja.
Boko Haram attacks Geidam town, shooting sporadically. Causalities not known.

The families of the victims of a stampede at 2014 job recruitment drive protest outside the National Assembly in Abuja to protest government promises unfulfilled, which included employment of kin. The protest occurred on either 08/10 or 09/10.
Eighteen dead and other injuries reported following a pair of suicide bomb blasts in Abuja. Boko Haram suspected.

The youths in Kwara South under the aegis of Coalition Groups of APC members in Ilorin protested_ on 10/09 against the nomination of Alhaji Lai Mohammed as minister from the state, describing it as ""cheating"". The protesters were ""earlier"" (exacted date not known) protested against another nominated candidate in Ajasse Ipo.
Unidentified gunmen killed an oil worker at the Kolo Creek Oilfields, reasons unknown.

The youths in Kwara South under the aegis of Coalition Groups of APC members in Ilorin protested_ on 10/09 against the nomination of Alhaji Lai Mohammed as minister from the state, describing it as ""cheating"". The protesters were ""earlier"" (exacted date not known) protested against another nominated candidate in Ajasse Ipo.
Boko Haram attacks Balakari on 10/10, a village in Chibok Local Government Area, killing four and burning houses.
An explosion in a Oworonsoki beer parlour injures five in 11/10. Perpetrators not known.
Students protest a lecturer strike in Oshogbo, block traffic and engage in running battles with police.
Students of the University of Calabar protest poor sanitary conditions at the university on 12/10. The protest caused the school to close.

Unknown gunmen attacked and shot dead the Managing Director of Lekki Free Trade Zone in the Ibeju/Lekki area. A injury was also reported. The attack sparked a violent protest and battle with police in the Okunraiye area of the LGA.

Unknown gunmen attacked and shot dead the Managing Director of Lekki Free Trade Zone in the Ibeju/Lekki area. A injury was also reported. The attack sparked a violent protest and battle with police in the Okunraiye area of the LGA.
Unidentified gunmen abduct five teachers in Agbar-Ndele. The motive for the kidnapping is not known.
Boko Haram (actor not confirmed)  attacks military forces in Okene. The military response led to the deaths of two of the attackers. The Daily Trust reports 15 dead.
Youths in Akure battle with Igbo indigenes after the youths accused the Ibgos of insulting their monarch.
Traders on 13/10 staged a peaceful protest over alleged continued lock down of their shops at the Wuye Ultra-Modern Market in Abuja.

Multiple bomb blasts reported in Maiduguri on 13/10, later determined to be suicide blasts. The explosives occurred at three minutes intervals and seven people were confirmed dead, including the three suicide [Boko Haram], while 11 others sustained various degrees of injuries.
Placard carrying directors and professors from the Nigerian Institute of International Affairs protest on Victoria Island over the organizations leadership.
An angry mob at Ungwan-Rukuba New Road, around the Nasarawo area of Jos burnt a 25-year-old man, Mantau Rati Black, for allegedly stabbing a person.
Former students gather in Lafia to protest fees.
Boko Haram launched a series of suicide attacks outside of Maiduguri in Gumsuri beginning the evening of 15/10, continuing into 16/10 in Maiduguri proper. 37 dead over the two days.

column7: NULGE: Nigerian Union of Local Government Employees
column17: Members of NULGE protest over salary delay in Abuja on 15/10.

column7: NULGE: Nigerian Union of Local Government Employees
column17: Members of NULGE protest over a delay in pensions.
The Kogi State chapter of the NUP protest in Lokoja over pensions.
Two young men were reported killed and another seriously injured by members of a vigilance group in Papalanto. The victims, all Igede from Benue State, were believed attacked for this reason.

""Scores"" dead after suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers attacked three targets at Tudun Natsira and one at Banakwai all in Ajilari area of Gommari in Maiduguri. The targets were believed to be mosques - the attackers were disguised as worshippers. Death totals reached 37 over the two days of attacks.
Boko Haram suicide bombers attack Dar village, Madagali LGA on 17/10 of Madagali, kill 12 residents.

column7: APGA: All Progressives Grand Alliance Party
column17: APGA supporters and some civil society groups ""at the weekend"" held a protest at the parties secretariat over a series of rejected petitions by their parties candidates.

column7: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column17: One person was feared dead and 15 others injured in Ibadan, the Oyo State capital, during a bloody clash between members of National Union of Road Transport Workers (NURTW) and Tipper Drivers Association. The fracas began on 18/10 and continued into the following day.

Military forces ambush a group of Boko Haram members, killing 30 after a gun battle. Three soldiers abducted. Location a matter of dispute - the article lead describes the action in Borno, though the text of the article claims the event occurred in villages of Kirchinga/Imirsa of Madagali, Adamawa. The ambush may have been a response to a suicide attack in the area the previous day. Boko Haram reportedly killed 3 soldiers an abducted one senior officer while disguised a local vigilantes.
A suicide bomber from suspected Boko Haram was shot dead by security forces during an attempt to bomb the headquarters of 7 Division of the Nigeria Army in Maiduguri.

column7: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column17: One person was feared dead and 15 others injured in Ibadan, the Oyo State capital, during a bloody clash between members of National Union of Road Transport Workers (NURTW) and Tipper Drivers Association. The fracas began on 18/10 and continued into the following day.
Dockworkers protest safety and labour issues at Nigerdock, Snake Island, Lagos.
Scores of protesters and family members of a woman who had allegedly died at the hands of police protest at Ebute Meta Chief Magistrates Court on Lagos Mainland for justice in the matter.
Okada riders protest a tax levied by the Niger State government in Minna.

Military forces, along with a local militia group attack and kill 150 members of Boko Haram in Madagali LGA, recover weapons on 20/10. A gun battle between the two actors had occurred several days previous.
A vigilante mob beats a robbery suspect to death in Ihiagwa.
Pro-Biafra protesters demonstrate in Port Harcourt and Awka against the recent arrest of a director a pro-Biafra radio station.
Suspected Fulanis attack a Berom village on 20/10, two killed, four missing.

Pro-Biafra protesters demonstrate in Port Harcourt and Awka against the recent arrest of a director a pro-Biafra radio station. Twenty protest were arrested the following day in Port Harcourt and charged with treason.
Igbo traders protest a tax levied against them in Ado-Ekiti.
A indigenous group protest non-government representation in Abuja.
Fulani gunmen attack KatanKa Village in Wukari Local Government, eight dead.
An electricity union protests for pay in Abuja.
Protesters in Calabar call for the suspicion of a court official after their petitions against alleged PDP lawbreaking were not met.
Students of the University of Lagos (UNILAG) protest for unknown reasons on 21/10.
Twenty bus passengers are shot killed by Boko Haram in Jigalta.

column7: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column9: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column17: Two factions of NURTW clash over union leadership in Owo on 21/10.
Unidentified gunmen attack an advisor to the governor of Rivers State in Buguma. No causalities reported.

column7: IPOB: Indigenous Peoples of Biafra; Journalists (Nigeria)
column17: A pro-Biafran group known as the IPOB protest in Orlu for the release of a like-minded radio host who had been recently jailed on political grounds. Similar protests took place in two others cities across the country the past week.
Electrical workers protest against the planned liquidation of a power holding company in Abuja. A similar protest occurred in the city the previous day.
A suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber attacks a mosque in Maiduguri on 23/10, 28 dead, plus injuries.
A suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber attacks a mosque in Yola on 23/10, at least 30 reported dead, many others injured.
Unidentified gunmen attack and kill a pastor at his home in Yenagoa during the early morning hours for reasons unknown.
An unidentified gunman stormed a market at Leleyi community in Kwali Area Council of the Federal Capital Territory, killing a Igbio trader. The reason for the attack is not known.

Youths of two communities, Oye and Ilupeju Ekiti in Oye Local Government Area of Ekiti State become violent after a boundary dispute boils over. The clash was said to have disrupted free flow of traffic on the Ifaki-Oye-Ikole-Omuo Highway. Police made several arrests. Injuries reported.

Four suspected Boko Haram female suicide bombers detonate in the Dala Yazaram neighbourhood of Maiduguri on 24/10, at least three dead, plus the bombers The attack comes a day following another, larger attack in the city. Note: One of the attackers was arrested before the attack.
Students in Edde protest frequent power outages ""at the weekend.""
Four unidentified suicide bombers attempt an attack in Maiduguri on 25/10, kill only themselves.
Residents of Labora-Owode Community in Ibeju-Lekki Local Government Area of Lagos State, ""stormed"" the Lagos State House of Assembly to protest the activities of land grabbers in the community.
Boko Haram attacks Jakana on 27/10, kills eight villagers.
State workers protest non-payment of salary in Makurdi. The protest chased lawmakers away from the house assembly during the protest. No violent incidents reported.

A total of 338 hostages held by militant group Boko Haram have been rescued by troops who raided enclaves of the rebels near the Sambisa Forest located in Nigeria's northeastern state of Borno on 27/10. The rescue took place following an air strike by the country's air forces. Causalities not reported.

Hundreds of ex -militants from the Niger Delta barricaded the corporate headquarters of the Niger Delta Development Commission (NDDC) in protest of neglect from the amnesty programme. The protesters also blocked roads in the area.
Staff of Kwara State Water Corporation, Ilorin, protested the non-payment of salaries.
Military forces capture four members of Boko Haram following an hour-long battle in Karchiga village of Madagali Local Government Area. No casualties reported.
While covering a clash between police and Okada riders in suburban Lagos a reporter is assaulted by police.

Police clash with Okada Riders protesting the seizure and impounding of their motorbikes in the Ajao, Ikeja area of Lagos metropolis. Except for a reporter who was attacked by police for covering the event, there were no reported injuries by the warring sides.
Youths block roads and burn tyres near Akure airport in protest of a colleague who had been allegedly shot by police. The Governor addressed the protesters and appealed for calm.

Two suspected armed robbers are beaten to death by a mob along the Maiduguri road in Bauchi State. The two victims are from Tilden Fulani in Toro LGA, though the exact location of the attack is not known.

Vehicular movement was disrupted for several hours along the Onitsha-Awka old road following a protest by members of the Association of Small and Medium Scale (SME) Industries, Anambra State over power outages. The protesters allegedly numbering more than 20,000 stormed the Ogid(i) office of the EEDC with placards to express their grievances over what they called exploitation at the hands of the company.
Elected Rivers State PDP members protest the conformation of an APC minister.
A police officer shot and killed a truck driver in Orile after refusing to pay a bribe. The killing sparked a violent protest from the mans truck-driving colleagues.
A police officer shot and killed a truck driver in Orile after refusing to pay a bribe. The killing sparked a violent protest from the mans truck-driving colleagues.
Port Harcourt market traders protest the nullification of a gubernatorial election.

Residents of Adadama and Amagu Ikwo communities in Ebonyi and Cross River states clash in Amagu Ikwo over trespassing by one of the two groups. Injuries reported and many houses destroyed in the fighting. The clash occurred ""at the weekend.""

Two market women have been killed and dozens of others injured in Akwa Ibom state when unidentified ""militants"" attacked a market located at the boundary between Okopedi-Use-Ikot-Oku, Ibiono Ibom local government area and Obot Etim, Itu local government area.
Military forces engage in a gun battle in Dunamari (Duwabafi) with Boko Haram, four Boko Haram dead.

column7: IPOB: Indigenous Peoples of Biafra; Journalists (Nigeria)
column17: Supporters of IPOB hold a protest against the incarceration of a radio personality and fellow supporter. The group charges the arrest was politically motivated.

Six led a protest in Esa-Oke, Obokun Local Government of Osun State against the alleged plan by the state government to merge the polytechnics and colleges of education in the state. The small group barred an entrance to a school, preventing people from entering.
Unidentified gunmen kill a man and kidnap his niece in Bauchi on 02/11. The reason for the attack is not known.
Two police officers are nearly lynched following a misunderstanding following a land deal.

Itsekiri Joint Action Group, IJAG, a coalition of organizations of Itsekiri ethnic nationality in Warri, Delta State, laid siege to the office of Delta State Oil Producing Areas Development Commission, DESOPADEC, shutting down its activities on charges of ""marginalization"" toward the ethnic group. Police arrest 11.
Workers at a chemical company in Warri protest non-payment of salaries.
Students of a school in Malumfashi LGA of Katsina State run riot, destroying their building. The protest is related to a school rule they believed unjust.

PDP supporters attack a group of protesting APC members, suspected at the direction of the governor. The group was protesting a neglected garbage dump site. In retaliation, APC members attack a PDP campaign group (date unknown; soon after). No injuries reported from either attack.
Pensioners numbering over 200 staged a protest to Government House in Makurdi over the non payment of their arrears and gratuities by the Governors administration.

PDP supporters attack a group of protesting APC members, suspected at the direction of the governor. The group was protesting a neglected garbage dump site. In retaliation, APC members attack a PDP campaign group (date unknown; soon after). No injuries reported from either attack.
Dozens of youths in Kauru Local Government Area of Kaduna State staged a protest over the nomination of candidate for the position of education secretary by the local government council in Kauru.
Military forces destroy and seize a Boko Haram camp at Kerenoa Area of Monguno, Borno State on 04/11. Two reported dead, weapons recovered.

column7: NAWOJ: National Association of Women Journalists; Women (Nigeria)
column17: NAWOJ protested at the Lagos Assembly against violence toward women.
Supporters of IPOB protest, block roads in Asaba. Police dispersed the protesters with gas.

column7: IPOB: Indigenous Peoples of Biafra; Journalists (Nigeria)
column17: IPOB stages a protest, blocking roads, in Onitsha over the continued detention of their leader, a notable radio personality. One protester was feared dead for unknown reason (fatality unconfirmed).
Butchers protest along the Ado-Iworoko road, outside Ado-Ekiti in protest of a tax levied against cows.
Police arrest 83 Biafran supporters during a protest in Yenagoa. It is believed the group was affiliated with IPOB, a group that has been staging protests throughout the region on 06/11.
Biafran supporters protest in Port Harcourt. It is believed the group had affiliations with IPOB.
IPOB and MASSOB protests in Imo State, near the border with Bayelsa, exact location not known. Police fire tear gas, arrest 31. No violence reported from protesters.
IPOB protest in Nkpor, Ogidi, Abagana and Amawbia (Awka) and Awka for the release of a political prisoner on 07/11.
IPOB protest in Nkpor, Ogidi, Abagana and Amawbia (Awka) and Awka for the release of a political prisoner on 07/11.
IPOB protest in Nkpor, Ogidi, Abagana and Amawbia (Awka) and Awka for the release of a political prisoner on 07/11.
IPOB protest in Nkpor, Ogidi, Abagana and Amawbia (Awka) and Awka for the release of a political prisoner on 07/11.

Members of the APC and PDP clash and exchange gunfire in pre-meditated violence over two days in Wukari following the judgement of the Taraba Governorship Election. No fewer than twelve killed, property destroyed.

Military forces conduct an offensive against four Boko Haram camps, overtaking all and rescuing 20 prisoners and killing ""a number"" of Boko Haram. The operations occurred in Bornos north-east, in Rigaga and its adjourning villages in Bama axis.

column7: IPOB: Indigenous Peoples of Biafra; Journalists (Nigeria)
column17: IPOB protest in Aba over the detention of a like minded radio personality.
A group of youths protest a road accident, set five trucks ablaze.

Members of the APC and PDP clash and exchange gunfire in pre-meditated violence over two days in Wukari following the judgement of the Taraba Governorship Election. No fewer than twelve killed, property destroyed.

column7: IPOB: Indigenous Peoples of Biafra; Journalists (Nigeria)
column17: IPOB protest in Aba for a second day over the detention of a like minded radio personality.

column7: IPOB: Indigenous Peoples of Biafra; Journalists (Nigeria)
column17: IPOB, protesting the detention of a radio commentator in Enugu are met by an army barricade near a base. No violent incidents.

No fewer than 22 persons, including women and children were feared killed when suspected Fulani herdsmen in the early hours of Monday, attacked nine communities in Dekina Local Council of Kogi State. The affected communities are: Agojeju, Ikpoba, Ojeh, Ajomojayi, Ajadaji, Idochi, Ojiyanawo, Ulaja and Oganenigu.

column7: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra; Journalists (Nigeria)
column17: MASSOB and IPOB protest on Asa on 09/11 over the detention of a like-minded radio personality.
Unidentified gunmen kill a Labour Party candidate at Orhunwhorhun, Udu Local Government Area of the state. Date of the murder unknown - source dated 09/11.
Workers of the Cocoa Research Institute of Nigeria protest for the removal of the institutes directors accusing leadership of """"maladministration.""""

No fewer than 22 persons, including women and children were feared killed when suspected Fulani herdsmen in the early hours of Monday, attacked nine communities in Dekina Local Council of Kogi State. The affected communities are: Agojeju, Ikpoba, Ojeh, Ajomojayi, Ajadaji, Idochi, Ojiyanawo, Ulaja and Oganenigu.

column7: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: MASSOB protesters begin a march from Abia State to Port Harcourt beginning their trek at 6am.

column7: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: MASSOB protest in Port Harcourt, police make many arrests following the use of tear gas. The demonstrations lasted much of the day and in various parts of the city. Protester violence reported. The protesters had marched from neighbouring Abia State, beginning their trek early in the morning hours.

Thousands of women in Taraba State on 10/11 embarked on a peaceful protect across the streets of Jalingo to protest the ruling of the Governorship Election Petitions Tribunal which had decided a political opponent as governor.
Two group of youths clash over either a female acquaintance OR the recent death of a Delta Labour Party candidate. Police restore order, no reported injuries.

Military forces clear the Boko Haram camps at Nwalemer, Mallemiri and Bale, and in Gwoza axis, killing four members of Boko Haram (numbers vary by source, some as high as nine), rescuing 61 captives. Date(s) unknown - military made announcement on 11/11.

Military forces clear the Boko Haram camps at Nwalemer, Mallemiri and Bale, and in Gwoza axis, killing four members of Boko Haram (numbers vary by source, some as high as nine), rescuing 61 captives. Date(s) unknown - military made announcement on 11/11.

Military forces clear the Boko Haram camps at Nwalemer, Mallemiri and Bale, and in Gwoza axis, killing four members of Boko Haram (numbers vary by source, some as high as nine), rescuing 61 captives. Date(s) unknown - military made announcement on 11/11.

5,000 pro-Biafran protesters (affiliation not known, likely MASSOB and/or IPOB) blocked the Aba/Port Harcourt express way, calling for the release of a radio commentator. Police open fire on the group with live bullets and tear gas, one confirmed death, plus injures.

Military forces clear the Boko Haram camps at Nwalemer, Mallemiri and Bale, and in Gwoza axis, killing four members of Boko Haram (numbers vary by source, some as high as nine), rescuing 61 captives. Date(s) unknown - military made announcement on 11/11.
Members of a consumer protection forum protest against an electricity tax.

column7: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra; Journalists (Nigeria)
column17: Members of MASSOB and its faction, IPOB protest over the incarceration of a radio host in Owerri. Date not known - source dated 13/11.
A villager mob kills four suspected armed cattle thieves in Santar Naade of Kankara, LGA.

""At the weekend"" military forces attack Boko Haram stronghold, overtaking the Borno State areas of Gubumbali, Kardewa, Anguwan Fulani Rogo, Anguwan Fulani Kaderwa, Dure Fadagwe Christian, Fdacwe Muni and Balazala, recovering weapons. 19 dead in total, divided among two events. The operation was in coordination with operation in Azare and Monguno.

""At the weekend"" military forces attack and gain control of a Boko Haram location at Gasarwa, which lies between Monguno and Maiduguri. The troops killed 18 Boko Haram and recovery an array of weapons.

""At the weekend"" military forces attack Boko Haram stronghold, overtaking the Borno State areas of Gubumbali, Kardewa, Anguwan Fulani Rogo, Anguwan Fulani Kaderwa, Dure Fadagwe Christian, Fdacwe Muni and Balazala, recovering weapons. 19 dead in total, divided among two events. The operation was in coordination with operation in Azare and Monguno.
Boko Haram attacks military forces at Kardewa, Borno State, ""as the weekend"" but are repelled. Causalities not known.
""At the weekend"" military forces attack and gain control of a Boko Haram location at Boboshe village near Durkwa, Hawul LGA, recovering weapons.

column7: IPOB: Indigenous Peoples of Biafra; Journalists (Nigeria)
column17: Members of IBOP and MASSOB march through Umuahia South in protest of an incarcerated radio commentator who shares their views. Soldiers following the protesters reportedly beat a journalist coving the even when the reporter began taking photographs.
Unidentified gunmen abduct an Ijaw musician and kill a bystander in Polaku. The abduction led to a protest for release later in the week.
Residents of Lagos State barricaded the two entrances to the State House of Assembly for several hours in protest of a new electricity tax.

column7: IPOB: Indigenous Peoples of Biafra; Journalists (Nigeria)
column17: IPOB protests in Umuahia on 16/11 over the detention of a like-minded radio commentator.
Students of the Akwa Ibom State University (AKSU), Obio Akpa Campus protest the closure of a school portal on 17/11.
PDP supporters protest at their parties headquarters over the ruling of a governorship election in Taraba State.
Members of the PDP protest a political attack against a preferred politician in Benin City.
A women's group protests the plans of a medical facility in their area.
Suspected Boko Haram detonates explosives in a suicide attack in Yola the evening of 17/11, killing 34 and injured 80. Numbers vary by source.
Non-violent activity: The Deputy Senate President, Ike Ekweremadu, escaped a attempted assassination attempt by unknown perpetrators without injury.
Boko Haram and military forces clash in Gudunbali on 18/11, two officers and 105 soldiers reported missing. Military officials later dispute the missing soldier claim.
A man suspected to be a kidnapper is lynched by a mob in Lagos on 18/11.
A Peoples Democratic Party ( PDP) youth leader in Tunruku ward of Igabi local government area of Kaduna State was strangled to death by suspected hired assassinated on 18/11.
On 18 November 2015, a local armed group clashed with Fulanis in an area between Ivbiaro and Ihevbie villages in Owan East LGA. One death reported.

Fifteen traditional rulers in four local government councils of Osun State staged protest to the Osogbo Office of Ibadan Electricity Distribution Company (IBEDC) over electricity outage in their domains for several months.
Residents of Kiri-Kasosi village, Gamawa LGA, attack and kill a robbery suspect.
APC and PDP supporters clash in Ekeremor, one member of the APC dead, others injured. Police later arrested the perpetrator. The clash was related to disagreements of a governorship election.

Nigerian Army supported by Nigeria Air force aircraft, have killed about 40 Boko Haram members and destroyed their rocket fabrication factory after carrying out several raids and attacks on Boko Haram camps in Matali, Damboa Local Government Area of Borno State.

column7: IPOB: Indigenous Peoples of Biafra; Journalists (Nigeria)
column17: Members of IBOP protest for the release of a jailed radio commentator.
Two suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers detonate explosives in Tarauni, Kano on 18/11. Nineteen dead, 53 injured. Numbers vary by source. The attackers were believed to be female.
Air Forces bomb Boko Haram positions in Mada. Causalities, damage not known or reported. Date of raid not known - military announcement on 19/11.
Air Forces bomb Boko Haram positions in Kumshe. Causalities, damage not known or reported. Date of raid not known - military announcement on 19/11.
Air Forces bomb Boko Haram positions in Karetu. Causalities, damage not known or reported. Date of raid not known - military announcement on 19/11.
Air Forces bomb Boko Haram positions in Banki. Causalities, damage not known or reported. Date of raid not known - military announcement on 19/11.
Air Forces bomb Boko Haram positions in Gambaru. Causalities, damage not known or reported. Date of raid not known - military announcement on 19/11.
Residents of Gbaji-Seme protest prolonged power outages. Date of the protest not known, source dates 19/11.

Neighbouring Benin forces invade 16 communities in Baruten LGA, raising the Benin flag in the effected area. No violence reported. Many civilians fled the area. The areas effected include: Okuta, Ogomne, Bwin, Gandasunon, Kpuru, Woru Wuren Kparu, Ajuba1, Ajuba 2, Saka Yeruman Kparu, Monta, Dotin Kparu, Halidun Kparu, Yakubun Kparu, Sonsi, Gunosani, Alhaji Kparu, Yodo Mankparu and Simen Kparu. The area in question was demarcated among Britain and France in 1914. The response from the Nigerian government is not clear, and the extent of Benin control is a questionable. Date(s) not clear.

Fifteen traditional rulers in Ayedade, Irewole, Isokan and Ife North Local Government Areas of Osun State stormed the Osogbo office of the Ibadan Electricity Distribution Company (IBEDC) to protest power outage in their communities.

Neighbouring Benin forces invade 16 communities in Baruten LGA, raising the Benin flag in the effected area. No violence reported. Many civilians fled the area. The areas effected include: Okuta, Ogomne, Bwin, Gandasunon, Kpuru, Woru Wuren Kparu, Ajuba1, Ajuba 2, Saka Yeruman Kparu, Monta, Dotin Kparu, Halidun Kparu, Yakubun Kparu, Sonsi, Gunosani, Alhaji Kparu, Yodo Mankparu and Simen Kparu. The area in question was demarcated among Britain and France in 1914. The response from the Nigerian government is not clear, and the extent of Benin control is a questionable. Date(s) not clear.
Widows and traders in Sapele, Delta State on 20/11 staged a peaceful protest against the state governor over stall allocation.

Protesters under the aegis of National Youth Vanguard of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), protested at the parties national secretariat in Abuja, over the Taraba State Governorship Election Tribunal election ruling.
Suspected Boko Haram members on 20/11 night launched an attack on Kwanti village in Fika local government area of Yobe State, in which 7 persons were killed.
Musicians protest the abduction of an Ijaw colleague in Polaku community earlier in the week.
The town of Ajetachi in Dekina Local Government Area is taken over by ""rampaging hoodlums"" who attack PDP voters ahead of an election in the area. Injuries not known or not reported.

column7: IPOB: Indigenous Peoples of Biafra; Journalists (Nigeria)
column17: Members of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) protested in Onitsha, Anambra State, marching through the busy Onitsha-Enugu expressway for over one and a half hour against the detention of the Director of Radio Biafra, Mr. Nnamdi Kanu.

A young girl carrying a suicide pack detonates near a military checkpoint, killing herself and seven passengers of a bus who had disembarked to be searched. It is believed the bomber is affiliated with Boko Haram.
APC supporters hold a rally for the Edo Governor and protest against the PDP in Benin City on 23/11. The protest was an apparent response to a PDP protest in the city on 17/11.

A group of Ogun State politicians protest at the Court of Appeals in Ibadan pleading with members of the Appeal Tribunal for the Ogun East Senatorial election to imbibe fairness and objectivity in the hearing of the appeal of a election result.
Hundreds of pro-Biarfa supporters (affiliation not reported) protest in Abuja against a incarceration of a compatriot being held in Kano.
Explosion rocked a mosque at Yartabki village near the headquarters of Funtua local government in Katsina State on 24/11. No injuries reported. Police arrested one unidentified suspect.
A pro-APC group stages a protest in Lokoja after a court declared a recent election inconclusive.
PDP youth protest in Abuja for the removal of the Acting National Chairman of the party, Chief Uche Secondus.
Hundreds of workers of a gas plant in Ughello South LGA protest non-payment of salary. Date of protest not known - source dated 25/11.
Supporters of the Women Arise movement protest the killing of a civilian by police near a courthouse in Ebute-Metta on 25/11.
A group of 400 farmers protest violent incidents between they and Fulanis. The protest occurred in several parts of Ido LGA, including Omi Adio, Onikanga, Mabolese, Alatori, Agbetu and Olorode.
A group of 400 farmers protest violent incidents between they and Fulanis. The protest occurred in several parts of Ido LGA, including Omi Adio, Onikanga, Mabolese, Alatori, Agbetu and Olorode.
A group of 400 farmers protest violent incidents between they and Fulanis. The protest occurred in several parts of Ido LGA, including Omi Adio, Onikanga, Mabolese, Alatori, Agbetu and Olorode.
A group of 400 farmers protest violent incidents between they and Fulanis. The protest occurred in several parts of Ido LGA, including Omi Adio, Onikanga, Mabolese, Alatori, Agbetu and Olorode.

column7: AWLA: African Women Lawyers Association; Women (Nigeria)
column17: The African Women Lawyers Association, AWLA protested against the alleged marginalization of women by President Mohammadu Buharis administration near the Lagos Assembly.

column7: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra; Journalists (Nigeria)
column17: MASSOB supporters protest for the release of a radio commentator in Owerri on 26/11.

Twenty-two are dead following a Boko Haram suicide bombing on a procession of a Shiite group in Garum Mallam, Dakasoye, south of Kano. Shortly after the attack Boko Haram made a statement, claiming responsibility.
APC youths block the major Highway linking Ayangba and Abuja in protest against reports the party had replaced its candidate in the inconclusive governorship primary election.
Boko Haram attacks Bam village of Biu LGA during the morning hours of 30/11, killing four, abducting several girls and destroying the town.
Boko Haram attacks Gajiganna village in Magumeri LGA on 29/11, killing three villagers and a soldier before carting away a lot of foodstuff into an awaiting pickup van.
Staff of the Industrial Training Fund (ITF) staged a protest and shutdown their office in Abuja on 29/11 over alleged financial impropriety and misappropriation of funds by the Director General.

Military forces and Boko Haram clash in Gulak following an attack on a military base by the latter. Twenty members of Boko Haram, and at least one soldier dead plus 100+ missing. During the battle Boko Haram temporarily dislodged the solders and came to posses their weapons.
Workers at Malam Aminu Kano International Airport in Kano protest over non-payment of their entitlements.
Factions of the APC clash over of the parties choice of its candidate in Abuja on 30/11. No death was recorded as calm was restored when more anti-riot police came to the scene.
Obafemi Awolowo University is closed following two days of student unrest over poor electric supply.

Scores of students of the D.S Adegbenro ICT Polytechnic, Itori, in Ewekoro Local Government area of the state, went on rampage at the Itori end of the Lagos-Abeokuta Expressway, over the death of one of their colleagues who was reportedly crushed by a truck. The protesting students were said to have held up traffic for almost four hours, lasting from 11am till 3pm.
Women and children staged a peaceful protest in Zaria over plan by Kaduna State government to demolish houses in the area.

column7: IPOB: Indigenous Peoples of Biafra; Journalists (Nigeria)
column17: Members of IPOB protest in Nnewi for the release of a incarcerated radio commentator who shares their political views.
Unidentified attackers laid siege on Tangaran village in Anka local government area of the state on the night of 01/12, killing four.
Fulani herdsmen attack Polalido-Kandilan in Billiri local government area of Gombe State in which one person was killed, four injured and 40 houses burnt down.
Players of a football club protest near the government house over unpaid salaries.
Armed men suspected to be Boko Haram insurgents attacked Gamgara, a farming community in Abadan(m) area of Borno State, killed six men and injured several others in an attack around 8.30pm on 01/12.
Obafemi Awolowo University is closed following two days of student unrest over poor electric supply.
Fulanis clash with members of the Ofagbe community, one dead. The reason for the clash is not known.
Employees of BUA Group block roads in protest ""worker welfare"" on Victoria Island.
Demonstrators protest at the Secretariat of the Nigeria Union of Journalists (NUJ) Kaduna State council protesting the planned demolition of their houses by the state government.
Imo State workers protest salaries in Owerri on 01/12.

Gunmen kill APC deputy ward chairman in Odi in an apparent kidnap attempt, The killing caused tension between the PDP and APC in the area, though it is not clear if any member of the PDP is responsible for the crime.
Seven are dead following a clash between IPOB protesters and police forces in Onitsha. The seven who were killed included two police men, a female passer- by and four pro-Biafra protesters.
Hotel workers protest Nigerian Security and Civil Defence Corps, NSCDC, for defying a court order to vacate the hotel they had shut down and occupied since August 27.
The teachers of the staff schools of the Adeniran Ogunsanya College of Education (AOCOED) protest labour issues on 12/02.
A suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber kills herself and three others in Sabon Gari.

Members of the APC protest at the office of the Independent National Election Commission, INEC, in Lokoja demanding that All Progressives Congress (APC) be declared winner of the Kogi governorship election.
Members of the PDP embark on a ""peace procession"" in protest against violence in Rivers State.
A group protests in Aboh against an oil companies alleged non-compliance with a law, the ""Local Content Act.""
A women's group protests sexual abuse near the Enugu State House.
A suspected Boko Haram suicide bomber kills herself and two others at a market in Klimba.

column7: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: Police forces arrest several MASSOB protesters on 04/12. No violence reported.
Arrests: Military forces on 04/12 arrest the Boko Haram leader Abdullahi Abubakar along the Borno-Adamawa border, specific location not known.
Unidentified gunmen killed four people, including an 11 year old during an attack on Tangaran village in Anka LGA. Date of the attack not entirely clear, source dated 04/12.
Fulanis kidnap three contractors in Onicha on 05/12, reasons not known.
APC and PDP members clash in Brass and Nembe during elections. No reported injury or death.

A group of youths attack the convoy of the Nasarawa governor with sticks and stones on 05/12. Several of the youths were arrested in the following days. The political attitudes of the attackers are not known.
Clashes between PDP and APC supporters during election in Southern Ijaw causes the death of a woman on 05/12 in Oporoma.
A suspected premeditated attack against PDP voters in Oporoma, Bayelsa State kills between 1 and four. Perpetrators nor known.
APC and PDP members clash in Brass and Nembe during elections. No reported injury or death.
Boko Haram attacks Takulashi, Chibok LGA on 06/12, attacking residents and destroying 60 houses. ""Scores injured.""
A bloody clash between Fulani herdsmen and farmers in Oju Local Government Area of Benue State has led to the death of six persons on 06/12.
A group of women, mainly of the PDP protest in Southern Ijaw LGA over irregularities of a poll.
Hundreds of residents of Amuzu community in Ezza South Local Government Area protest a government take-over of land to be used for development.
Youths in Lambata blocked the major highway leading into Minna for at least three days, protesting against the relocation of the towns market by the state government.
Members of the Maritime Workers Union protest in Warri over an inability to engage in union activities on 07/12.

Military forces encounter fleeing Boko Haram at Pulka, kill 100+. The fighters had been fleeing a military ""onslaught"" in Sambisa Forest, no causality exact figures provided from the original clash.

Military forces encounter fleeing Boko Haram at Pulka, kill 100+. The fighters had been fleeing a military ""onslaught"" in Sambisa Forest, no causality exact figures provided from the original clash.

Scores of staff of Kwara State Water Corporation in Ilorin commenced a protest over non payments of their three months salaries which led to the untimely death of five of them. The staff locked the main gates to their expansive office along Sulu Gambari road Ilorin, and displayed various placards to express their grievances.
Unidentified gunmen killed at least 20 people in a dawn attack on Mashema village, Zamfara State. The action is believed to be a retaliatory attack, reasons unknown.
Youths protest at the national assembly against a proposed social media law.
Youths in Lambata blocked the major highway leading into Minna for at least three days, protesting against the relocation of the towns market by the state government.
Employees of BUA Group again protest on 09/12 (the group had first protested on 01/12) outside their corporate office on Victoria Island over pay.

Youths in Lambata blocked the major highway leading into Minna for at least three days, protesting against the relocation of the towns market by the state government. Police fire tear gas when the group blocked a bridge.
Youths barricade a road in Yenagoa over the cancellation of an election in Southern Ijaw Local Government Area.
Military forces deliver a ""decisive blow"" to Boko Haram at Buni Yadi, recovering a large amount of weapons. No causalities reported.
Military forces clash with Boko Haram Furkati village, Geidam Local Government Area. Five Boko Haram dead, weapons recovered.

column7: MHWUN: Medical and Health Workers Union of Nigeria
column17: Workers of National Agency for Food and Drug Administration and Control (NAFDAC) (representing the MHWUN) on 10/12 forcibly entered the agencies office in Lagos State, disrupting activities for several hours. The protesters demanded the administrator of the agency.

Boko Haram attacks Buratai on 18/12 during the early morning hours, sparking a clash with military forces. Fourteen causalities. The town is home to the army chief, leading the military to believe the attack was a response to strategic gains in recent months. On 10/12, Boko Haram attacked nearby Kamuya, which is home to the officers mother.

PDP lawmakers, those loyal to Ukwubile Ochijenu and those opposed to him, clash in Kogi over a plan to impeach the governor. No fewer than five members of the house assembly and some police officers were injured.
Military forces clear four Boko Haram camps in the Bama area, freeing 31 civilian hostages. No violence reported; Boko Haram had fled pending the arrival of the soldiers.
Youths block the Minna/Abuja highway in protest of a proposal to move a nearby market.

A lieutenant general survives an assassination attempt in Zaria. The military assumed the local Shiite population was responsible, and committed violence against them in ""cold blood"", which, in turn, lead to a clash between the two groups and later protests. Human Rights Watch later claimed that 300 were killed in the unrest over several days.
Twenty villagers are dead following a Boko Haram attack on Warawara (Biu LGA) on 12/12.

Members of the military and Shiites clash over two days following violence against the sect at the hands of the military. This followed an assassination attempt on a military leader the army attributed to the sect. ""Several deaths"" reported. Latest reports indicate 60 deaths as a result of the clash. Shiite leaders have claimed ""no fewer than 800 bodies of its members were deposited at the Ahmadu Bello University Teaching Hospital,"" though this claim has not been confirmed. Human Rights Watch later claimed that 300 were killed in the unrest over several days.

Following a failed assassination attempt against a lieutenant general, members of the military, assuming the local Shiite population was responsible, killed several members of the sect ""in cold blood."" The numbers of dead are believed to be at least, or higher than 12 with 30 injuries. Shiite leaders indicate the numbers of dead are much higher. The majority of dead were believed killed at the home of a Shiite leader, who was taken into custody by the soldiers. In the following days the killings sparked several protests in the area, including in Iran. Note: at least one source claims the attacks took place on 13/12, though most assert 12/12. Human Rights Watch later claimed that 300 were killed in the unrest over several days.
Six are dead following a Boko Haram attack on Mangari on 12/12.
Four are dead following a Boko Haram attack on Mangari on 12/12.
An elderly woman is set ablaze by suspected assassins, though the target of the killers may have been her son. The motive for the attack is not known.
Gunmen ""at the weekend"" assassinate a university lecturer, along with his son in Port Harcourt. The motive for the targeting is not known.
