At least 14 people were reportedly killed and several others injured in Kwata area of Zawan, Jos South Local Government Area of Plateau State, on the night of 13/12, following attack by suspected Fulani gunmen.

Members of the military and Shiites clash over two days following violence against the sect at the hands of the military. This followed an assassination attempt on a military leader the army attributed to the sect. ""Several deaths"" reported. Latest reports indicate 60 deaths as a result of the clash. Shiite leaders have claimed ""no fewer than 800 bodies of its members were deposited at the Ahmadu Bello University Teaching Hospital,"" though this claim has not been confirmed. Human Rights Watch later claimed that 300 were killed in the unrest over several days.
Lawyers protest in Owerri over unpaid salaries.

Shiite members protest in Bauchi, Potiskum and Birnin Gwari following the death of many of their fellow members in Zaria at the hands of the military, as well as for the release of a Shiite leader detained during the deadly raid.

Thousands of Shiite members protest in Kano and Katsina over the recent killing of members of their sect by the military, as well as the incarceration of a prominent leader. It should be noted that two separate demonstrations took place in Kano.

Thousands of Shiite members protest in Kano and Katsina over the recent killing of members of their sect by the military, as well as the incarceration of a prominent leader. It should be noted that two separate demonstrations took place in Kano.

Shiite members protest in Bauchi, Potiskum and Birnin Gwari following the death of many of their fellow members in Zaria at the hands of the military, as well as for the release of a Shiite leader detained during the deadly raid.

Shiite members protest in Bauchi, Potiskum and Birnin Gwari following the death of many of their fellow members in Zaria at the hands of the military, as well as for the release of a Shiite leader detained during the deadly raid.
Shiites continue a protest for the release of a leader (Zakzaky) and against recent Zaria violence.
A Muslim group protests in Ado-Ekiti over a ""land-grabbing"" effort by the government. The group said they had laid claim to the land for over fifty years.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: 15 December, on or about. Report that military forces and the Civilian JTF sexually assaulted and starved civilians in a Bama Boko Haram displacement camp in ""late 2015 and early 2016.""
Shiites protest in Gombe against recent state violence toward them, and for the release of a sect leader.
Shiites protest in Gusau against recent state violence toward them, and for the release of a sect leader.

Members of the Islamic Movement of Nigeria (Shiite) gather to protest the arrest of their leader, Ibraheem El-Zakzaky, in the Tudan Wada are of Kandua City following a Zaria raid. The police attempted to disperse the group, which led to a clash. Three reported dead.
Shiites continue a protest (third day) for the release of a leader (Zakzaky) and against recent Zaria violence.
Shiites protest in Bauchi against recent state violence toward them, and for the release of a sect leader.
Boko Haram ambushes a military convoy along Maiduguri-Bama road, killing a lieutenant colonel.
Hundreds of students of Kwara state polytechnic, Ilorin, protested against a registration fee on 15/12.
Polytechnic students barricaded the entrance of their school in protest of a registration fee. A similar protest occurred the previous day.

column6: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: One ""civilian vigilante"" and four Boko Haram suicide bombers are dead following an attack on a checkpoint in Mafa.
Residents of several neighbourhoods of Lagos Mainland protest prolonged blackouts at the headquarters of Eko Electricity Distribution Company (EKEDC) on Lagos Island on 16/12.

Biafran loyalists, who were mostly traders staged a peaceful protest at the Alaba International Market in Ojo, shutting down shops and restricting vehicular movements in the area. The group was demanding the dismissal of a court case against a radio-commentator and leader of the group.

During the week between 12/12 - 18/18 (date not known) military forces battle Boko Haram along the ""Alagarno axis,"" killing fifteen and rescuing hostages. The confrontation was part of a larger operation in the area.

column7: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: Security forces open fire on a group of MASSOB and IPOB supporters in Onitsha on 17/12, five dead 7 injuries, including one soldier who was killed in the groups retaliation. The group was initially celebrating the release of their incarcerated leader when they were fired upon.
Indigenes of Ika and Aniocha nations numbering over 500, barricaded the entrance to the Delta State House of Assembly complex in protest against the alleged oil exploration in their area.
A group protests the outcome of a Kogi State governorship election in Ilorin ""at the weekend.""

Students of the Federal Polytechnic Ede, Osun State and people of the Ede Community, ""[at the] weekend"" staged a protest to Ibadan Electricity Distribution Company (Ogun, Ibadan), due to power outage.
Nigerian troops have killed three Boko Haram fighters and recovered a cache of arms and ammunition following a battle near Damboa in Borno state. Among the dead include a leader known as ""Ameer.""
A child suicide bomber detonated his explosives, killing himself, two other bombers and six people on the morning of 20/12 in Benisheikh. The bombers were in their mid-teens.
Nigerian forces encounter Boko Haram at Mainari (Mafa LGA), killing nine members of the sect and recovering weapons.
A vigilante group attacks and kills six suspected thieves Bela village, Bornon Kurku area of Bali.

Militias from neighbouring towns fight over land in Share and Tsragi. No fewer than 50 houses have been reportedly burnt, 30 persons injured, while four persons were feared between the two towns, though more injuries may have come in Share.
A Bayelsa State commissioner is kidnapped in Ogbia LGA.

Militias from neighbouring towns fight over land in Share and Tsragi. No fewer than 50 houses have been reportedly burnt, 30 persons injured, while four persons were feared between the two towns, though more injuries may have come in Share.

Clashes between militias of Share and Tsaragi continue into a second day. Security forces are despatched to the town to restore order. Additional fatalities, injuries not known, though mush of the civilian population had fled due to the violence.
Shiites protest in Kano over the recent arrest of their leader, Ibrahim El-Zakzaky on 21/12.

Clashes between militias of Share and Tsaragi continue into a second day. Security forces are despatched to the town to restore order. Additional fatalities, injuries not known, though mush of the civilian population had fled due to the violence.
Members of the National Youth Council of Nigeria stage a protest over the deaths of their colleagues during an auto accident.
A foiled attempt to assassinate a APC chief in Obia/Akpor causes the death of his police escort.
Property destruction: The home of a SDP member of the house delegation for Delta State is set ablaze by political foes on 22/12. The perpetrators identities are not known.
Unidentified persons kill three police officers and injure four others when they attempted to attack a group of PDP official in Port Harcourt. The police gave protection, which gave to a fight.
Workers of the Federal University of Technology, Akure (FUTA), in Ondo State staged a peaceful protest over their dismissal by the federal government on 23/12.
Dockworkers protest on 23/12 over the work-related death of a colleague on Tin Can Island.
Pensioners in Bayelsa state under the aegis of Nigeria Union of Pensioners (NUP) staged a protest over non-payment of their pensions and gratuities on 23/12 at the Yenagoa government house.

Members of the Islamic Movement in Nigeria (IMN), known broadly as a Shiite group, during the morning hours protested on the streets of Kano to mark the birthday of Prophet Mohammed and mourn the killings of their colleagues in Zaria two weeks ago by soldiers.
Four suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers kill 14, including themselves, while injuring 39 others. The attack took place in the Sager area of the city on the evening of 24/12.

A pastor or cleric is targeted for abduction by unidentified gunmen in Uromi on 25/12. Though the kidnapping was ultimately unsuccessful, the attackers shot and severely injured a guard. The motive for the attack is not yet known.
Boko Haram attacks Kimba village the evening of 25/12, killing between 13 and 16, abducting or injuring others and burning houses. The source reported Boko Haram had ""taken control of the village.""
Aggrieved Port Harcourt church members barricade the door to their building and carry over allegations over embezzlement by church leaders.

Nigerian forces shoot and kill seven potential suicide bombers (some reports claim 14) attempting to gain access to Maiduguri (at Aladuwari area) on 27/12. [A] Major General of the 7 Division said the militants intended to carry out massive and coordinated suicide mission through Asmari, Damboa check point, Ali Dawari, Molai Kura, Baderi, Jumari villages, all at the outskirts of Maiduguri. This follows the detonation by three of bombers at a nearby mosque, killing 25 and injuring 85. The bombers were reported to be teen-aged girls.

Nigerian forces shoot and kill seven potential suicide bombers (some reports claim 14) attempting to gain access to Maiduguri (at Aladuwari area) on 27/12 This follows the detonation by three of bombers at a nearby mosque, killing 25 and injuring 85. The bombers were reported to be teen-aged girls.
A government official of Degema Local Council is kidnapped in Buguma, along with her son on 27/12, perpetrators not known.

A pair of Boko Haram suicide bombers detonate themselves near a petrol station in Isari, killing 19. It is believed the attack was in coordination with an attack on Maiduguri, 130km to the west. It was noted the attackers were female.

Boko Haram conduct a additional suicide attacks on a Maiduguri mosque in Sulemanti ward, a day following a series of attacks on the town. Twenty reported dead, though accounts vary, some numbering the dead as high as 40.
Suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers attack a Madagali motor park on 28/12, killing between 30 and 50 and injuring many others. The attack occurred at 9am.

Two police officers are hospitalised after they were attacked by a mob at Amofia Ngbo, Ohaukwu local government area. The officers had gone to the community to arrest a man who stabbed another man for demanding to be paid money owed to him when they were surrounded by members of the community who refused to allow them effect the arrest of the suspect.

Two police officers attached to Ebonyi State command, Amofia Ngbo in Ohaukwu local government area, were attacked by a mob and their AK-47 rifles taken away from them while in an attempt to arrest a murder suspect. Following the mob action, police, angered by the attack, began destroying property.
Labours protest non-payment of contracts in Port Harcourt on 29/12.

A mob in Irri, Isoko south local area of Delta State attacked and stripped two women of their clothes for suspected witchcraft activities. The women were threatened with machetes including other dangerous weapons by the mob numbering over two thousand youths. No injuries reported.

Following a court ruling regarding the appeal of an APC governorship candidate on 31/12, a ruling the hurt to chances of the current PDP to maintain power, many supporters of the PDP began large protests in Umuahia and Aba, which remained ""unabated"" until at least 05/01.

Following a court ruling regarding the appeal of an APC governorship candidate on 31/12, a ruling the hurt to chances of the current PDP to maintain power, many supporters of the PDP began large protests in Umuahia and Aba, which remained ""unabated"" until at least 05/01.

Following a court ruling regarding the appeal of an APC governorship candidate on 31/12, a ruling the hurt to chances of the current PDP to maintain power, many supporters of the PDP began large protests in Umuahia and Aba, which remained ""unabated"" until at least 05/01.

Following a court ruling regarding the appeal of an APC governorship candidate on 31/12, a ruling the hurt to chances of the current PDP to maintain power, many supporters of the PDP began large protests in Umuahia and Aba, which remained ""unabated"" until at least 05/01.

Women and youths of Ovade - Oghara(fe) community in Ethiope West Local Government Area of Delta State, demonstrated, at the ""weekend"", calling for the removal of the youth leader of the community, who they accused of indiscriminately arresting villagers, high-handedness, insubordination, corruption, among others.
Supporters of PDP protest block roads in Isiala-North and South LGAs over a court ruling that could limit the tenure of the sitting governor.
Supporters of PDP protest block roads in Isiala-North and South LGAs over a court ruling that could limit the tenure of the sitting governor.

Supporters of PDP protest in Ukwa East and Ukwa West on 02/01 over a court ruling which may limit the power of the sitting governor. Exact locations within the LGAs not known. There have been ongoing, similar protests in Aba and Gashua.

Women and youths of Ovade - Oghara(fe) community in Ethiope West Local Government Area of Delta State, demonstrated, at the ""weekend"", calling for the removal of the youth leader of the community, who they accused of indiscriminately arresting villagers, high-handedness, insubordination, corruption, among others.
Shiites protest in Zaria for the release of their leader, Ibrahim Zakzaky, who had been arrested last month. A counter protest against Zakzaky elsewhere in the city.

Supporters of PDP protest in Ukwa East and Ukwa West on 02/01 over a court ruling which may limit the power of the sitting governor. Exact locations within the LGAs not known. There have been ongoing, similar protests in Aba and Gashua.

Following a court ruling regarding the appeal of an APC governorship candidate on 31/12, a ruling the hurt to chances of the current PDP to maintain power, many supporters of the PDP began large protests in Umuahia and Aba, which remained ""unabated"" until at least 05/01.

Following a court ruling regarding the appeal of an APC governorship candidate on 31/12, a ruling the hurt to chances of the current PDP to maintain power, many supporters of the PDP began large protests in Umuahia and Aba, which remained ""unabated"" until at least 05/01.

Following a court ruling regarding the appeal of an APC governorship candidate on 31/12, a ruling the hurt to chances of the current PDP to maintain power, many supporters of the PDP began large protests in Umuahia and Aba, which remained ""unabated"" until at least 05/01.

Following a court ruling regarding the appeal of an APC governorship candidate on 31/12, a ruling the hurt to chances of the current PDP to maintain power, many supporters of the PDP began large protests in Umuahia and Aba, which remained ""unabated"" until at least 05/01.
Shiites protest in Gashua on 03/01 to demand the immediate release of their leader, Sheikh Ibrahim El-Zakzaky, who was arrested during the Zaria clash.

Suspected Fulani gunmen attacked two settlements in Udeni Ruwa District, Nasarawa Local Government Area of Nararawa state killing between 12 and 13 people. The effected villages are Okpaya, were five were reported dead and Udeni, where eight were believed dead.

Suspected Fulani gunmen attacked two settlements in Udeni Ruwa District, Nasarawa Local Government Area of Nararawa state killing between 12 and 13 people. The effected villages are Okpaya, were five were reported dead and Udeni, where eight were believed dead.
A Boko Haram suicide bomber detonates a pack at Izge Gwoza and Izge Dambuwa in Gwoza Local Government area of Borno State at the border of Adamawa State, killing 26.
Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) protest in Lokoja over unpaid dues.

Following a court ruling regarding the appeal of an APC governorship candidate on 31/12, a ruling the hurt to chances of the current PDP to maintain power, many supporters of the PDP began large protests in Umuahia and Aba, which remained ""unabated"" until at least 05/01.
The ad hoc staff of the Independent National Electoral Commission protest in Lokoja on 04/01 over unpaid salaries.

Following a court ruling regarding the appeal of an APC governorship candidate on 31/12, a ruling the hurt to chances of the current PDP to maintain power, many supporters of the PDP began large protests in Umuahia and Aba, which remained ""unabated"" until at least 05/01.
Former workers of an electric company protest over past payments arrears in Sokoto.
Beginning 04/01, Okada riders protest over a tariff until 07/01 in Ughelli, clashing with police on the final day, leading to arrests.
A group of Shiite women protest in Kaduna, calling for the release of Sheikh Ibrahim El-Zakzaky.
Beginning 04/01, Okada riders protest over a tariff until 07/01 in Ughelli, clashing with police on the final day, leading to arrests.
Worried by the spate of kidnapping of medical personnel and others in the state in recent times, several doctors groups protest insecurity in Asaba on 05/01.
Suspected Fulanis attack and kidnap a local traditional ruler on 05/01 as he travelled between Igbodo and Obior in Delta State. The leader was later discovered to have been killed by his captors.
Military forces allegedly kill three civilians (a female teacher and two middle-aged men) they suspected of being Boko Haram, possibly in error.
Beginning 04/01, Okada riders protest over a tariff until 07/01 in Ughelli, clashing with police on the final day, leading to arrests.
Leaders of Okun Youths (Yoruba) numbering about 100 gathered in Kabba to protest against the ""marginalisation"" of Okun people in the State Public Service.

A Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) group known as PDP Youth Vanguard has stormed the national secretariat of the party in Abuja, protesting the arrest of the parties national publicity secretary, Chief Olisa Metuh by the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC), calling the arrest ""selective justice.""

column7: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column17: Members of NURTW protest insecurity in Aramoko-Ekiti on 06/01 following the assault and robbery of a fellow member.

column7: CASER: Citizens Advocacy for Social and Economic Rights
column17: Members of CASER protest on 07/01 in Abuja over a rerun election in Bayelsa State.
Beginning 04/01, Okada riders protest over a tariff until 07/01 in Ughelli, clashing with police on the final day, leading to arrests.
Military forces reported they have rescued 3,212 trapped civilians following a firelight in Dikwa with Boko Haram on 07/01. Causalities not known.

column6: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column17: Persons suspected to be members of the National Union of Road Transport Workers attack traders on Oke-Odo. It is believed the union wants to create a motor park in the area and was trying to frighten the traders into abandoning the area.
Suspected APC ""political thugs ""attack the Korokorsei home of the Speaker of Bayelsa State House of Assembly with an explosive. No reported injury.
A 23-year-old displaced person was found beheaded in an Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp in Maiduguri. Perpetrators, motive not known.
Villagers of Duku protest the alleged recent killing of three detained persons at the hand of the military. It was reported the military suspected the three of being Boko Haram, possibly in error.
Five are killed in violence between PDP and APC supporters in Nembe. Additionally, The home of a top PDP stalwart was reportedly vandalised.
Boko Haram gunmen have killed seven people and injured others in a raid on ""some (unnamed) villages"" in Madagali LGA during the early morning hours of 10/01.
Unidentified gunmen shoot a kill a police officer and his civilian companion in Agege, Lagos. The killing was described as an assassination. The motive for the violence is not known.

Residents of Kelebe community in Olorunda local government area of Osun state on 10/01 protested the activities of an area sect practicing multiple religions. The aggrieved protesters accused them of ritual activities and practising what they described as strange religion in the community.

Six people, including a traditional ruler and security officials were feared dead as result of a gun battle between supporters of the Peoples Democratic Party [PDP] and the All Progressives Congress [APC] in Peremabiri, Southern Ijaw Local Government Area following the reading of election result in the area. Similar violence occurred in Nembe.
Primary school teachers in Adamawa State staged a protest over delay in the payment of their salaries in the capital.
Members of the NLC march at their headquarters in Owerri on 12/01 over unpaid salaries.
Vigilantes kill four suspected thieves in Jinowu.
Vigilantes attack three suspected thieves in the Fadeyi section of Lagos mainland.

column7: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column17: Four members of NURTW are injured and several vehicles destroyed when factions battle for supremacy within the group. Police made four arrests.
Members of the NLC march at their headquarters in Owerri on 13/01 over unpaid salaries. This was the second day of protests.
Arrests: Police intercept and arrest 150 members of Boko Haram while travelling near Ore, unconfirmed.
Suspected ""ex-militants"" (possibly MEND) detonate explosives destroying oil pipelines in Opudebubor, Okpelama and Kpokpo area, Warri South West. No report of human injury.
Suspected ""ex-militants"" (possibly MEND) detonate explosives destroying oil pipelines in Opudebubor, Okpelama and Kpokpo area, Warri South West. No report of human injury.
Youths in Owo protest against ""indoctrinate arrests"" in the town on 14/01.

PDP and APC supporters clash, leaving five dead in Bida or its surrounding area. The violence was sparked when an APC vehicle which ran into a crowd of PDP supporters that left two people dead. It is believed the collision was accidental.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: 15 December, on or about. Report that military forces and the Civilian JTF sexually assaulted and starved civilians in a Bama Boko Haram displacement camp in ""late 2015 and early 2016.""
Military forces repel a Boko Haram attack on Goniri army base during the early morning hours of 15/01, killing 17 of the attackers. One soldier was reported injured.
Pro-Biafra protesters (organization not known) ""intimidated and harassed"" Obigbo residents, forcing them to join the demonstration.
Fulanis kill a farmer in Amagunze over a land dispute on 15/01.
Unidentified gunmen attack a police station in Kanoma, Zamfara. Although no policeman was wounded, many of the attackers, who were overpowered by the police, ran away with bullet wounds.
Military forces repel a Boko Haram attack on Churokusko village in Tarmowa (Tarmua) local government area at the mid-morning of 15/01. Military Forces killed ""many"" of their attackers.
Supporters of IPOB protest in Asaba, calling for the release of a jailed leader, Nnamdi Kanu.

Residents of the Ondo State Southern Senatorial District (in or around Okitipupa or Erinje town) protest prolonged power outages, several arrests reported. Date of the protest not known. No reports of arrests occurring during the actual protests.
On 17 January 2016, a group of Fulani reportedly shot and killed three people over use of illicit drug use in suburban Abuja (Abuja Municipal, Federal Capital Territory).
Supporters of IPOB protest in Asaba, calling for the release of a jailed leader, Nnamdi Kanu. A similar protest took place the previous day.
Supporters of IPOB protest in Enugu, calling for the release of a jailed leader, Nnamdi Kanu. Several arrests reported.

Police open fire on a group of IPOB protesters on Aba, calling for the release of their jailed leader, Nnamdi Kanu. Eight reported dead, 30 injured, 26 arrested. The protest was characterised as peaceful by most sources, though The Nation newspaper reported the IBOP clashed with security agents.
Aggrieved members of the APC force their way into the party headquarters in Abuja after their preferred candidate was forced out a primary.
Residents near a University protest attacks by ""thugs"" attempting to remove them from their land for the purposes of development. Details of the attacks protested not known.
Over 500 ex-militants on 19/01 staged a protest in Port Harcourt over non-payment of amnesty allowances.
Oil workers block roads, traffic near the state house assembly claiming money owed to them by the government.
Members of the AYT protest in Lagos over a ruling of an appeal in regards to an election.

The entrance to the administrative headquarters of Isoko South Local Government Area of Delta State in Ole(h) was barricaded by protesting commercial motorcyclists who barred workers and clients from entry the council. Their grievance was the increase in the daily operational ticket by the state government. Several arrests were made.

Nigerian troops on 20/01 repelled an evening Boko Haram attack on Buratai town, killing some of the insurgents. At least three of the insurgents were killed and many of them escaped with bullet wounds.

Suspected """"cultists"""" attack unknown locations in Ahoada East and Ahoada West LGAs killing 16, including a police corporal. The motive for the attack may have been related to revenge for a previous death in the group.

Suspected ""cultists"" attack unknown locations in Ahoada East and Ahoada West LGAs killing 16, including a police corporal. The motive for the attack may have been related to revenge for a previous death in the group.
A group of farmers protest when they are displaced by the construction of an airport.

column6: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: Arrests: Boko Haram kingpin Jarasu Shira was on 20/01 morning arrested in Damboa by the vigilante group known as the Civilian JTF.
A women's group protests the arrest of a group of Okada riders who had themselves recent protested in the area over operational tickets. The original protest took place the previous day.
Truck drivers protest in Osara, block a highway, after a colleague was allegedly killed by a police officer during an argument.

Traders from Ibafon Main Market, Coconut area of Olodi Apapa, Lagos, protested at the corporate headquarters of Vanguard Media Ltd., protesting police extortion and harassment following several raids they considered unjust.
Bank depositors protest at a Jos government house after their money became irretrievable from a defunct cooperative society.
Suspected ""cultists"" attack Isiokpo community, killing three persons and setting houses ablaze. The attack may have been reprisal for an earlier attack (date unknown) of one of their members.
Nigerian forces stationed in Dikwa repel a Boko Haram attack on the town. No reported causalities. Date not known - source dated 21/01.

Unidentified gun attacked the home of a Bauchi State lawmaker, firing their weapons sporadically. The attackers engaged in a shootout the nearby police following the initial attack. No causalities reported.

Three Boko Haram suicide bombers were killed in an attempt to attack Nigerian forces at a Maiduguri checkpoint. One of the attackers were shot by a soldier before he was able to detonate himself. No other causalities.

No fewer than 15 persons have sustained different degrees of injuries while 11 residential buildings have been burnt following a communal clash between residents of Oyaba village in Wanikade and Ihetazi in Wanihem, Ukele North in Yala Local Government Area of Cross River State. The clash was focused around the town of Oyioba.
Military forces and Boko Haram clash in Marte, 21 reported dead. The clash occurred at a unreported point between the dates of 18/01 and 22/01.
Military forces and Boko Haram clash in Kuwiya (Kudiye), 10 reported dead. The clash occurred at a unreported point between the dates of 18/01 and 22/01.
Military forces and Boko Haram clash in Mijigine (Mijigete), 10 reported dead. The clash occurred at a unreported point between the dates of 18/01 and 22/01.
Military forces and Boko Haram clash in Ruga Fulani, 8 reported dead. The clash occurred at a unreported point between the dates of 18/01 and 22/01.
Military forces and Boko Haram clash in Ajigin, three reported dead. The clash occurred at a unreported point between the dates of 18/01 and 22/01.
Unidentified armed men attack a group of Fulani herders in Gareji village of Wukari, killing three, abducting women and stealing cattle. It is not clear if the attack was ethnically motivated.
Unidentified gunmen killed two police officers in Nimbia during the morning hours.

Gunmen believed to be ethnic Fulani herders have killed a policeman and 19 civilians and torched homes in Nigerias northeastern Adamawa state in a spat over grazing rights. The herders attacked the farming hamlets of Demsare, Wunamokoh, Dikajam and Taboungo all of Gireri District.
Unidentified gunmen abducted a man at Igbedi Community in Kolokuma/Opokuma Local Government Area of the state during the nighttime hours. The reason for the abduction is not known.
Five are killed ""early this week"" (source date 28/01) when Boko Haram attacked traders in Jawu, near Auno.

Gunmen believed to be ethnic Fulani herders have killed a policeman and 19 civilians and torched homes in Nigerias northeastern Adamawa state in a spat over grazing rights. The herders attacked the farming hamlets of Demsare, Wunamokoh, Dikajam and Taboungo all of Gireri District.

Traders and shop owners in Calabar have locked their shops and embarked on street protest to express their anger over what they described as excessive taxation, insecurity, attacks and molestation by agents of the state government.
Boko Haram attacked and killed a civilian, destroying his house in Babban Gida village.

Residents of Akobape Communities at Oke-Osun in Osogbo, Osun State staged protest over encroachment of the land by NASFAT, the owner of Fountain University, Osogbo. Three separate protests occurred in the city on the same day.

column7: CSCEOS: Civil Society Coalition for the Emancipation of Osun State
column17: Members of CSCEOS protest at the Osun State House over unpaid salaries. Three separate protests occurred in the city on the same day.
A group protests in Abuja against allegations of blackmail against the governor of Osun State.
Residents of Kobaope community in Osogbo protest against insecurity over a spate of attacks by ""armed thugs.""Three separate protests occurred in the city on the same day.

Two suspected Boko Haram female suicide bombers attacked Chibok Market in Chibok Local Government area of Borno State on 27/01, leaving 14 persons dead and over 24 others seriously injured. Another bomber struck a military checkpoint in the town, injuring two.
Contractors in Lokoja protest over payments on 27/01.

Two suspected Boko Haram female suicide bombers attacked Chibok Market in Chibok Local Government area of Borno State on 27/01, leaving 14 persons dead and over 24 others seriously injured. Another bomber struck a military checkpoint in the town, injuring two and killing only herself.
""Economic vandals"" destroy oil pipelines with bombs in several locations in Brass LGA over two days.
Unidentified gunmen abduct traditional ruler in Isoko South Local Government Area.
""Economic vandals"" destroy oil pipelines with bombs in several locations in Brass LGA over two days.
Protesters demonstrate in Ogulagha community (also known as Gulani) demanding the restoration of the scrapped Nigerian Maritime University (NMU) at Okerenkoko, Warri South West Local Government Area.
Fulanis attack another group of Fulanis land in Kuje. One death reported.
A suspected Boko Haram child suicide bomber detonated his explosive in a grain market in Gombi on 29/01, killing at least 10 people.
Residents of Kudeyibu Estate in Ijegun has protested at Ikeja Electric in Alausa over prolonged electrical blackouts in their area.

column6: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: At least five members of the Civilian Joint Task Force were killed while four others sustained critical injuries when a Toyota Hilux patrol vehicle rammed into landmines/ Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) in Buma, Kaga LGA suspected to have been planted by members of Boko Haram.

Boko Haram attacks Dalori village on 30/01 killing many. Many of the dead were children who had been burnt alive. The attack occurred during the evening hours. The death toll was raised to 101 over the course of the week (The Guardian).
Nigerian forces clash with suspected members of Boko Haram in Maiduguri on 30/01. No reported casualties.
A bloody conflict between suspected Fulani herdsmen and Agatu farmers at Ega Adapti Island in Agstu Local Government Area of Benue State claimed 10 lives.
Members of the APC protest outside their state secretariat in Benin City following the removal of a local councillor.

Military forces kill 100 members of Boko Haram and rescue 1,200 of their captives following a gun battle in Boboshe village, Dikwa LGA on 01/02. The prisoners were being held at the nearby towns of Garindawaji and Mamawarhi. Later accounts vary - This Day reports the death of 56 and the liberation of 520, other sources vary.
A vigilante mob attacks and kills a cobbler after they suspect him of a recent stabbing.
Six people were reportedly killed while one person sustained gunshot injury when suspected members of Boko Haram sect invaded Goniambari village in Kaga Local Government Area of Borno state.

Scores of former employees of the Ibadan Electricity Distribution Company (IBEDC) staged a peaceful protest along major streets of Ibadan against alleged wrongful disengagement of more than 1000 of them.
Local fishermen protest the use of large fishing trawlers.

Five houses destroyed after a large bomb blast in Benin City. Police arrested several suspects. Following the incident it was reported the many residents were panicked, fearing Boko Haram to be responsible, though authorities have not substantiated this. Some residents are hospitalised by the blast.
Nigerian forces intercept a pair of Boko Haram suicide bombers attempting to enter Maiduguri. The two detonated their packs from a distance, killing only themselves.
About 150 retirees in Cross River State protest at the office of the governor over the non-payment of five months gratuity.
Members of Andoni community attack a police station in Okoro Ete, killing two and stealing weapons. The attack may be related to ongoing tensions among community groups in the area.
Members of the Islamic movement in Nigeria (IMN), a Shiite group, embarked on a peaceful demonstration in Kaduna metropolis demanding the release of their leader Sheik Ibraheem El-Zakzaky.
A doctor is shot by police during a protest and strike by medical staff. It is not clear is the shot was fatal.

Workers of the Osun State Broadcasting Corporation, Orisun FM radio station in Ife-Ife were attacked by students of public secondary schools in the town in protest over alleged inability of the state government to pay their external examination fees. No reported injury.
Boko Haram raided two villages, Mairi and Malari in Konduga Local Government Area of Borno, killing four persons and razing houses in the communities.

At least 23 people are killed following an attack by gunmen who invaded Kwanar Dutse village of Maru LGA. No group has claimed responsibility, though locals fear Boko Haram may be responsible. Date of attack not entirly clear, ""[occurred during the weekend]"".
At least 10 persons were confirmed dead with scores injured when a group of Boko Haram invaded Mairi Mmumbe village, near Dalori of Konduga Local Government Area of Borno State.
Doctors at a Lagos teaching hospital protest a tax policy on 06/02.
Students of Afe Babalola University, Ado Ekiti, destroyed property worth millions of naira protesting over yet-to-be ascertained reasons. Police were able to quell the situation.
A suspected Fulani Herdsmen attack in Buruku Local Government Area of Benue State, killing 12 and injuring 25. The violence was mainly concentrated around the areas known as Tom-Anyiin and Tom-Ataan.
Doctors at a Lagos hospital protest unpaid saleries on 07/02.
Bank pensioners protest welfare payments in Kaduna.
Organised labour, including the NLC and its civil society allies protested a electricity tax in several cities. The protests were peaceable.
Organised labour, including the NLC and its civil society allies protested a electricity tax in several cities. The protests were peaceable.
Organised labour, including the NLC and its civil society allies protested a electricity tax in several cities. The protests were peaceable.

Members of Nigerian Maritime Administration and Safety Agency protest the non-payment of monthly allowances in Apapa.
Organised labour, including the NLC and its civil society allies protested a electricity tax in several cities. The protests were peaceable.
Organised labour, including the NLC and its civil society allies protested a electricity tax in several cities. The protests were peaceable.

Organised labour, including the NLC and its civil society allies protested a electricity tax in several cities. The protests were peaceable.
A group of 250 soldiers protest their dismissal from the army over ""unlawful"" activity.
Organised labour, including the NLC and its civil society allies protested a electricity tax in several cities. The protests were peaceable.
Organised labour, including the NLC and its civil society allies protested a electricity tax in several cities. The protests were peaceable.

Organised labour, including the NLC and its civil society allies protested a electricity tax in several cities. The protests were peaceable.
Organised labour, including the NLC and its civil society allies protested a electricity tax in several cities. The protests were peaceable.
Boko Haram attacked a group of firewood traders in Jawu village, about 8 kilometres from Auno town of Kondiga, west of Maiduguri, killing five.
A group of Owerri residents attack and nearly lynch two men they suspect of robbery before they are saved by police.

No fewer than 12 people have sustained various degrees of injury, including a district head, in a fracas between Gwani and Kinafa communities in Yamaltu/Deba local government councils over farm land dispute.
Police open fire on an otherwise peaseable IOPB protest in Aba on 09/02. Six dead, injuries reported, plus arrests.
Two female suicide bombers detonated bombs at the Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camp in Dikwa, Borno State, leaving 58 people dead and over 78 others injured.
Protest against persistent Fulani violence in Asaba on 09/02.

Members of the All Progressives Congress (APC), ""last week"" (source dated 15/02) staged a peaceful protest at the parties secretariat in Kuje, calling for the replacement of their chairmanship candidate in the forthcoming area council election.

Students of Yaba College of Technology, YABATECH, protested the death of a fellow student, alleging medical malpractice and a transfer policy. Students were also protesting at the nearby University of Lagos, also on Lagos Mainland. The protest was violent and is expected to cause the university to close for several weeks.
Fulanis attack Abi community on 11/02, killing two and causing 19 to go missing.
Cameroonian soldiers launch a cross border raid against Boko Haram at Goshi location (in or near Ashigashiya) on 11/02, killing at least 27.
Fulanis and Agatu farmers clash in Okokolo, Ologba Utukolugwu and Oweto areas of Agatu LGA. Six deaths reported.
Fulanis and Agatu farmers clash in Okokolo, Ologba Utukolugwu and Oweto areas of Agatu LGA. Six deaths reported.

About twenty persons sustained injuries during a bloody clash among members of All Progressives Congress (APC), at Oka-Akoko in Akoko South West Local Government area of Ondo State. The violence is believed to be related to the parties choice of a governorship candidate. Two deaths, plus several injuries.
Military forces ambushed a group of Boko Haram fighters at Gwai Mainari in Mainok on 11/02. ""Some"" Boko Haram were killed in the attack, others injured, weapons recovered.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill a former Rivers State PDP lawmaker on 11/02. The reason for the attack is not known.

Soldiers traversing Dogon Gida and New Marte stepped on an undetected Improvised Explosive Device (IED) buried by suspected Boko Haram. The explosion caused four injuries and damage to the vehicle. Elsewhere in the area (unknown exact location), military forces in a joint operation with Cameroonian forces killed 10 members of the group while recuing 45 female captives. The source states the ""military forces advanced to Mararraba, Angwan Fada, Dale, Wizha, Bokko Timit, Bokko Nasanu, Bokko Hide, up to Ngoshe village where they linked up with the Cameroonians."" However, it is not clear where the encounters with Boko Haram occurred.

Soldiers traversing Dogon Gida and New Marte stepped on an undetected Improvised Explosive Device (IED) buried by suspected Boko Haram. The explosion caused four injuries and damage to the vehicle. Elsewhere in the area (unknown exact location), military forces in a joint operation with Cameroonian forces killed 10 members of the group while recuing 45 female captives. The source states the ""military forces advanced to Mararraba, Angwan Fada, Dale, Wizha, Bokko Timit, Bokko Nasanu, Bokko Hide, up to Ngoshe village where they linked up with the Cameroonians."" However, it is not clear where the encounters with Boko Haram occurred.

Boko Haram militants killed at least 30 people during attacks on two villages in Damboa (Yakshari-12/02 and Kachifa-13/02) over two days in Borno State. The attackers looted food supplies, carting away herds, and kidnapping women and children.
Unidentified gunmen invaded Omoku community on 12/02, forcing residents from their homes, reasons unknown. Fifteen dead reported.
Organized labourers (mainly NLC) protest a electricity tax in Ikeja. This was a continuation of a similar mass protest in various areas in the previous week.
One beheaded, another kidnapped when militia members from Agila, Benue State attack Ojiogu village, Ukwuagba-Ngbo, Ebonyi State in a boundary dispute. The attack occurred ""at the weekend.""

Boko Haram militants killed at least 30 people during attacks on two villages in Damboa (Yakshari-12/02 and Kachifa-13/02) over two days in Borno State. The attackers looted food supplies, carting away herds, and kidnapping women and children.

Two persons are feared dead and six others injured in Kwal village of Bassa local government area of Plateau State following renewed hostilities between Berom and Irigwe communities in the state on 15/02.

column7: NULGE: Nigerian Union of Local Government Employees
column17: NULGE workers barricade council secretariats in Sagbama, Nembe, Yenagoa, effectively shutting them down, over unpaid salaries on 15/02.

column7: NULGE: Nigerian Union of Local Government Employees
column17: NULGE workers barricade council secretariats in Sagbama, Nembe, Yenagoa, effectively shutting them down, over unpaid salaries on 15/02.

column7: NULGE: Nigerian Union of Local Government Employees
column17: NULGE workers barricade council secretariats in Sagbama, Nembe, Yenagoa, effectively shutting them down, over unpaid salaries on 15/02.
A group of factory workers violently protest the alleged taking of bribes by management. The protesters assaulted a police officer, injuring him.

Students of Delta State University run riot, destroying school property. Sources said the students were protesting against the managements decision not to allow the final year engineering students graduate without passing the courses they carried over from other departments.
Delta State University students protest for their non payment of their bursary allowance on 16/02 in Asaba.

Military forces battled Boko Haram on 16/02 in Borno rescuing 350 persons and killing 167 insurgents in separate but nearby operations in Gajibo, Maula, Gamai, Gamare, Maiwa, Warsale, Tangli, Tushi, Sowa, Hasanari, Changuwa, Malamaja and Marya towns in Mafa and Dikwa Local Governments Areas.

Military forces attack and recapture the ""spiritual"" Boko Haram stronghold of Alagarno (which includes Komala, Dole, Kumshi and Moadori), killing two and capturing two leaders, Mustapha Busuru and Usman Abubakar.

Boko Haram attacks Kuda, setting fire to the village. In response to the attack military forces mobilized, though the Boko Haram attack retreated before the soldiers arrived. One woman reported dead from the fire.

Military forces battled Boko Haram on 16/02 in Borno rescuing 350 persons and killing 167 insurgents in separate but nearby operations in Gajibo, Maula, Gamai, Gamare, Maiwa, Warsale, Tangli, Tushi, Sowa, Hasanari, Changuwa, Malamaja and Marya towns in Mafa and Dikwa Local Governments Areas.

Military forces battled Boko Haram on 16/02 in Borno rescuing 350 persons and killing 167 insurgents in separate but nearby operations in Gajibo, Maula, Gamai, Gamare, Maiwa, Warsale, Tangli, Tushi, Sowa, Hasanari, Changuwa, Malamaja and Marya towns in Mafa and Dikwa Local Governments Areas.
Members of the Nigerian Medical Association protest at the Osun state house over unpaid salaries on 16/02.
A coalition of civil society groups protest at the National Assembly and Education Ministry the termination of 13 vice chancellors of federal universities by the government.
Military forces attacked Boko Haram elements at Komala and Musafanari general area coming from Sambisa forest. A number of weapons were recovered. Casualties not known.

column7: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
column17: NANS students protesting the firing of education leaders demonstrate in Abuja on 18/02. Police dispersed the group with tear gas, make five arrests.

Protesters demonstrated at the office of Sterling Energy Exploration Company, SEEPCO, at Kwale, Ndokwa West Local Government Area, Delta State, demanding the relocation of the companies operational headquarters from Lagos to Delta State.
Gunmen suspected to be kidnappers on 20/02 invaded a Fulani camp at Gurfata village in Gwagwalada Area Council, Abuja, killing a member of the group and kidnapping another herder.
Prospective students barricaded JAMB offices in Lagos and Benin while protesting against the decision of the board to close the sale of forms.

column9: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column17: Students of Lagos State University clash with members of the NURTW during a road-blocking taxation protest (along Lagos-Badagry Expressway) on behalf of the students. Injuries reported.
Prospective students barricaded JAMB offices in Lagos and Benin while protesting against the decision of the board to close the sale of forms.
Youths of Eniong Offot community in Uyo local government area of the Akwa Ibom State staged a protest over planned demolition of their homes.

column7: PENGASSAN: Petroleum and Natural Gas Senior Staff Association of Nigeria
column17: Members of PENGASSAN protest over two days over a management issue.

Eighteen persons were killed in Gokana LGA, Rivers State, as soldiers engaged loyalists of an ex-militant leader (Solomon Ndigbara) in a shootout. The clash is likely related to a recent raid on the leaders home.
Suspected PDP supporters bomb the office of the APC senatorial candidate in Boni. The bombing occurred during the overnight hours and it is believed no one was present at the time of the bombing.
Primary School teachers in Yagba West local government area of Kogi state protested against the plan by the authorities of the council to pay them less of their current salary.
A group demonstrates against Senate President Bukola Saraki, calling for his resignation following the suspension of a fellow Senator. The protest took place at the national assembly.

column7: PENGASSAN: Petroleum and Natural Gas Senior Staff Association of Nigeria
column17: Members of PENGASSAN protest over two days over a management issue.
One killed, several wounded in a Edo communal clash between those of Uneme and Okpella villages. The clash may have been related to access to a logging area.
During a battle of Nigerian and Cameroonian forces in Kumshe a house with Boko Haram members caught fire in nearby Fatake, killing three members inside.

Nigerian and Cameroonian forces engage Boko Haram along the Talala-Banki-Kumshe axis, 23 Boko Haram militants were killed (The Nation), the troops destroyed 4 AK 47 rifles and captured a gun truck mounted with an Anti-Aircraft Gun (AA Gun) and 2 AK 47 rifles, as well as a 60mm mortar. The military forces also rescued 150 prisoners, who were mostly children. Three soldiers injured. Allied forces gained control of the area.

Hundreds of protesters marched through streets in Asaba to express disapproval of the alleged plan by the state government to formally recognise Agbaovwe Afugbeya as monarch in Uwheru Kingdom in Ughelli North Local Government Area.

Fulani militia attacks the Agatu communities of Akwu, Adagbo, Okpagabi, Edumoogbo, Egwuma, Okpanchenyi, Onicha K Oladukwu, Usha, Owetp, Ayilla, and Ogboju on 24/02, as well as Okokolo and Abugbe. ""Hundreds"" killed (300 reported later in the week - Vanguard), villages destroyed. In the following week authorities estimated 7,000 were displaced due to the violence.
A secondary school student is shot and killed by security forces when a protest erupted after police attempted to stop a football match.

Fulani militia attacks the Agatu communities of Akwu, Adagbo, Okpagabi, Edumoogbo, Egwuma, Okpanchenyi, Onicha K Oladukwu, Usha, Owetp, Ayilla, and Ogboju on 24/02, as well as Okokolo and Abugbe. ""Hundreds"" killed (300 reported later in the week - Vanguard), villages destroyed. In the following week authorities estimated 7,000 were displaced due to the violence.

Military forces encounter and stop Boko Haram during a suspected coordinated attack on the Dikwa area. The troops recovered 26 bodies of Boko Haram, while others escaped with gunshot wounds; destroyed 3 VIED, 1 MBIED and two gun trucks. The military deaths not reported.

Fulani militia attacks the Agatu communities of Akwu, Adagbo, Okpagabi, Edumoogbo, Egwuma, Okpanchenyi, Onicha K Oladukwu, Usha, Owetp, Ayilla, and Ogboju on 24/02, as well as Okokolo and Abugbe. ""Hundreds"" killed (300 reported later in the week - Vanguard), villages destroyed. In the following week authorities estimated 7,000 were displaced due to the violence.

column7: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
column17: NANS affiliated students protest the termination of 12 vice chancellors by the federal government in Abuja, blocking traffic, damaging cars and other property.

Fulani militia attacks the Agatu communities of Akwu, Adagbo, Okpagabi, Edumoogbo, Egwuma, Okpanchenyi, Onicha K Oladukwu, Usha, Owetp, Ayilla, and Ogboju on 24/02, as well as Okokolo and Abugbe. ""Hundreds"" killed (300 reported later in the week - Vanguard), villages destroyed. In the following week authorities estimated 7,000 were displaced due to the violence.

Fulani militia attacks the Agatu communities of Akwu, Adagbo, Okpagabi, Edumoogbo, Egwuma, Okpanchenyi, Onicha K Oladukwu, Usha, Owetp, Ayilla, and Ogboju on 24/02, as well as Okokolo and Abugbe. ""Hundreds"" killed (300 reported later in the week - Vanguard), villages destroyed. In the following week authorities estimated 7,000 were displaced due to the violence.

Nine persons including a personnel of Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps, NSDC were reportedly killed while ten others sustained various degrees of injuries when Fulanis attacked Ibi and Wukari local government areas of Taraba State on 25/02.
Sellers of sachet water took to the streets of Kubwa village on 25/02 protesting the increase of the cost price of the product.

A section of Ladipo Auto Spare Part Market in Mushin area of Lagos State was grounded as traders took to the streets protesting the reported death of one of their colleagues after he was recently killed by ""thugs.""
""Scores"" are killed when an improvised explosive device seized from Boko Haram Islamists detonated at a police station in Jimeta, Yola area.

Nine persons including a personnel of Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps, NSDC were reportedly killed while ten others sustained various degrees of injuries when Fulanis attacked Ibi and Wukari local government areas of Taraba State on 25/02.
Youths from Southern Ijaw Local Government Area of Bayelsa State protest neglect from a western oil company following a rig explosion in their area. The protest took place in Yenagoa.
Military forces clear a Boko Haram camp at Korohuma (Kotokuma), kill 37 members of the group. Two soldiers reported dead.

Unnamed gunmen attack Ogbele community on 27/02, killing five and kidnapping the chairman of the Community Development Committee. Residents of neighbouring communities fled in fear of mass arrests from descending security forces to the area.
APC youths hold a political rally in support of President Buhari in Katsinas Kangiwa Square.
A vigilante group lynches a suspected thief in the Apo area of the city on the morning of 29/02. In response a group protested the killing.

column7: PENGASSAN: Petroleum and Natural Gas Senior Staff Association of Nigeria
column17: Members of PENGASSAN protest over a management issue in Abuja.
A vigilante group lynches a suspected thief in the Apo area of the city on the morning of 29/02. In response a group protested the killing.
Gunmen suspected to be ""pipeline vandals"" abducted three girls from a hostel in Ikorodu on the evening of 29/02.

Retirees from the Bayelsa state civil service under the aegis of Nigerian Union of Pensioners were attacked in front of the Government House while they were protesting unpaid gratuity by a group that they allege was hired by the state government. A conflicting witness claims there was not violence.
Residents of Akamkpa and Obubra local government areas protest in Akankpa against a state government scheme to remove a large area of forest in order to build a highway.

column7: CAFON: Consumer Advocacy Foundation of Nigeria
column17: Banking customers under the aegis CAFON protest in Enugu over undue charges. In addition to the protest, the group also boycotted banking activates for the day.
A coalition of civil society groups from the state gathered the National Assembly to protest a spate of recent killings by Fulanis in Agatu Local Government in Benue State.

column7: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column9: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column17: One feared dead during a leadership tussle among members of the NURTW union in Oshodi.
Youths protest against ""hate speeches"" by the Governor. [The protesters] said that their [demonstration] was in pursuit of Ogoni non-violence struggle.
Yoruba and Hause militias clash in Kosofe the night of 02/03. Four reported dead from fighting.
Civil servants in Ijora protest an alleged assault on a colleague by a member of work management.
A group of soldiers allegedly attack a group of elderly woman who were otherwise peaceably protesting a disputed land ownership issue. The extent of the protesters injures are not known.

Some persons whose buildings were demolished to pave way for the construction of additional service lanes on the Ugbowo-Lagos Road in Benin City protest non-payment of compensation by the Edo State Government.
Members of the Anambra State Vigilante group protested the non-payment of their eight months salary arrears by the state government. The protest took place at the government house in Awka.
A vigilante mob attacks and set ablaze a suspected kidnapper in Kwadaru village of Kubau.
An APC ward chairman is attacked and beheaded by suspected PDP militia in Omoku. His wife and son were also shot dead in the attack.
Military forces clear three Boko Haram camps in Alagarno forest on 04/03 (at Biu LGA) at Lawin Meleri, Matiri Bulaka and Aljeri, killing 5 members of the sect and rescuing 63 of their prisoners.
Military forces encounter fleeing Boko Haram near the Sabsawa axis of Sambisa forest. The following clash caused at least one soldier to be injured.

During the night of 04/03 Hausa men attacked a group of Yorubas and their shops at Mile 12 market in Kosofe. Many shops were destroyed and six killed. In response to the invasion, some armed Yoruba youths converged close to the market in readiness for another attack or clash at about 1pm. The Yorubas chanted war songs attempted to invade the market and destroy shops belonging to Hausa traders, but they were dispersed by security operatives with tear gas canisters. 105 arrested total, among both groups.
The bodies of nine are discovered in Agatu LGA on 04/03. It is believed this had been a continuation of earlier violence and Fulanis are responsible.

During the night of 04/03 Hausa men attacked a group of Yorubas and their shops at Mile 12 market in Kosofe. Many shops were destroyed and six killed. In response to the invasion, some armed Yoruba youths converged close to the market in readiness for another attack or clash at about 1pm. The Yorubas chanted war songs attempted to invade the market and destroy shops belonging to Hausa traders, but they were dispersed by security operatives with tear gas canisters. 105 arrested total, among both groups.
An APC member is attacked and beaten to death in Obibi by suspected PDP supporters.
Members of WAI protest in Kirikiri against a defendant in a court case who is charged with domestic violence against his wife.

Agents of the Department of State Services (DSS) invade the Ekiti State House Assembly, abducting four lawmakers. It is believed the four were kidnapped after they refused to involve themselves in the impeachment process of the governor.

column7: ASURI: Academic Staff Union of Research Institutions
column17: Scientists under the aegis of Academic Staff Union of Research Institutions (ASURI) have embark on a street protest in Abuja over the inability of the federal government to commercialise research findings.
Military forces encounter and clear Boko Haram forces from Amdaga Makaranta and Amdaga Madachi in Gwoza. The same brigade had recently cleared Dure. Two Boko Haram reported dead.
Military forces encounter and clear Boko Haram forces from Dure area on 05/03. ""Several"" Boko Haram fatalities, three soldiers injured.
Ogoni residents protest in Bori over a military presence into their traditional communities. The protest took place ""at the weekend.""
Military forces clear Boko Haram from Dousa (Doksa) on 05/03, kill two and recovering weapons. The operation was in coordination with other military exercises in the area.
The Islamic Movement in Nigeria protest in Kano for the release of their incarcerated leader, Sheikh Ibraheem El-Zakzaky. Exact date of protest not known, source dated 06/03.
Land owners protest in Kaduna over the government take-over of their property without proper compensation. Date of protest not known, source dated 06/03.
Scores of residents of three communities on the Ibafo-Mowe axis of the Lagos/Ibadan Expressway protest prolonged power outages at the Punch Newspapers headquarters in Ikeja and in Ibafo on 07/03.
Scores of residents of three communities on the Ibafo-Mowe axis of the Lagos/Ibadan Expressway protest prolonged power outages at the Punch Newspapers headquarters in Ikeja and in Ibafo on 07/03.

Boko Haram, in an effort to overtake Gwoza, are intercepted and repulsed at the nearby towns of Bitta (in Damboa) and Pulka. The clash began the evening of 07/03, and continued overnight into the morning of 08/03. The fight was said to have forced the military to deploy fighter jets from Yola to support ground troops who were initially being overwhelmed. Eighteen Boko Haram dead, three soldiers injured.

Suspected PDP supporters attack and kill a APC chieftain, setting him ablaze. The death either sparked an armed clash between the two parties. It is not clear if there were any causalities or injuries from the subsequent clash.
An APC member is attacked and beaten to death by suspected members of the PDP in Opobo Town. A similar attack took place the same day in Buguma.

Boko Haram, in an effort to overtake Gwoza, are intercepted and repulsed at the nearby towns of Bitta (in Damboa) and Pulka. The clash began the evening of 07/03, and continued overnight into the morning of 08/03. The fight was said to have forced the military to deploy fighter jets from Yola to support ground troops who were initially being overwhelmed. Eighteen Boko Haram dead, three soldiers injured.
Suspected PDP supporters attack and kill a APC chieftain, setting him ablaze. The death either sparked or was the result of a clash between the two parties.

Boko Haram, in an effort to overtake Gwoza, are intercepted and repulsed at the nearby towns of Bitta (in Damboa) and Pulka. The clash began the evening of 07/03, and continued overnight into the morning of 08/03. The fight was said to have forced the military to deploy fighter jets from Yola to support ground troops who were initially being overwhelmed. Eighteen Boko Haram dead, three soldiers injured.

Hisbah forces in Sabon Gari of Kano attempted to impound a beer truck, smashing its windshield and deflating tyres. Nearby youths, angered by the action nearly attacked the Islamic group before they were separated by security forces.

Boko Haram, in an effort to overtake Gwoza, are intercepted and repulsed at the nearby towns of Bitta (in Damboa) and Pulka. The clash began the evening of 07/03, and continued overnight into the morning of 08/03. The fight was said to have forced the military to deploy fighter jets from Yola to support ground troops who were initially being overwhelmed. Eighteen Boko Haram dead, three soldiers injured.
Eight are killed in a Fulani attack in Logo LGA in the early morning hours of 08/03.

Boko Haram, in an effort to overtake Gwoza, are intercepted and repulsed at the nearby towns of Bitta (in Damboa) and Pulka. The clash began the evening of 07/03, and continued overnight into the morning of 08/03. The fight was said to have forced the military to deploy fighter jets from Yola to support ground troops who were initially being overwhelmed. Eighteen Boko Haram dead, three soldiers injured.

Boko Haram, in an effort to overtake Gwoza, are intercepted and repulsed at the nearby towns of Bitta (in Damboa) and Pulka. The clash began the evening of 07/03, and continued overnight into the morning of 08/03. The fight was said to have forced the military to deploy fighter jets from Yola to support ground troops who were initially being overwhelmed. Eighteen Boko Haram dead, three soldiers injured.

Teachers of Adeniran Ogunsanya College of Education, Agbara, protest pay by barricading the gates of their institution. During the demonstration, the protesters were engaged in a scuffle with management, which led to the non-lethal stabbing of one.
A mothers group protests ongoing violence at the hands of Boko Haram and Fulani tribes in Alausa on 09/03. The protest caused traffic problems in the city.
Support staff at the University of Ibadan protest non-payment of salaries on 09/03.

column7: PENGASSAN: Petroleum and Natural Gas Senior Staff Association of Nigeria
column17: PENGASSAN, was well as other unions, shut down the operations of Nigerian National petroleum Corporation (NNPC) nationwide, specificity barring union members from entering an office in Abuja.
A Fulani group attacks Logo LGA on 10/03, killing two. The group had attacked the area earlier in the week.
Military forces engage Boko Haram in Daba Magagi (Daban-Masara), wound and capture a prominent leader of the group.
Military forces clear a Boko Haram camp at Alajeri, Guzamala LGA, killing 40 and recovering weapons on 10/03.
Two families clash in the palace of Ooni of Ife on 10/03 over which would produce the next Obalufe (second-tier leader). No injuries were reported.
Unidentified persons kidnap an Edo State magistrate in Obadan on 10/03, reasons not known.
A Fulani group attacks Obangedde on 10/03, killing one and wounding others. The group had attacked the area earlier in the week.
Members and leaders of the APC protest at a party headquarters against alleged disenfranchisement by the Buhari administration.

A member of the PDP attacked a APC supporter with an axe at Yaba village in Abaji, Abuja. The extent of the victims injuries are not clear. Following the attack members of the APC mobalizied themselves and attacked a group of PDP supporters, provoking a clash.

A member of the PDP attacked an APC supporter with an axe at Yaba village in Abaji, Abuja. The extent of the vicims injuries are not clear. Following the attack members of the APC mobalizied themselves and attacked a group of PDP supporters, provoking a clash.
Members of the Islamic Movement of Nigeria staged a protest in Illorin on 11/03 against the detention of the Shiite leader Sheik Ibrahim Al ZakZak.
Eighteen are dead following a large explosion targeting a bank. Many other injured. Perpetrators not known.
Residents of Okpai protest neglect from an area oil company, demand the reconstruction of recently demolished road.
Military forces ambushed a group of Boko Haram forces near Komala and Musafanari villages in Sambisa forest. Several members of Boko Haram reported wounded. The clash took place ""at the weekend.""
Boko Haram forces ambush military forces at Banki, four Boko Haram dead, weapons recovered. The ambush occurred ""at the weekend.""

Ogoni youths from the Rivers South East senatorial district ""at the weekend"" took to the streets of Bori in protest over the alleged ""hate speech"" of Governor Ezebunwo Nyesom Wike against the Ogoni population in the area.

Nigerian forces ""at the weekend"" repulse a Boko Haram attack on Pulka. A similar Boko Haram attack had occurred in Pulka on 08/03. Seventeen Boko Haram dead, weapons recovered. Additionally, the forces rescued 95 hostages along the nearby Bitta-Pridang-Manawashe axis, as well as 27 who had escaped from Mayo Ali village.
Members of the Aga Orunto Ruling Family staged a peaceful protest to Ooni of Ifes palace over the appointment of new Obalufe.

Fulanis attack and ""take over"" the Logo LGA communities of Ukemberegya, Bwarer, Mbawar, Gov and Gambe Tiev on 13/03. Two reported deaths. Other villages in the area were raided in the attack but remain unoccupied.
On 13 March 2016, 2 factions of a local armed group clashed in Gombi (Gombi, Adamawa) killing at least seven people and leaving 19 injured.

Military forces clear Boko Haram from Gwashari village along Damboa-Bale road, killing one and capturing three others. They also recovered 1 Dane gun, AK-47 rifle magazine, 2 knives, assorted drugs and the sum of N142,000.

Members of the Ekiti State House of Assembly staged a peace protest at both the US and UK embassies in Abuja, calling on the two countries to intervene after the Ekiti State House invaded by Department of State Services (DSS) on 04/03.
For the second day, members of the Aga Orunto Ruling Family staged a peaceful protest to Ooni of Ifes palace over the appointment of new Obalufe.

Ogun State workers, attempting to enter the Ogun State secretirat, throw stones at an NLC lawmakers car in protest of of his wishes of a labour strike. In response, police released 15 Alsatian dogs to scatter the protesters. No reported injuries.

Youths of Anguwan Rukuba, in Jos, burnt a police station in the area after members of the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency (NDLEA) and the Nigeria Police arrested suppliers and users of a illicit drug the previous evening. No reported injury.
JAMB candidates (Joint Admission and Matriculation Board) protest for the removal of the registrar when they believe their grades had been marked down in an effort to privative the university.
Several nurse/medical unions protest unpaid allowences in Abuja during the morning hours.
Electricity consumers in Calabar protest a tax hike.
Residents protesting neglect of an area oil company destroy pipelines. A similarly motivated protest took place in the area on 11/03.
Bauchi pensioners protest non-payment of their monthly stipend on 15/03.
On 15 March 2016, Boko Haram and a local armed group clashed in Huyum (Askira/Uba, Borno). 5 dead with two of the dead being civilians bystanders.
Military forces ambush and clear the Boko Haram camps of Golgore (15/03) and Bulasari (16/03). During the operation ""a number"" of Boko Haram were killed and soldier was injured.
Military forces ambush and clear the Boko Haram camps of Golgore (15/03) and Bulasari (16/03). During the operation ""a number"" of Boko Haram were killed and soldier was injured.

column7: MSSN: Muslim Student Society of Nigeria; Students (Nigeria)
column17: MSSN members of the University of Lagos protest their groups non-recognition and a ban of activities by the school.
Hair dressers ""during the week"" (source dated 18/03) blocked the major entrance to Wuse market in Abuja to protest alleged harassment from officials of the markets management company.

column7: CDHR: Committee for the Defence of Human Rights
column17: CDHR (among a coalition of other groups) protests the alleged end of an anti political corruption crusade in Ikeja.
27 people were killed and 35 others were injured in an early morning Boko Haram double suicide attack on a mosque at Umarari-Molai (Dolori), a village 6 kilometres from Maiduguri.
Students of University of Jos as well as other youths took to the streets to protest against the shooting of a fellow student by security personnel during an arrest the previous day.
A coalition of groups protest unfavourable tax policy in Ado-Ekiti.
Two are dead and ten houses destroyed on 17/03 when Adadama militia attacked Ochanyim town in violence related to a border dispute.
Residents of Gbagyi Villa in Kaduna protest the plan by the Kaduna State Urban Planning and Development Agency to demolish area structures.
Unidentified gunmen attacked Mgbuitanwo, Emohua Local Government Area, beheading a man and abducting another.
Residents of Eket protest an area oil company over non-compensation following an oil spill.
Fulanis attack Tombo on 18/03, killing 15 residents.

A prominent member of the APC and the director of the NIMASA survive after an assassination attempt by unknown gunmen while travelling in their vehicle. Following the attack the assailants were pursued by security officials. One of the perpetrators became injured during a 30 minute gunfight.

Non-violent activity: A prominent member of the APC and the director of the NIMASA survive after an assassination attempt with no injury by unknown gunmen while travelling in their vehicle. Following the attack the assailants were pursued by security officials. One of the perpetrators became injured during a 30 minute gunfight.
One is dead in election day related violence when unidentified gunmen opened fire on a group of people at Abalama in Asari Toru local government area.
One person is shot and killed at Ogboloko community in Abua/Odual LGA in election day violence. Perpatrators not known.
Four are killed in election day violence in Eleme LGA on 19/03. Details of perpetrators and victim are limited.
One is killed in election day violence at Nonwa (either Kenbawa or Udume) on 19/03. Details limited.
On 19 March 2016, a local armed group clashed with unidentified gunmen in Daraga (Maru, Zamfara) killing 3. This follows an attack by the same unidentified gunmen.
Six are killed when unidentified gunmen invaded Daraga on 19/03. Following the attack a group, which killed three, armed villagers attacked the suspected gunmen, killing an additional three.
Military forces clear Boko Harams Dalori camp, killing 18 members (Xinhua reports 27), including a prominent leader known as the ""Ameer of Dalore."" Additionally, 67 of their hostages were freed.
Military air forces carry out strikes on the Allagarno forest area of Yobe, causalities not known.
Military forces ambush Boko Haram at Dawashi location, Borno State, kill seven.
Military forces clear a Boko Haram camp at Musari on 21/03, killing 58. One soldier reportedly lost in the battle.
Health workers in Ikare-Akoko protest over unpaid salaries on 21/03.
Ijaw youths attacked a group of Urhobo woman who were returning to their farms in Ogbe Ijoh on 23/03. Casualties not known. The attack lead to a clash between the two ethnic groups later in the week.

Military forces clear Boko Haram camps in Menari, Bulamari, Zangebe, Maafa, Mijigine, Baale and Kaltaram villages in Mafa LGA on 23/03, kill five, rescue 180 hostages and recover a large cache of weapons.

Military forces clear Boko Haram camps in Menari, Bulamari, Zangebe, Maafa, Mijigine, Baale and Kaltaram villages in Mafa LGA on 23/03, kill five, rescue 180 hostages and recover a large cache of weapons.

Military forces clear the areas of Wumbi, Tunish and Tilem in Kala/Balge on 23/03. The Boko Haram training camp at Tilem was destroyed. ""Heavy"" [Boko Haram] causalities reported, 567 civilian hostages.

Military forces clear Boko Haram camps in Menari, Bulamari, Zangebe, Maafa, Mijigine, Baale and Kaltaram villages in Mafa LGA on 23/03, kill five, rescue 180 hostages and recover a large cache of weapons.

Military forces clear the areas of Wumbi, Tunish and Tilem in Kala/Balge on 23/03. The Boko Haram training camp at Tilem was destroyed. ""Heavy"" [Boko Haram] causalities reported, 567 civilian hostages.

Vigilantes ""last week"" (source dated 30/03) attacked and nearly lynched a group of people posing as police officers in Lagos. Those impersonating the officers did so to illegally impound vehicles and sell them.

Military forces clear the areas of Wumbi, Tunish and Tilem in Kala/Balge on 23/03. The Boko Haram training camp at Tilem was destroyed. ""Heavy"" [Boko Haram] causalities reported, 567 civilian hostages.
Boko Haram abducts 18 women and two girls from Sabongari in Adamawa on 23/03.
A Hausa trader, along with his Fulani business partner are killed by Tiv militia in Ibi LGA.

Military forces clear Boko Haram camps in Menari, Bulamari, Zangebe, Maafa, Mijigine, Baale and Kaltaram villages in Mafa LGA on 23/03, kill five, rescue 180 hostages and recover a large cache of weapons.
Residents of Eket barricade roads in protest over a delay in payment of compensation from an oil company following a spill.
Urhobo and Ijaw youths clash in Udu LGA over a blocked road relating to a recent attack on a group of Urhobo women. The clash led to the over-running and looting a police station. ""Scores"" wounded.

column6: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: Civilian JTF (in coordination with military forces) stop two potential female suicide bombers at Umulari Mulai, about six kilometres away from Maiduguri on the Maiduguri-Damboa road. One of them detonated her bomb when the Civilian JTF vigilantes on duty around the area asked 'who is there.' The second bomber scurried away and holed up nearby. But she was discovered and shot when soldiers came to the site. Her bomb was later detonated. Only the two bombers reported dead.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill a police officer in Satellite Town on 25/03. The motive of the killing is not known.
Gunmen described as ""land grabbers"" on 25/03 attacked a group of protesters against the practice of Okada riders in Isiwu, killing one.
Party violence among the APC at a political rally in Dobi causes one death. Eight arrested the following day.
Abductors kidnapped an army Colonel while he travelled with his wife in Kamaza on 26/03. The colonel was later found dead.

Military forces clear Madube Cikin along the Bita-Madube Ciki-Njubul axis, killing four Boko Haram and rescuing 54. At least one soldier injured. Date(s) of the operation vague. Military announcement made on 28/03. Presumably, the operation took place several days earlier.
National Insurance Commission employees protest agency mismanagement and corruption in Abuja.
Kuteb militia attack Takum on 27/03, killing 20 Tiv.
30 are killed by Kuteb militia at Yongogba, a Tiv settlement along Takum-Kpashe Road.
Fulani militia attack the Tiv village of Butu on 27/03, beating an older man into a coma when he was unable to flee. The Fulanis had given notice of their coming attack on 25/03.
Military forces clear Boko Haram from Bolunga village on 28/03, kill five and capture one.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: A joint military operation among the Civilians JTF and regular army on 28/03 ""[that] took place at Iza [sic] general area"" yields 29 Boko Haram dead, 72 rescued civilians and the clearing of Mbollena and Shamari areas. One member of the Civilian JTF was wounded in a vehicle accident.
Military forces gain control of the 'spiritual power base' of Boko Haram, Alagarno as well as the neighbouring villages of Yajiwa, Joba, and Mosa on 28/03. ""Several"" Boko Haram killed.
Military forces gain control of the 'spiritual power base' of Boko Haram, Alagarno as well as the neighbouring villages of Yajiwa, Joba, and Mosa on 28/03. ""Several"" Boko Haram killed.
Military forces gain control of the 'spiritual power base' of Boko Haram, Alagarno as well as the neighbouring villages of Yajiwa, Joba, and Mosa on 28/03. ""Several"" Boko Haram killed.
Military forces gain control of the 'spiritual power base' of Boko Haram, Alagarno as well as the neighbouring villages of Yajiwa, Joba, and Mosa on 28/03. ""Several"" Boko Haram killed.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: A joint military operation among the Civilians JTF and regular army on 28/03 ""[that] took place at Iza [sic] general area"" yields 29 Boko Haram dead, 72 rescued civilians and the clearing of Mbollena and Shamari areas. One member of the Civilian JTF was wounded in a vehicle accident.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: A joint military operation among the Civilians JTF and regular army on 28/03 ""[that] took place at Iza [sic] general area"" yields 29 Boko Haram dead, 72 rescued civilians and the clearing of Mbollena and Shamari areas. One member of the Civilian JTF was wounded in a vehicle accident.
Military forces clear Boko Haram from Gare village near Sambisa Forest on 28/03, killing one and rescuing 36 prisoners.
Eruwa Polytechnic students violently protest over alleged admission flaws and an increase in fees on 29/03. Police use tear gas, two injured.

Scores of residents in Arepo in Ogun State took to the street to protest the alleged murder of three members of the community by naval operatives deployed to safeguard the pipelines in the area. The deaths of the three may have been related to a fight in a beer parlour.
Unidentified gunmen attack Ohali-Elu town in Ogba/Egbema/Ndoni LGA on 30/03 killing between 6-12 at a funeral.
Over 100 residents Otodo Gbame community protested at the Lagos State Government House on 30/03 against dredging and sand-filling activities near their homes.

Two are dead and several houses destroyed during tit-for-tat attacks between Uneme-Ekpedo and Bekuma-Okpameri communities over land rights on 30/03.
