An Uneme youth was initially killed for picking a mango from a tree that the Bekuma argue belonged to them. The Uneme later attacked Bekuma residents.

Two are dead and several houses destroyed during tit-for-tat attacks between Uneme-Ekpedo and Bekuma-Okpameri communities over land rights on 30/03. An Uneme youth was initially killed for picking a mango from a tree that the Bekuma argue belonged to them. The Uneme later attacked Bekuma residents.

Members of the PDP gather at the Independent National Electoral Commission in Abuja to protest the continued delay to act on the Supreme Court judgment in respect of the winners of the National Assembly seats in Anambra state in the 2015 general elections.
Members of the Islamic Movement peacefully protest for the release of their leader, Ibraheem El-Zakzaky near Zaria on 31/03.
Members of the Islamic Movement peacefully protest for the release of their leader, Ibraheem El-Zakzaky in Kaduna on 31/03.
Military forces clear Wulwuta of Boko Haram on 31/03, kill 9, rescue 21 and recover weapons. One soldier wounded.
On 31/03 a group of Okada riders protest the killing of three of their colleagues by criminal elements earlier in the week. The group blocked several major roads throughout the city.
Arrests: Security forces arrest the leader of Ansaru, a splinter group of Boko Haram in Lokoja on 01/04.
People of Effurun community on 01/04 took to the streets, protesting alleged military victimisation of residents of their neighbourhood after a chairman has a violent encounter with a sailor.
Youths numbering over 1000 on 01/04 blocked the Ibrahim Yakowa expressway around Kamazo, a suburb of Kaduna metropolis to protest lack of electricity in their area for nearly a year.
Lagos bus drivers protest ""poor staff welfare"" on 01/04.
Members of IPOB kidnap and kill five Hausa-Fulani motorcycle operators in Isuikwato LGA, date unknown, source dated 10/04. The remains of the five were later discovered in Umuanyi forest.
A vigilante group attacks and sets two suspected thieves alight on Gboko on 02/04.
Youths numbering over 1000 blocked the Ibrahim Yakowa expressway in Chikun LGA to protest lack of power in their area.
A member of the staff of a OPC member is kidnapped and killed by Fulanis during the weekend of 01/04 - 03/04 in Ilado.
A group of youths protest the arrest of a neighbour on 02/04, begin a fracas with police. Two injured after police opened fire on the demonstrators.
The Women Arise for Justice protest the non-prosecution of violent perpetrators of killings during a recent area election.

Military forces kill 15, arrest 12 and recover weapons, hostages during a clearing operation of several Bama localities on 03/04 including: Madawaya, Jere, Kardile, Koujili, Ngenere, Maksamari, Douse, Bembem, Zombulum and Taraji. Military forces also captured the villages of Kyare, Kadawu, Gineba, Bosheri and Ajiri without violence making only arrests.

Military forces kill 15, arrest 12 and recover weapons, hostages during a clearing operation of several Bama localities on 03/04 including: Madawaya, Jere, Kardile, Koujili, Ngenere, Maksamari, Douse, Bembem, Zombulum and Taraji. Military forces also captured the villages of Kyare, Kadawu, Gineba, Bosheri and Ajiri without violence making only arrests.
Military forces capture Bula Umar from Boko Haram on 03/04 and recover a large volume of bomb making material. No violence reported.
Military forces capture the Bama communities of Kyare, Kadawu, Gineba, Bosheri and Ajiri from Boko Haram on 03/04. No reported violence.

Four or five are killed by Fulani in Wannune during the overnight of 03/04. The following morning a group of youths protest the killings by barricading a road. Among the dead was an APC youth leader. The killings are believed to have been sparked after unidentified youths of the village killed two Fulanis early in the day of 03/04.

Military forces kill 15, arrest 12 and recover weapons, hostages during a clearing operation of several Bama localities on 03/04 including: Madawaya, Jere, Kardile, Koujili, Ngenere, Maksamari, Douse, Bembem, Zombulum and Taraji. Military forces also captured the villages of Kyare, Kadawu, Gineba, Bosheri and Ajiri without violence making only arrests.

Military forces kill 15, arrest 12 and recover weapons, hostages during a clearing operation of several Bama localities on 03/04 including: Madawaya, Jere, Kardile, Koujili, Ngenere, Maksamari, Douse, Bembem, Zombulum and Taraji. Military forces also captured the villages of Kyare, Kadawu, Gineba, Bosheri and Ajiri without violence making only arrests.

Military forces kill 15, arrest 12 and recover weapons, hostages during a clearing operation of several Bama localities on 03/04 including: Madawaya, Jere, Kardile, Koujili, Ngenere, Maksamari, Douse, Bembem, Zombulum and Taraji. Military forces also captured the villages of Kyare, Kadawu, Gineba, Bosheri and Ajiri without violence making only arrests.
Military forces capture the Bama communities of Kyare, Kadawu, Gineba, Bosheri and Ajiri from Boko Haram on 03/04. No reported violence.

Four or five are killed by Fulani in Wannune during the overnight of 03/04. The following morning a group of youths protest the killings by barricading a road. Among the dead was an APC youth leader. The killings are believed to have been sparked after unidentified youths of the village killed two Fulanis early in the day of 03/04.

Military forces kill 15, arrest 12 and recover weapons, hostages during a clearing operation of several Bama localities on 03/04 including: Madawaya, Jere, Kardile, Koujili, Ngenere, Maksamari, Douse, Bembem, Zombulum and Taraji. Military forces also captured the villages of Kyare, Kadawu, Gineba, Bosheri and Ajiri without violence making only arrests.
A communal clash related to an ""invasion"" by ""strangers"" in Ibrede causes the deaths of two and the destruction of property. Date not known - source dated 04/04.
Residents in Warri on 04/04 block roads in protest against epileptic electricity supply in their neighbourhood.

Four or five are killed by Fulani during the overnight of 03/04. The following morning a group of youths protest the killings by barricading a road in Wannune. Among the dead was an APC youth leader. The killings are believed to have been sparked after unidentified youths of the village killed two Fulanis early in the day of 03/04.

column8: MEND: Movement for the Emancipation of the Niger Delta
column17: Members of MEND attack a police station in Ngo, battle a resisting police forces and stealing weapons. No reported causalities.
A demonstration at Alaba International Market, Ojo when members of a furniture dealers association protest the ""unjust"" removal of their chairman.

Women from Umuduruegwelle community in Ehime Mbano Local Government Area of Imo State protest, took to the street to protest against what they described as ""the incessant rape and murder of innocent mothers in the area.""

Police in Kubwa on 06/04 evening averted a clash between supporters of the All Progressives Congress (APC) and those of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Kukwaba area of Kubwa, Abuja. A police source said although no life was lost in the clash, the windscreen of a Toyota car parked within the area belonging to a non-partisan citizen was smashed. The unrest is related to a PDP rally held in the area.
The residents of Church Street in Ijora Badia have protested over the release of a police Inspector who allegedly shot three residents and injured others during a recent naming ceremony.
Hundreds of students of the University of Lagos blocked the major road leading to the institutions main campus on 06/04 to protest against epileptic power supply and poor water supply.
UNILAG students protest electricity issues for a second day.
After three are killed when tipper lorry accidentally crashes into a crowd Osholo village in Etsako East, a angered vigilante mob set the two drivers ablaze. Date not clear, source dated 07/04.
Suspected Fulani herdsmen reportedly killed a youth leader in Tsetia village, Wannune on 08/04.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: Military forces along with the Civilian JTF intercept and repel five female Boko Haram suicide bombers attempting to enter Maiduguri at Polo and Giwa Barrack areas. Three soldiers were injured in the battle. All five of the attackers were reported dead. The clash occurred before day break.
Students of Adekunle Ajasin University violently protest the death of a fellow student due to a recent motorcycle accident.
Fulanis reportedly shot and killed a member of Delta State University staff and a farmer in Abraka. The killings were described as ""in cold blood.""
Journalists narrowly escape a deadly attack by ""political youths"" during ward elections in the area. Extent of injuries not known.

Ndoro militias attack Dobi and Maisuma villages on 10/04, killing 50 Fulani residents and steeling livestock. The attack was apprently motovated by revenge after the body of a Ndoro woman was found nearby and the militia blamed the Fulani.

Ndoro militias attack Dobi and Maisuma villages on 10/04, killing 50 Fulani residents and steeling livestock. The attack was apprently motovated by revenge after the body of a Ndoro woman was found nearby and the militia blamed the Fulani.

The body of a Ndoro woman in found by her kinsmen in a rural area of Gashaka. The villagers, believing Fulani were responsible, mobilised militias and attack two Fulani villages. The blame of the Fulanis may be an assumption.

Three are dead, including a police officer following a violent two day protest at the University of Port Harcourt over a policy that prevents students from writing examinations. The violence caused a month-long cancellation of classes.

Three are dead, including a police officer following a violent two day protest at the University of Port Harcourt over a policy that prevents students from writing examinations. The violence caused a month-long cancellation of classes.
Ugbene retaliate to the severe assault on one of their members by armed men from Ejuona by setting fire to Edjuona dwellings, leading to severe injuries.
Fulani herdsmen on 11/04 attacked Angai and Ndole villages in Gashak Local Council area of Taraba State, killing at least 44.
Protesting students of the Benue State University trooped into the streets, crippling business activities and barricading the Makurdi-Gboko federal highway over recent hike in tuition.

An Ugbene man is attacked with machetes by members of the Ejuona community. The conflict between the people of Ejuona and their Ugbene neighbours is over which of the groups are indigenous to the area and which were previously slaves.
Several Igbo traders in Yenagoa took a protest to the police headquarters complaining that their safety was no longer guaranteed by authorities in the state after several incidents of violence.
Youths protest against a conduct inquiry into the APC by the Kaduna State government on 12/04. It is not clear if the youths were mempers or supporters of the APC.

Students of the University of Port Harcourt protest, calling for the immediate removal of their Vice Chancellor, Prof Ndowa Lale, over what they described as his poor response to the incident that claimed the lives of their colleagues. Students had protested the two previous days over examination fees.

Nigerian and Cameroonian forces carried out joint Boko Haram-clearing operations in Bama LGA (Nbaga, Bula, Dabube, Ybiri, Greya and Suduwa towns), as well as across the border into Cameroon clearing a total of 12 locations. Of operations in the two countries, 22 Boko Haram dead (unknown exact number from each location), 1,275 hostages rescued.

Nigerian and Cameroonian forces carried out joint Boko Haram-clearing operations in Bama LGA (Nbaga, Bula, Dabube, Ybiri, Greya and Suduwa towns), as well as across the border into Cameroon clearing a total of 12 locations. Of operations in the two countries, 22 Boko Haram dead (unknown exact number from each location), 1,275 hostages rescued.

Nigerian and Cameroonian forces carried out joint Boko Haram-clearing operations in Bama LGA (Nbaga, Bula, Dabube, Ybiri, Greya and Suduwa towns), as well as across the border into Cameroon clearing a total of 12 locations. Of operations in the two countries, 22 Boko Haram dead (unknown exact number from each location), 1,275 hostages rescued.

Nigerian and Cameroonian forces carried out joint Boko Haram-clearing operations in Bama LGA (Nbaga, Bula, Dabube, Ybiri, Greya and Suduwa towns), as well as across the border into Cameroon clearing a total of 12 locations. Of operations in the two countries, 22 Boko Haram dead (unknown exact number from each location), 1,275 hostages rescued.
Traders protest, blocking roads in Udu over a market levy.

""Political thugs"" attacked and injured some Abuja Municipal Area Council (AMAC) members during chairmanship and councillorship rerun elections in some wards. The identities of the perpetrators are not known. Additionally, residents said the perpetrators invaded some polling units, snatched ballot boxes, destroyed ballot papers

A polling agent of the All Progressives Congress (APC) was stabbed by suspected ""hired thugs"" during the re-run chairmanship election at Gurfata village, Ibwa ward, Gwagwalada. The extent of the victims injuries are not known. The perpetrators had allededly also prevented others from voting in the area.
Commercial Motorcyclists aka Okada riders in Egbeda, Alimosho Local Government area protest against their unions practices on 13/04.

The Zamfara State Ministry for Local Government and Chieftaincy Affairs is nearly lynched by aggrieved council workers over unpaid salaries before security forces were able to mount a rescue. No mention of injuries or direct clashes between the rioters and the police.
Unidentified gunmen attack Bomu on 14/04, killing two, including a member of the PDP. A similar attack occurred in nearby Ogali.
Unidentified gunmen attack Elele on 14/04, killing two and kidnapping another.
Three persons are killed in Tundun Adabu, Obi local government area of Nasarawa state, during a violent clash between Eggon and Gwandare ethnic groups.

Two persons have been reportedly killed while several houses set ablaze following a clash between Tiv and Jukuns ethnic tribe in Abinsi on 14/04. The clash was believed to be related to the control of a fishing pond. The Daily Trust reports seven deaths.

Constituents from Ado/Ogbadibo/Okpokwu in Benue State protest at the National Assembly on 14/04 after their recently elected PDP MP waas not sworn-in as scheduled. The election result had been contested, though up held for the PDP politician by a court.
Members of the National Youth Service Corps (NYSC) protested the states government inability to pay their transport allowances on 14/04.
Unidentified gunmen attack Ogali on 14/04, killing two, including a member of the PDP. A similar attack occurred in nearby Bomu.

Clashes between Fulanis and farmers throughout Benue State, namely Agatu, Buruku, Tarka, Kwande, Logo, Makurdi and Guma LGAs, cause mass dislocation of the population. Date within the month and exact locations within the LGAs were not reported.

Clashes between Fulanis and farmers throughout Benue State, namely Agatu, Buruku, Tarka, Kwande, Logo, Makurdi and Guma LGAs, cause mass dislocation of the population. Date within the month and exact locations within the LGAs were not reported.

Clashes between Fulanis and farmers throughout Benue State, namely Agatu, Buruku, Tarka, Kwande, Logo, Makurdi and Guma LGAs, cause mass dislocation of the population. Date within the month and exact locations within the LGAs were not reported.
Unidentified gunmen stop a bus along the Ikorodu road, target a specific passenger, kill him, and drive away. The motive of the killing is not known.

Clashes between Fulanis and farmers throughout Benue State, namely Agatu, Buruku, Tarka, Kwande, Logo, Makurdi and Guma LGAs, cause mass dislocation of the population. Date within the month and exact locations within the LGAs were not reported.
11 dead, including civilians, over a three day communal clash in Inyima village between its towns militia and their Onyadama neighbours over land. Exact causalities not known.

Clashes between Fulanis and farmers throughout Benue State, namely Agatu, Buruku, Tarka, Kwande, Logo, Makurdi and Guma LGAs, cause mass dislocation of the population. Date within the month and exact locations within the LGAs were not reported.
Military forces repel a Boko Haram attack at Pulka on 15/04, killing seven and recovering weapons.

Clashes between Fulanis and farmers throughout Benue State, namely Agatu, Buruku, Tarka, Kwande, Logo, Makurdi and Guma LGAs, cause mass dislocation of the population. Date within the month and exact locations within the LGAs were not reported.

Clashes between Fulanis and farmers throughout Benue State, namely Agatu, Buruku, Tarka, Kwande, Logo, Makurdi and Guma LGAs, cause mass dislocation of the population. Date within the month and exact locations within the LGAs were not reported.
Military forces on patrol encounter Boko Haram at or near Wulge (Urge), killing 27, clearing several camps and rescuing 455 hostages.
11 dead, including civilians, over a three day communal clash in Inyima village between its towns militia and their Onyadama neighbours over land. Exact causalities not known.

24 thatched shops were destroyed and seven houses razed following a communal clash between the Kudung people and Pwel people of Dawaki, both in Kanke local government areas of Plateau State. [...] the genesis of the clash was the unmasking of a Kudung ""masquerade"" by the Pwel people who were on a reprisal mission following a similar action done to their masquerade by the Kudung people three months ago. The clash occurred over two days. No causalities reported.
11 dead, including civilians, over a three day communal clash in Inyima village between its towns militia and their Onyadama neighbours over land. Exact causalities not known.
Seven are killed in a farmland dispute between members of Rumu and Isgogo communities at Kubula village in Zuru local government area of Kebbi State on 17/04.

column7: NUEE: National Union of Electricity Employees
column17: Members of the National Union of Electricity Employees ""invade"" their offices in Plateau, Benue, Bauchi and Gombe states over unfavourable working conditions. The workers carried slogan bearing signs. The protesters blocked roads in Jos, and may have in other areas.

column7: NUAHP: Nigerian Union of Allied Health Professionals; Teachers (Nigeria); Health Workers (Nigeria)
column17: Members of Nigerian Union of Allied Health Professionals (NUAHP), University of Ilorin Teaching Hospital (UITH) branch protested against managements plans to privatise a section of the hospital.
Electricity customers protest poor service in Ikeja, demand a recall of workers.

24 thatched shops were destroyed and seven houses razed following a communal clash between the Kudung people and Pwel people of Dawaki, both in Kanke local government areas of Plateau State. [...] the genesis of the clash was the unmasking of a Kudung ""masquerade"" by the Pwel people who were on a reprisal mission following a similar action done to their masquerade by the Kudung people three months ago. The clash occurred over two days. No causalities reported.
Auto parts traders protest in Nkpor over management issues.

Scores of protesters staged a protest at the Federal Ministry of Communications over the decision of the government to withdraw their appointment and cancel their recruitment by the National Information Technology Development Agency.

column7: NUEE: National Union of Electricity Employees
column17: Members of the National Union of Electricity Employees ""invade"" their offices in Plateau, Benue, Bauchi and Gombe states over unfavourable working conditions. The workers carried slogan bearing signs. The protesters blocked roads in Jos, and may have in other areas.

column7: NUEE: National Union of Electricity Employees
column17: Members of the National Union of Electricity Employees ""invade"" their offices in Plateau, Benue, Bauchi and Gombe states over unfavourable working conditions. The workers carried slogan bearing signs. The protesters blocked roads in Jos, and may have in other areas.
Military forces repel a Boko Haram attack at a Karetu (Kareto) military base on 18/04. 30 Boko Haram dead, 24 soldiers injured.
Boko Haram attacked a group of military forces in Damasak, near the border with Cameroon on 18/04. The source speculated there were heavy causalities from both sides.

column7: NUEE: National Union of Electricity Employees
column17: Members of the National Union of Electricity Employees ""invade"" their offices in Plateau, Benue, Bauchi and Gombe states over unfavourable working conditions. The workers carried slogan bearing signs. The protesters blocked roads in Jos, and may have in other areas.
The Nigeria Labour Congress (NLC) and civil society groups protest at the offices of the Ikeja Electricity Company in Lagos over the recent termination of 400 staff amidst epileptic supply of power.
Suspected Boko Haram gunmen on horseback killed at least 11 people in Zango village, Gulani LGA on the evening of 19/04 and into the following morning.
Army and Navy forces clash with oil pipeline vandals in Ibafo, killing five on 19/04.

Social and economic activities were on 19/04 disrupted for several hours in Asaba, the Delta State capital as thousands of people took to streets to protest the growing involvement of Fulani herdsmen in criminal activities in the state.
Boko Haram ambushes a Generals convoy in Bama on 19/04, resulting in a clash. One soldier was killed and others injured, ""some"" Boko Haram dead. The General escaped unhurt.
Employees of a telecommunications company protest in Port Harcourt on 20/04 over the impending termination of several jobs.
Police of Bwari division (Tudun Wada) clash with a group of vigilantes over grazing rights to land. Several injuries reported. Date not clear - source dated 21/04.
Suspected Boko Haram gunmen on horseback killed at least 11 people in Zango village, Gulani LGA on the evening of 19/04 and into the following morning.
Two suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers attack a displacement camp in Banki on 20/04, seven dead. The bombers were guising as refugees.
Electricity customers protest in Asaba on 20/04 over cost of service.
Police disperse violent electricity distribution protesters in Enugu. The protesters had destroyed company property and manhandled staff.

Military forces, along with BOYES, carry out clearance operations Damboa-Bale-Gwoza, including the towns of Mufurundi, Kaleri, Masemari, Bego, Bale, Gadzama and Gagantilo. During the operation, the troops encountered and detonated an Improvised Explosive Device (IED), buried by the militants at Gadzama village. At Bego village the forces kill nine Boko Haram and rescued 157 hostages.

Military forces, along with BOYES, carry out clearance operations Damboa-Bale-Gwoza, including the towns of Mufurundi, Kaleri, Masemari, Bego, Bale, Gadzama and Gagantilo. During the operation, the troops encountered and detonated an Improvised Explosive Device (IED), buried by the militants at Gadzama village.

Military forces, along with BOYES, carry out clearance operations Damboa-Bale-Gwoza, including the towns of Mufurundi, Kaleri, Masemari, Bego, Bale, Gadzama and Gagantilo. During the operation, the troops encountered and detonated an Improvised Explosive Device (IED), buried by the militants at Gadzama village.
Fulani men on 21/04 attacked Igo village in Donga LGA, killing seven Tiv. The attack may have be a reprisal for a recent robbery.
Unidentified persons invade a polling unit at Afon LCDA, Abeokuta North attack people and stealing ballot boxes.
Electricity customers protest in Warri on 21/04 over epileptic service.
Military forces encounter Boko Haram while on patrol toward Diema, Sigel and Kala area on 21/04. Eight Boko Haram dead.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: Military forces clear Bulari and Tori locations (unknown LGA) of Boko Haram. During the operation, 10 Boko Haram are killed and one was captured alive. Two Civilian JTF accompanying the troops lost their lives. The troops rescued 7 civilians and recovered a Volkswagen Golf car, 15 bicycles and various bags of foodstuffs.

Arrests: Military forces arrest four Boko Haram ""kingpins"" at Rann, including Umara Mai Gyaran Rediyo (Radio Technician), Umaru Mai Nama, (who specializes in cattle rustling and sale), Alifa Makinta (a specialist on stealing foodstuff) and Balu Jugudum (in charge of stolen jewelleries).

At least 10 people have been killed and several houses burnt in fresh violence between the Wurkum and Shumo ethnic groups in Karin-Lamido LGA. The violence began when Wurkum militia attacked a Shumo village and civilians. In reprisal Shumo militia attacked a Wurkum area. Both attackers occurred near Balasa.

At least 10 people have been killed and several houses burnt in fresh violence between the Wurkum and Shumo ethnic groups in Karin-Lamido LGA. The violence began when Wurkum militia attacked a Shumo village and civilians. In reprisal Shumo militia attacked a Wurkum area. Both attackers occurred near Balasa.
Services at Lagos University Teaching Hospital, LUTH, Idi Araba, Lagos, were interrupted in 23/04 as dozens of protesters demonstrated at the hospitals main gates to protest the alleged negligence.
Fulanis attack the Bali locations of Bornon Kurku, Anchogo and Tortondo, killing a suspected six. Date not known, source dated 23/04.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: Military forces stop a suicide bomber in Umarari area of Maiduguri. The suspect detonated his explosives after he was halted by security agents and members of the Civilian Joint Task Force, killing only himself.
On 23 April 2016, IS West Africa attacked Nigerian forces and destroyed 6 military vehicles and two tanks in Borno state. Weapons and military equipment were also seized.
A vigilante mob attacks and set two suspected thieves ablaze in Warri on 24/04.
Military forces ambush a group of Boko Haram near Alagarmo on 24/04, kill five.

column7: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
column17: Members of NANS protest against the """"unjust"""" expulsion of a fellow student on 25/04. The protesters blocked several roads in and around the institution. The protest lasted over two days and caused the school to close indefinitely.
Fulanis attack Ukpabi Nimbo on 25/04, 48 believed dead.

Suspected Fulani herdsmen kidnapped eight persons in Obiaruku, Ukwuani Local Government Area of Delta State on 25/04 and held them hostage for several hours during which the victims were allegedly tortured.
Unidentified men murder a Osun Chief on Oshogbo on 25/04. The reason for the killing is not known.
A Abuja civil service union protests a delay in pay on 25/04. Anti-Saraki (president of the Senate) demonstrators also assemble at the national assembly to protest.
A vigilante mob attacks and sets three suspected thieves ablaze in Warri on 25/04. A similar attack took place the previous day.

Major health institutions in Ekiti State, including the Federal Teaching Hospital, Ido Ekiti(FETHI), the Ekiti State University Teaching Hospital (EKSUTH), Ido Ekiti, and other general hospitals were paralysed on 25/04 when their staffs protested after several doctors were recently killed in an auto accident.

column7: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
column17: Members of NANS protest against the """"unjust"""" expulsion of a fellow student on 25/04. The protesters blocked several roads in and around the institution. The protest lasted over two days and caused the school to close indefinitely.

Troops of the 7 Brigade, 8 Task Force Division of the Nigerian Army who were on clearance operation around Gratte in Kukawa LGA of Borno State killed seven Boko Haram militants including a notorious kingpin popularly known as the Albani of Monguno.

Protesters, under the aegis of Okigwe Zonal Development Association, Abuja (OZDA) on 26/04 staged a demonstration at the National Assembly, over the delay in conducting Imo North Senatorial rerun polls. Other protests, including the anti-Saraki and bringbackourgirls campaigns, took place at the Assembly the same day.

Two groups of protesters clashed at the assembly complex in Abuja. The first group, identified as OccupyNASS, had taken over the main entrance of the national assembly before another group, identified as Save Our National Assembly, brought a counter-protest to the venue. One reported injury. The protest began as an anti-Saraki protest.
Ex-militants in Akwa Ibom State, who were granted amnesty since 2012, barricaded the entrance to Government House, Uyo, protesting their alleged neglect.
A vigilante group attacks church members and their Bishop over alleged infidelity by the pastor on 26/04.
The owners of buildings demolished by Osun State government for road construction in some parts of Osogbo, capital of Osun State on 26/04 protested over non-payment of their compensation.

No fewer than 20 persons were seriously injured and 13 houses torched when a rival youth group attacked another one in Obosi in Idemili North Local Government Area of Anambra State. It was gathered that members of Obosi Youths Movement, OYM, were allegedly protesting the introduction of another youth movement named Obiano Youth Vanguard, with OYM members saying they did not want another youth association in the area.
A ""recent"" clash (source dated 27/04) between members of the APC and PDP over the visit of the National Chairman of PDP to Dutse results in the injury of five and the death of one.
The bring back our girls campaign protests at the National Assembly for three days.
Market traders in Nkpor protest a tax on 27/04.

A former Minister of state for Education, Senator Iyabo Anisulowo was on 27/04 kidnapped by armed men alongside her security aide along Igbogila road in Yewa North (or Egbado North) local government area of Ogun state on 27/04.
Delta State pensioners took to the streets in Asaba to protest non-payment by the government of their pension and gratuity under the State Contributory Pension Scheme.
Soldiers protest unpaid salaries in Yola.
The bring back our girls campaign protests at the National Assembly for three days.
Two Cross River communities clash over three days in Yakurr LGA. Causalities not known. On the final day militia from Mkpani clashed with soldiers they mistook for mercenaries.
Military forces destroy Boko Haram cells in the Sambisa Forest areas of Yerwa and Kaluketu, killing four and recovering weapons.
A violent tyre burning protest in Sanya area, Lagos after an official form a government agency was believed to have killed a tanker driver along an expressway.

Nineteen persons have been killed at Ula-Upata and Edoha in Ahoada east local government area of Rivers State by gunmen suspected to be members of an unnamed ""cult group"" on 30/04. The attacks came in two waves. The first during the early afternoon, and the second later in the evening. The attack may have been related to an election in the area.
Suspected Agatu gunmen attack Fulani settlements of Loko and Adayi of Nassarawa LGA on 30/04, killing 20 herdsmen and 83 cows.
Two Cross River communities clash over three days in Yakurr LGA. Causalities not known. On the final day militia from Mkpani clashed with soldiers they mistook for mercenaries.

Two persons were reportedly feared killed and five others critically injured during a bloody clash between supporters of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) and the All Progressives Congress (APC) in Bassambiri, Nembe Local Council of Bayelsa State. The clash occurred ""at the weekend"" and was sparked when members of PDP supporters led by the newly appointed Caretaker Chairman, Mr. Walter Kuroekigha chanted the parties slogans, which allegedly provoked APC members at a ceremony.
Suspected Agatu gunmen attack Fulani settlements of Loko and Adayi of Nassarawa LGA on 30/04, killing 20 herdsmen and 83 cows.
Two Cross River communities clash over three days in Yakurr LGA. Causalities not known. On the final day militia from Mkpani clashed with soldiers they mistook for mercenaries.
Gunmen, suspected to be Fulani herdsmen assassinated the District Head of Fadan Karshi, along with his nephew.
Military forces launch a pre-emptive attack against Boko Haram in Wumbi, nine dead. Several soldiers sustained injury in the assault.

Soldiers attempt to open a road block placed by Mkpani militia in their effort against Nko militia. When the militia mistook the soldiers for mercenaries they opened fire, sparking a clash. Three killed, two injured.
Prisoners in Afikpo stage a jailbreak, then protest through the streets against the poor quality of food they are served. Police and militart responed to the protest.
A traditional ruler is murdered in Ejule in a suspected leadership tussle.

Six floating corpses have been reportedly recovered along the Brass River in the Bayelsa East senatorial district. The decomposing corpses are believed to be that of victims of a violent attack on a boat conveying some oil workers on a visit to an oil facility in the Nembe creek.

105 Students at Bida, Niger State escaped being abducted by gunmen in police uniform. Three of the students were raped by the bandits while many of them, including their teachers sustained varying degree of injuries
At the Lion Building in Ukpabi Nimbo in Uzouwani Council, Enugu State, women were led in protest by women organizations at the gates of the Government House.

column7: CDHR: Committee for the Defence of Human Rights
column17: Members of the Committee for the Defence of Human Rights (CDHR), staged an anti-corruption rally in Minna, Niger state.
A new militant group the Niger Delta Avenger (NDA) in the Niger Delta region have blew up of the Chevron Valve Platform off the coast of Warri in Delta State.

Health workers across Ondo town in Ondo West Local Government Area of Ondo State paralysed social and economic activities in the town, protesting against the non payment of their five months salary by the state government
A bomb detonated, suspected to be a petrol bomb, leaving seven people injured in Ogbaru, a town close to Onitsha in Anambra State
Workers of the Federal Ministry of Health staged a peaceful protest to demand better incentives and the resignation of the Permanent Secretary, Mrs. Aminat Shamaki.

Hundreds of residents of Felele area in Ibadan South East Local Government Council shut down all roads leading to the area in protest of maltreatment by Ibadan Electrical Development Company (IBEDC), over inconsistency billing, irregular supply of electricity and bad public relations, among others.
An angry mob yesterday lynched an armed robbery suspect at Iponri area of Lagos.

column7: JOHESU: Joint Health Sector Union; Health Workers (Nigeria)
column17: The industrial dispute by the Joint Health Sector Union (JOHESU) at the Jos University Teaching Hospital (JUTH) has taken yet another dimension as the striking workers have taken to the streets to protest the hospitals decision to stop their salaries.
The Nigerian Army has killed 20 bandits and recovered 12 rifles after a fierce encounter with the armed bandits, the commanding officer in Gusau, Lieutenant Colonel Abdullahi Adamu Aliyu has said.
At least three people have been killed in Aba, Abia State, in ethnic clashes between Igbo traders and their Hausa counterparts.

In response to the killing of two butchers, massive protest action took place in Aba, Abia as protesters marched towards the Mosque and the Hausa settlement on Hospital Road, but were quickly dispersed by soldiers who kept watch over the places.
Nigerian soldiers allegedly killed two butchers at the abattoir in the Ogbor Hill area of Aba.

In the second attack in as many days, Niger Delta Avengers members attacked and blew up Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation (NNPC) crude trunkline feeding crude oil to both Warri and Kaduna refineries. An oil flow station and gas line were also reportedly attacked in the Warri area in Delta state.
Pensioners, aligned to the Nigerian Union of Pensioners, in Bauchi State staged a demonstration over the delay in the payment of their pension benefits for almost four months.
Pensioners protest a delay in benefits in Bauchi on 06/05.
Five are dead after members of Igbide community attack Okpolo-Enhwe community on 07/05 in a boundary dispute.

Troops from 21 Brigade, 7 Division, on 08/05, successfully cleared four villages of Boko Haram - Bala Karege, Goske, Harda, and Markas 3 - which were previously under the control of Boko Haram in Sambisa Forest. The military forces were met with no resistance, with the exception of Harda village, where the forces ran into a small ambush. Eight Boko Haram dead. Some sources claim 18 dead.

Military forces announced on 08/05 they have clear the Borno villages of Galtha Baba, Galtha Musa, Bulakurma, Shatimari, Chukruk, Bulangaje, and Disa of Boko Haram. No violence reported. One Boko Haram member captured alive, and fifteen hostages were rescued. The operation may have been before 08/05.

Military forces announced on 08/05 they have clear the Borno villages of Galtha Baba, Galtha Musa, Bulakurma, Shatimari, Chukruk, Bulangaje, and Disa of Boko Haram. No violence reported. One Boko Haram member captured alive, and fifteen hostages were rescued. The operation may have been before 08/05.
At least six persons were killed and many others wounded when Fulani gunmen attacked Korum, Orawua and Gidan Bature villages in Gassol Local Government Area of Taraba State on 08/05.
A vigilante mob set a suspected thief ablaze in Warri.
Unidentified gunmen attack a APC local government aspirant on 08/05 while he travelled in Sobe. No causalities.

Following the dismissal of an ill student from an Ife-Ife height school, colleagues storm a radio station in protest, assaulting employees and others. The date of the protest is not clear. Source dated 09/05.
Unidentified gunmen attack and kill three civilians in Bori on the night of 09/05.

Dissatisfied members of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) from Imo West(Orlu) ""took over"" the state secretariat along Okigwe Road, Owerri, Imo State capital and called for the cancellation of the state congress of the party scheduled to hold today. They alleged that the ward and local government congresses were held in only four out of the 12 council areas of the zone.

Five members of the Rivers State police force are attacked and killed by unidentified assailants in Okobe. The policemen were ambushed in the early hours of 09/05 while heading to their base at the end of their special mission in the restive north-eastern state of Yobe.

column7: IPMAN: Independent Petroleum Marketers Association of Nigeria
column17: Petroleum marketers clash with security forces over the inability to dispense fuel in Udu LGA. No reported causalities.

Women protest in Nkwagu over the detention of the President General of the community. The women ""stormed"" a government house, but were stopped by police before they could enter. No reported violence.
Protesters under and aegis of the Kogi Youth Forum demonstrate at the Kogi State Assembly over the impeachment of the house speaker.
Unidentified assailants attack and kill two guards at the Rivers State high court on 10/05.
Gunmen suspected to be ""militants"" on 10/05 killed three soldiers at Foropa, Southern Ijaw local government area of Bayelsa State.
Over 5,000 members of the Indigenous People of Biafra, IPOB, embarked on a protest march in Aba, calling for the formation and recognition of a Biafran state.

Military forces, along with those from Cameroon, carry out a two day operation against Boko Haram at Madawaya Forest (7km from Cameroon's northern border, killing 58 and capturing a prominent leader. A number of hostages were also rescued in the operation.

Military forces foil a Boko Haram suicide bomber in a mosque in Sulaimanti area of the city of Maiduguri. The bomber attempted to enter the building, but was stopped by security forces. Panicked, the bomber detonated, killing only himself and injuring five others.

Military forces, along with those from Cameroon, carry out a two day operation against Boko Haram at Madawaya Forest (7km from Cameroon's northern border, killing 58 and capturing a prominent leader. A number of hostages were also rescued in the operation.
A suicide bomber attempts to enter a Maiduguri mosque, detonates, and kills six on 11/05.
Aggrieved members of the PDP protest at their state party congress in Illorin over a leadership tussle.

Youths on 11/05 set ablaze the personal residence of Senator Kabiru Gaya and vandalized the poultry farm of House of Representatives member from the area, Abdullahi Mahmoud during a protest against """"unfulfilled promises."""" Police arrested 18.
Touts and transporters clash over rights to a motor park on 11/05. Police move in, avert bloodshed. Two arrests reported.

column7: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
column17: The National Association of Nigerian Students (NANS) on 12/05 protested over the refusal of Minister of Education to reinstate the 13 vice chancellors sacked by government without recourse to rules and principles governing university system.
A Boko Haram suicide bomber has rocked the busy Musa Usman Secretariat Main Gate in Maiduguri on 12/08, killing seven injuring 18. Among the dead include two police officers.
Arrests: Military forces arrest a Boko Haram leader, Suleiman Umaru during an operation in Sambisa Forest on 13/05. No violence reported.
Fulani herders attack Tarfi village, Binnev Ward, in Buruku on the evening of 13/05, killing 12.
Hundreds of physically-challenged, orphans and other children catered for by Project Charilove ""at the weekend"" protested over non-payment of alleged five months arrears. Source dated 16/05.

Military forces carry out a clearance operation at the Gwoza villages of Guduf Buba, Yagwa, Gamude, Kwatara Kasa and Kwatara Tsakiya. No reported violence. Date of the operation(s) on or soon before 14/05.
Military forces repel a Boko Haram attack in Sambisa forest, kill two and recover weapons. Five soldiers were wounded due to mortar fire.

Military forces carry out a clearance operation at the Gwoza villages of Guduf Buba, Yagwa, Gamude, Kwatara Kasa and Kwatara Tsakiya. No reported violence. Date of the operation(s) on or soon before 14/05.

column7: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: Two members of the Movement for the Actualization of the Sovereign state of Biafra, MASSOB, were reportedly killed by two policemen attached to Okpoko Police Division, Onitsha suburb, Anambra State, while others sustained injuries while a shop was razed. Trouble was said to have started for the MASSOB members when a woman reported a case of assault against one of them, but he allegedly put up a fight when the police tried to arrest him.
Doctors at a teaching hospital protest unpaid salaries.
A coalition of civil society groups protest in Benin Citys Kingss Square on 16/05 over fuel prices.
Workers protest at their companies headquarters on Victoria Island over salary.
Military forces perform a clearance operation against Boko Haram at Alafa in Sambisa Forest, kill 15.
Military forces clear a Boko Haram camp at Njakia, no reported violence.
Unidentified gunmen, dressed as police, shot and killed a senior officer at close range for unknown reason. A female bystander was also killed in the attack.
About 5, 000 youths in Bauchi under the aegis of Bauchi State APC Youths, staged a peaceful rally to support the removal of an oil subsidy.

Two policemen were injured when suspected gunmen launched an attack on the Osara Police Station in Adavi local government area of Kogi State. Following the attack the assailants carted away ammunitions. No reported causalities.
Unidentified gunmen, on 18/05, invaded Rumukwachi community in Obio/Akpor Local Government Area of Rivers State and abducted two residents.

At the Murtala Muhammed Airport, Lagos, members of the Wabba faction of the NLC and civil society organisations blocked the road leading to the local wing of the airport in Lagos at the Ikeja end resulting in traffic jam and leaving air travellers, commuters and motorists stranded. The protest was related to the price of fuel. The National Union of Air Transport Employees (NUATE) also took part in the protest.
Protesting members of the NLC chase non-striking group workers from their offices on 18/05 during a demonstration against fuel prices.
Member of the Sokoto State chapter of the NLC protest at the government house over fuel prices.
No fewer than 40 vehicles have been burnt and 15 injured in a clash between Yoruba and Igbo traders in the Mushin area of Lagos. The violence is believed to have been sparked by use of market area.
Members of the NLC force government employees out of their offices on 19/05 to make them join a strike against fuel cost.
Members of the NLC protest in Lagos over fuel prices on 19/05.
Police attack an otherwise peaceful fuel price protest along the Abakaliki-Enugu Expressway on 19/05. At least one labour leader was reported injured.
Abuja NLC workers, among others, protest at Berger Junction, Abuja in conjunction with a fuel price strike.

A group of villagers, said to be from Umuago, Urualla, Ideato North local council area of Imo State, have attacked and destroyed part of the proposed Imo European University, IEU, after believing they had not been compensated for the land use fairly.
Members of the NLC protest in Yaba over the cost of fuel.
Military forces conduct a clearance operation at Shettimari, Hong and Biladdili villages in Damboa LGA, killing 35 Boko Haram and rescuing 97, including those who were abducted in Chibok in 2014.
Military forces conduct a clearance operation at Shettimari, Hong and Biladdili villages in Damboa LGA, killing 35 Boko Haram and rescuing 97, including those who were abducted in Chibok in 2014.

Gunmen reportedly abduct two Nigerian high court judges on 19/05, one in at Ojuocha in Ofu Local Government Area during a farm inspection, while the second was reportedly abducted while on his way to the court in Ayingba, Dekina Local Government Area of the state.
Youths from Ibeno local government area protest at an office of a western oil company following a spill in their area.

Gunmen reportedly abduct two Nigerian high court judges on 19/05, one in at Ojuocha in Ofu Local Government Area during a farm inspection, while the second was reportedly abducted while on his way to the court in Ayingba, Dekina Local Government Area of the state.
Military forces conduct a clearance operation at Shettimari, Hong and Biladdili villages in Damboa LGA, killing 35 Boko Haram and rescuing 97, including those who were abducted in Chibok in 2014.
Suspected Fulani gunmen on the night of 20/05 attacked Oke Ako in Ikole Local Government Area of Ekiti State and killed one man.
An aid of the governor is shot and killed at his Makurdi home on 20/05. The assailants entered his home while it was unoccupied and waited for his return.
A woman was abducted by Boko Haram in Maiduguri on 20/05, then later escaped.

column7: RATAWU: Radio and Television Workers Union; Journalists (Nigeria)
column17: Workers of RATAWU attempt to forcibly shut down a broadcast station of Radio Bayelsa over non-payment of salaries, but are dispersed by police and well as the Information Commissioner who was present.
Youths in Kwal community of Kanke local government area of Plateau State protested an attempt to remove a transformer from the LGA Secretariat in Kwal and move it elsewhere.

On 23 May 2016, a Boko Haram chief bomb maker was killed by another member of the sect when he attempted to leave the group in Sambaisa Forest area (Gwoza, Borno). Formally, the bomb maker was one of the chief bodyguards of Abubakar Shekau. Disputed, the source ""Vanguard"" reports the bomb maker was killed by a member of the military when he attempted to flee.
500 pensioners who retired from the service of the Edo State Government on 23/05 took to the streets in protest of 42 months pension arrears.

At least five communities of Ladin Buta (not named) near Khaddamari village of Jere Local Government Area of Borno state have been taken over and destroyed by suspected members of Boko Haram on 24/05. The attackers burned houses, killed 13 residents and injured several others.

Three persons have reportedly lost their lives in the past two days (24/05 and 25/05) following a fight between youths of Shibiri and Etegbin communities in Ojo area of Lagos over collection of levies from tipper drivers transporting dredged sands from waterside.
Boko Haram attacked Gurlum Kwalle and Jajeri areas of Adamari on 25/05, killing 11 and destroying houses.
Military forces engage a group of unidentified kidnappers in Afam, recover three victims who were abducted earlier in the day. Two of the gunmen dead, four injured.

Three persons have reportedly lost their lives in the past two days (24/05 and 25/05) following a fight between youths of Shibiri and Etegbin communities in Ojo area of Lagos over collection of levies from tipper drivers transporting dredged sands from waterside.
Unidentified attackers abducted two men and a woman from Isiokpo on 25/05 for unknown reason. The victims were later recovered after military forces engaged the attacked in a gun battle.

Members of a group known as NDA destroy a Chevron oil pipeline in Escravos. The group, who claimed responsibility for the blast, said they are fighting for a greater share of oil profits, an end to pollution and independence for the southern region, had told oil firms to leave the Delta before the end of the month.
Traders at Alaba International Market, near Lagos State University, protest over land encroachment by a bank.
Imo State pensioners protest against non-payment of entitlements in Ezinihitte LGA.
Hundreds of traders protest a takeover of their market by the local government and a tax in Oleh.
Military forces ambushed and killed two members of Boko Haram and recovered weapons along Maiduguri-Bulabulin-Damboa road.
Electricity customers protest high prices in Abuja.

Property destruction: Members of NDA destroy an oil pipeline connecting the Bonny terminal and the Brass export terminal with dynamite on 28/05 as a way to protest for a share of the regions oil wealth. The militants are also angry that the government is winding down a 2009 amnesty program that had paid 30,000 militants to guard installations they once attacked.
Military forces intercept and kill ""militants"" who were attempting to bomb an oil pipeline near Brass. Exact causalities not known.

A vigilante mob attacks and kills four in Pandongari over blasphemy allegations against the Prophet Muhammad on 29/05. There was further unrest and destruction of property in the area the following day.

column9: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: 29-30 May 2015. The Nigerian military reportedly killed 140 civilians during their operations against Biafra activists in Anambra and Delta. This was reported by an organization who identified seven mass graves, thought to contain some of those killed during the operation. The 140 fatalities were disaggregated between the two locations and May 29 and May 30th (35 fatalities per location per day).

column9: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: 29-30 May 2015. The Nigerian military reportedly killed 140 civilians during their operations against Biafra activists in Anambra and Delta. This was reported by an organization who identified seven mass graves, thought to contain some of those killed during the operation. The 140 fatalities were disaggregated between the two locations and May 29 and May 30th (35 fatalities per location per day).
Unidentified gunmen attack Zagabutu on 29/05, killing a prominent leader and two others.

A commercial tricycle drives over an IED outside of Biu. The blast killed four civilians and a solider. Preliminary investigations show that the IED was buried a long time ago undetected. It exploded when the tricycle erroneously ran over it.
A PDP leader clashes with members of the National Youth Council at a ""Democracy Day"" celebration. Injuries unknown.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill three in Agasha.

column9: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: 29-30 May 2015. The Nigerian military reportedly killed 140 civilians during their operations against Biafra activists in Anambra and Delta. This was reported by an organization who identified seven mass graves, thought to contain some of those killed during the operation. The 140 fatalities were disaggregated between the two locations and May 29 and May 30th (35 fatalities per location per day).

column9: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: 29-30 May 2015. The Nigerian military reportedly killed 140 civilians during their operations against Biafra activists in Anambra and Delta. This was reported by an organization who identified seven mass graves, thought to contain some of those killed during the operation. The 140 fatalities were disaggregated between the two locations and May 29 and May 30th (35 fatalities per location per day). Seven fatalities had previously been reported during clashes between protesters and security personnel on 30 May so the previously recorded fatalities were deducted from the disaggregated fatalities figure for Asaba on May 30.

column7: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: Members of police clash with protesting members of MASSOB in Onitsha, one police officer injured, one missing. In a conflicting reported, MASSOB claims they were attacked by the police while peaceful, killing fifteen of their members. This Day reports 30 dead.

column7: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: MASSOB embarks on a peaceful protest in Calabar.

column7: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: MASSOB protesters block roads in Port Harcourt on 30/05, police arrest 13.

column7: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: Police encounter and stop a pro-Biafran MASSOB protest in Aba. No arrests reported.

column7: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: A clergyman and 320 others were arrested as they were beginning a pro-Biafra protest in Abakaliki.

column7: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: Police arrest 13 members of MASSOB in Enugu following an ""unlawful protest"" in aim to establish a Biafran State and celebrated the 49th anniversary of its declaration.

column7: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: A man was shot and 19 were arrested by police during a peaceful protest for the MASSOB 49th anniversary in Umuahia. The extent of the gunshot victims injuries are not known.
Fulanis attack the Tiv communities of Tseaondo and Tseantyo on 30/05 of Ukum LGA, killing 10.
Fulanis attack the Tiv communities of Tseaondo and Tseantyo on 30/05 of Ukum LGA, killing 10.

column7: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: MASSOB holds a short protest in Ikom on 30/05 in honour of the 49th anniversary of the movement. The protest was shortened due to a counter protest by a group of youths.

A vigilante mob attacks and kills four in Pandongari over blasphemy allegations against the Prophet Muhammad. There was further unrest and destruction of property in the area on 30/05, the following day.

column7: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: 30 May. A fight broke out between policemen and some people suspected to be members of the Movement for the Sovereign State of Biafra (MASSOB) in Asaba. The incident occurred along Anwai Road in the city when MASSOB members were marching to demand for the independence of Biafra. According to police, the MASSOB marchers initiated the clash. Xinhua reports seven MASSOB killed in the fighting. Later reports indicated a total of 140 persons killed in Asaba and Awka between May 29-30.

column7: MASSOB: Movement for the Actualization of a Sovereign State of Biafra
column17: Seventeen protesting members of MASSOB are arrested following the use of tear-gas from police in Owerri. No reported violence from the protesters.
Workers of the Federal Ministry of Health forcibly shut down the ministry on 31/05, blocking the entrance, accusing the secretary of ""high-handedness"" and corruption.

Three persons, including a two-year-old girl, were killed when unknown gunmen suspected to be Tarok and Jukun ethnic militias attacked Isini Village in Sarkin Kudu District of Ibbi local government area of Taraba State on 31/05.

NDA on 01/06 evening attacked a military houseboat and allegedly killed two soldiers at Efe-Ugbokodo area in Warri South Local Government Area of Delta State. Agence France presses reported six dead, including civilians.

NLC protesters disrupt a meeting where leaders were discussing the privatization of area schools. Many of the protesters overturned chairs, and assaulted the Secretary to the State Government, Alhaji Ismail Olalekan-Alli and beat him with sticks, resulting in injury.

The troops of 202 Battalion ambushed Boko Haram elements at Sabsawa-Boarding road and BOCOBS-Ngurusoye road in Borno state killing 3 militants and arrested one of them over or between 1st-2nd June 2016.

The troops of 202 Battalion ambushed Boko Haram elements at Sabsawa-Boarding road and BOCOBS-Ngurusoye road in Borno state killing 3 militants and arrested one of them over or between 1st-2nd June 2016.
Military forces kill five Boko Haram, make one arrest and rescue 248 hostages during clearance operations in Jere and Konduga LGAs, dates not known - announcement from military made on 01/06.
The staff of the National Economic Reconstruction Fund (NERFUND) protested over management labour practices in Abuja.
Nkpor market traders protest higher tax rates at the government secretariat in Ogidi.
The Niger Delta Avengers blew up two oil wells located in Warri South West LGA of Delta State belonging to Chevron Nigeria Limited. The group claimed responsibility through their Twitter account.
Military forces kill five Boko Haram, make one arrest and rescue 248 hostages during clearance operations in Jere and Konduga LGAs, dates not known - announcement from military made on 01/06.
Agreement: 77 members of Boko Haram surrendered to troops of the 122 task force battalion on Operation Lafiya Dole in Borno State. Location of event not reported.

A woman trader, who was alleged to have blasphemed Prophet Mohammed, has been mobbed to death by youths in Kano on 02/06. The victim was accused of blasphemy during a religious argument at Wambai market.

The troops of 202 Battalion ambushed Boko Haram elements at Sabsawa-Boarding road and BOCOBS-Ngurusoye road in Borno state killing 3 militants and arrested one of them over or between 1st-2nd June 2016.

The troops of 202 Battalion ambushed Boko Haram elements at Sabsawa-Boarding road and BOCOBS-Ngurusoye road in Borno state killing 3 militants and arrested one of them over or between 1st-2nd June 2016.
Members of the NDA blow up two oil pipelines in Bayela State on 02/06, location not known.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: Military forces, along with the Civilian JTF, launch a Friday attack on the Boko Haram camp of Chukungudu in Borno State. Nineteen Boko Haram dead, including a commander, as well as two soldiers injured.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: Troops of 112 Battalion on patrol from Mafa to Dikwa were ambushed at Ajiri village by Boko Haram. One soldier died in the process, an officer and 3 soldiers sustained various degrees of injury. One of the civilian JTF accompanying the patrol team was also injured.
Two dead and eleven injured in tit-for-tat attacks between militia of Ogbe-Ijoh and Aladja communities.
Two dead and eleven injured in tit-for-tat attacks between militia of Ogbe-Ijoh and Aladja communities.
A prominent businessman survives an attempt on his life in Abuja.
Kidnappers abduct the commissioner for women affairs in Benue State at Makurdi town.
Gunmen on the evening of 06/06 killed the youth leader of the All Progressives Congress (APC) on 06/06 at the Ikpoba-hill area of Benin City, circumstances not known.

column7: NLC: Nigeria Labour Congress; NUT: Nigeria Union of Teachers; Students (Nigeria); Teachers (Nigeria)
column17: Members of the Nigeria Labour Congress (NLC) and the Nigeria Union of Teachers (NUT) protest a plan of the state government to involve individuals, old students association and missionaries in the running of public secondary schools. The protesters caused property damage and caused the closure of schools.

Suspected Boko Haram attacked and wounded three security operatives in Kanamma, the headquarters of Yunusari Local Government Area of Yobe State. A resident who fled to neighbouring Niger Republic told the source that on 07/06 that the attackers stormed the town on four motorcycles, each carrying three armed men.
Muslim youths attack and severely injure a Christian man for not observing the Ramadan fast in Kakuri.
Youths, both Christian and Muslim, protest at the National Assembly over a proposed constitutional amendment concerning Sharia Law, which they called ""Islamization.""

Unidentified gunmen, either members of a cult group or Fulanis, attacked University of Agriculture Makurdi killing seven students on 08/06. In response to the attack several students protested, though security operatives quickly dispersed the group without reported incident.
NDA destroys a oil pipeline in Warri North LGA with explosives on 07/06.

Hundreds of rights activists as well as miners from across Lagos State gathered in Agege to protest the stop work order given by the Lagos State Governor, Mr Akinwunmi Ambode, describing it as illegal.

Unidentified gunmen, either members of a cult group or Fulanis, attacked University of Agriculture Makurdi killing seven students on 08/06. In response to the attack several students protested, though security operatives quickly dispersed the group without reported incident.
The acting Registrar, Medical Laboratory Science Council of Nigeria (MLSCN) was killed by gunmen on the morning of 08/06 in Abuja. The source noted limited details.

Suspected pipeline vandals attack Ibafo on 09/06, killing four. It is believed the attackers were trying to abduct an area leader, but upon learning of his absence became frustrated and killed the four.
Striking workers block the entrance to the government house in Akure on 09/06 over non-payment of salaries.

Military forces clear several areas of Bama District, killing ""scores"" of Boko Haram, freeing eight captives. The villages were Kircha Goniye, Wujjah Alkelu, Kita Jiddum, Jameri, Geri Gana, Gere Kura and Jabe.

Military forces clear several areas of Bama District, killing ""scores"" of Boko Haram, freeing eight captives. The villages were Kircha Goniye, Wujjah Alkelu, Kita Jiddum, Jameri, Geri Gana, Gere Kura and Jabe.
Boko Haram attacks Mairari during the late hours of 10/06, killing four, taking them from their homes and slitting their throats.
NDA destroys a oil pipeline in Brass LGA with explosives on 10/06.
Students of Federal College of Education (Technical) (FCE) (T), Gombe is forced closed following a violent student protest over a water shortage.
Military forces kill 10 Boko Haram during a clearing operation in the Gamboru/Ngala areas of Chukungudu and Hausari on 11/06.
Unidentified gunmen kidnap a judge and kill his police orderly as they travelled near Lokoja on 12/06.
Military forces repel an attack by Boko Haram at Pulka, six Boko Haram fatalities.
Primary school teachers on 13/06 held a peaceful demonstrations in all local government areas in Nasarawa State to protest percentage payment of teachers salary in the state.
Primary school teachers on 13/06 held a peaceful demonstrations in all local government areas in Nasarawa State to protest percentage payment of teachers salary in the state.

Students of the University of Nigeria Enugu Campus (UNEC) protested on 13/06 against acute water scarcity and over three months of power failure around the campus.
