Youths in Jos took to the street near the government house to protest the donation of lands for the creation of grazing reserves in the state.
Primary school teachers on 13/06 held a peaceful demonstrations in all local government areas in Nasarawa State to protest percentage payment of teachers salary in the state.
Several workers who worked in the security department of Total E&P Nigeria Limited protested the non-payment of their severance packages by the company in Lagos.

Boko Haram attacks Kutuva village, Damboa LGA on 14/06, killing 4 and abducting 4 others. Soon after, a local vigilante group gave chase. Though the attackers were able to escape the militia recovered armament and vehicles.
Two Boko Haram are killed, three soldiers and 13 civilians wounded in an ambush near Gwoza.
Suspended Immigration personnel protest in Abuja over pensions issues.

Military forces carryout a clearance operation at Kircha, Bama during the evening hours. Four Boko Haram dead. Military forces also cleared the villages of Mulfuta, Baibawa, Jenere, Bembem, Maksamari, Bula Kafie and Bula Bodi without reported violence.

Military forces carryout a clearance operation at Kircha, Bama during the evening hours. Four Boko Haram dead. Military forces also cleared the villages of Mulfuta, Baibawa, Jenere, Bembem, Maksamari, Bula Kafie and Bula Bodi without reported violence.

Military forces carryout a clearance operation at Kircha, Bama during the evening hours. Four Boko Haram dead. Military forces also cleared the villages of Mulfuta, Baibawa, Jenere, Bembem, Maksamari, Bula Kafie and Bula Bodi without reported violence.

Military forces carryout a clearance operation at Kircha, Bama during the evening hours. Four Boko Haram dead. Military forces also cleared the villages of Mulfuta, Baibawa, Jenere, Bembem, Maksamari, Bula Kafie and Bula Bodi without reported violence, with the exception of Bembem, where the troops had a short encounter with Boko Haram.

Military forces carryout a clearance operation at Kircha, Bama during the evening hours. Four Boko Haram dead. Military forces also cleared the villages of Mulfuta, Baibawa, Jenere, Bembem, Maksamari, Bula Kafie and Bula Bodi without reported violence.

Military forces carryout a clearance operation at Kircha, Bama during the evening hours. Four Boko Haram dead. Military forces also cleared the villages of Mulfuta, Baibawa, Jenere, Bembem, Maksamari, Bula Kafie and Bula Bodi without reported violence.

Hundreds of Students of Tai Solarin College of Education, Omu-Ijebu of Ogun State, on 15/06 embarked on a protest on behalf of their lecturers who they said had been denied their salaries for 13 months.

Military forces carryout a clearance operation at Kircha, Bama during the evening hours. Four Boko Haram dead. Military forces also cleared the villages of Mulfuta, Baibawa, Jenere, Bembem, Maksamari, Bula Kafie and Bula Bodi without reported violence.

Military forces carryout a clearance operation at Kircha, Bama during the evening hours. Four Boko Haram dead. Military forces also cleared the villages of Mulfuta, Baibawa, Jenere, Bembem, Maksamari, Bula Kafie and Bula Bodi without reported violence.
Thousands of market women and youth groups on 15/06 took to the streets of Calabar to push for a highway project.
Pensioners protest non-payment of arrears by the state government.
Christian groups protest a court ruling that would allow the hijab to be worn in state schools.

Workers in the Oyo State Public Service in Ibadan held a rally to protest against their unpaid six months salaries and governments controversial proposal to handover the management of some schools to private bodies.

Around 15 June 2016 (month of), Ikwo communal militia clashed with Cross River communal militia in Ebonyi State. Event connected to the ongoing border disputes between Ikwo and Cross River communities. No reported fatalities.
Boko Haram have reportedly killed 24 persons in Kuda-Kaya village of Madagali local Government Area of Adamawa State during the evening hours.

Aggrieved youths in their hundreds blocked the Yakowa expressway in Kaduna and matched through other neighbouring communities to protest against the frequent outage and alleged extortion by officials of Kaduna Electricity Distribution Company (KEDCO).
Arrests: Military forces arrest the Boko Haram commander Ibrahim Jagwal at Gishiwa Dabua area of Potiskum, Yobe State.
NDA destroys an oil pipeline in Oruk Anam LGA, Akwa Ibom State on 16/06 and later claims credit via Twitter.
Staff of the Port Harcourt Electricity Distribution Company are attacked by community youths displeased with service.
Gunmen on 17/06 invaded Imagbon, Elepete, Kajola, Glorious land and Ereko communities in Shagamu area killing 10 residents, injuring others and destroying several properties.
A person was severely injured when supporters of the two chairmen of the party clashed at the national secretariat of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Abuja.
Suspected Fulani herdsmen on 17/06 invaded Ilewo-Orile community in Ogun State, killing three persons.
Unidentified gunmen attack Imushin during the late night hours, killing fifteen. The killings were described as ""indiscriminate.""
Military forces clear Bulagana and Gambori of Boko Haram on 18/06. Four reported Boko Haram dead.
Military forces clear Bulagana and Gambori of Boko Haram on 18/06. Four reported Boko Haram dead.
Two are killed during a Boko Haram raid on Wumbi village on 18/06.
Fulanis attack Dusa of Turan in Logo Local Government Area of Benue state, killing 20 residents while they slept.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: Military forces in conjunction with members of Civilian-JTF vigilante group carried out a operations along Bitta-Damboa and Dikwa-Marte axis, leaving seven Boko Haram dead and others captured. Five soldiers wounded.

Police and students clash in Owo when students protest at a police station after the students accused the police of hitting a fellow student with an automobile and simply leaving. Three students reported shot and injured.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: Military forces in conjunction with members of Civilian-JTF vigilante group carried out a operations along Bitta-Damboa and Dikwa-Marte axis, leaving seven Boko Haram dead and others captured. Five soldiers wounded.

Activities were grounded at the headquarters of the Federal Ministry of Finance, Abuja, for several hours as its staff demonstrated against their unpaid allowances put at about N1.2 billion. The protest lasted over two days.
Nigerian Air Force jets bomb an Boko Haram convoy in Doron Naira, fifteen dead.
Fulanis attack the villages of Uzaar in Tombo, Anyii in Logo local government on 20/06 and Vase in Ukum local government on 21/06, killing 26.
Fulanis attack the villages of Uzaar in Tombo, Anyii in Logo local government on 20/06 and Vase in Ukum local government on 21/06, killing 26.
In what was described as a [economic] reprisal, a group of gunmen invaded two communities - Elegbete and Igbolomu - in Ikorodu area of Lagos from waterfronts, allegedly killing at least 20 residents.
In what was described as a [economic] reprisal, a group of gunmen invaded two communities - Elegbete and Igbolomu - in Ikorodu area of Lagos from waterfronts, allegedly killing at least 20 residents.

Activities were grounded at the headquarters of the Federal Ministry of Finance, Abuja, for several hours as its staff demonstrated against their unpaid allowances put at about N1.2 billion. The protest lasted over two days.
Fulanis attack the villages of Uzaar in Tombo, Anyii in Logo local government on 20/06 and Vase in Ukum local government on 21/06, killing 26.
A group of 30 ""militants"" attack a convoy of foreign workers, killing one and kidnapping three.

Gunmen suspected to be ""members militants"" were said to have invaded Igbolomu and Ishawo areas in Ikorodu Local Government Area of Lagos State and began shooting sporadically. Causalities not known.

Members of the Ijaw Youth Council invade a radio station in an effort to interrupt a live broadcast over a disagreement over organizational leadership. The attackers stole items at the station and assaulted employees.

Gunmen suspected to be ""members militants"" were said to have invaded Igbolomu and Ishawo areas in Ikorodu Local Government Area of Lagos State and began shooting sporadically. Causalities not known.
Groups protest in Ado-Ekiti to demand the governor to resign over ""his failure to live up to expectation.""
Military forces ambush a Boko Haram position at Gamboru-Ngala on 24/06, killing ten.
""Pipeline vandals"" attack Igbo Olomu, Ogijo killing 60. The attackers targeted ""landlords and local vigilante men in the community, killing them with members of their families.""

Workers unions at the Federal University of Agriculture, Abeokuta have paralysed activities at the institution, following series of protest embarked upon by aggrieved workers over poor working condition which they alleged the management has subjected them to.
At least eight people are feared dead following a clash between Fulani herdsmen and farmers in Koh village.

column7: NAPPS: National Association of Proprietors of Private Schools
column17: National Association of Proprietors of Private Schools, Ogun chapter staged a protest over alleged multiple taxation.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: Troops of the 21 Brigade and the Civilian JTF on a patrol of Zangebe, Maiwa, Algaiti and Mainari villages killed six militants and wounded several others.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: Troops of the 21 Brigade and the Civilian JTF on a patrol of Zangebe, Maiwa, Algaiti and Mainari villages killed six militants and wounded several others.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: Troops of the 7 Division Garrison Rapid Deployment Force (RDF) II, in conjunction with some mobile policemen and the Civilian JTF also conducted clearance operations at Masu Yiwa, Ladin Buta, Bazaka, Kesa Gala, Tabla, Fahinde, Shirori, Gizina, Maska Aribe, Maska and Maska Lawanti villages, all in Mafa Local Government Area of Borno State. During the operations, the troops encountered Boko Haram members at Maska Lawanti where they killed two and recovered two motorcycles.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: Troops of the 7 Division Garrison Rapid Deployment Force (RDF) II, in conjunction with some mobile policemen and the Civilian JTF also conducted clearance operations at Masu Yiwa, Ladin Buta, Bazaka, Kesa Gala, Tabla, Fahinde, Shirori, Gizina, Maska Aribe, Maska and Maska Lawanti villages, all in Mafa Local Government Area of Borno State. During the operations, the troops encountered Boko Haram members at Maska Lawanti where they killed two of them and recovered two motorcycles.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: Troops of the 21 Brigade and the Civilian JTF on a patrol of Zangebe, Maiwa, Algaiti and Mainari villages killed six militants and wounded several others.
Unknown gunmen attack the convoy of the deputy governor in Obafemi-Owode LGA. Security force escort returned fire, casualties not known.

Troops of the 192 Battalion, 26 Task Force Brigade and some vigilantes on fighting patrol along Kusarha-Zalidava general area encountered some elements of Boko Haram around Zalidava-Weige villages. During the encounter, two Boko Haram militants were killed while troops recovered 1 General Purpose Machine Gun (GPMG) and a belt of 7.62mm (NATO) ammunition containing 42 rounds.
On 26 June 2016, unidentified gunmen clashed with a local armed group in Okpoga (Okpokwu, Benue) which killed three people and injured two others belonging to the local armed group.
Two Boko Haram suicide bombers detonate at a mosque, killing only themselves and injuring others.
Unidentified gunmen on 27/06 attacked Gurguzu village of Igabi Local Government Area of Kaduna State, leaving four dead and several others injured after the attack.
Anti-Buhari/pro-Ayodele Fayose protest by students in Ado-Ekiti.
A police officer errantly shot a motorcyclist. The killing sparked a demonstration, with the people of the area pouncing on the policeman that shot the man, beating him to a coma.
Air forces launch attacks at a Boko Haram location near Kangarwa, killing 15.

Lawmakers (PDP) of state House of Assembly held a plenary session in the middle of highway in protest against the freezing of the account of Governor Ayodele Fayose at the Zenith by the Economic and Financial Crime Commission (EFCC). It is not clear if traffic was halted during the demonstrations.
Military forces encounter Boko Haram at Gudumbali were they killed two and wounded one.
Military forces dislodge Boko Haram from Ngoshe and Guva, killing ""several"" and rescuing 16 of their hostages.

Protest against the removal of the governor on 29/06. A Federal High Court, sitting in Abuja, had removed the governor on Monday on the ground that he failed to satisfy the tax requirements as a candidate.
Military forces dislodge Boko Haram from Ngoshe and Guva, killing ""several"" and rescuing 16 of their hostages.

For several hours, a major artery of Lagos State, the entire stretch of Ikorodu Road at Maryland was completely blocked as street hawkers went berserk destroying vehicles and smashing BRT buses in protest of the death of a colleague.

Scores of residents of Ibeju-Lekki area of Lagos State staged a peaceful protest to the state House of Assembly over the alleged imposition and appointment of Baale (local chief) on the community by the Onibeju of Ibeju Lekki.
Unknown gunmen on 01/07 kidnapped Sierra-Leonean Ambassador to Nigeria, Maj-Gen. Nelson Williams (Rtd) along Abuja-Kaduna Express way while en route to Jaji, Kaduna.

A lawmaker representing Oorelope constituency in the Oyo State House of Assembly, Hon. Gideon Aremu, was shot dead by yet-to-be-identified gunmen at Alakia, in the Egbeda Local Government Area of Oyo State on Friday evening.
The NDA bombs five oil pipelines in Abiteye.
A robbery suspect is set ablaze is Emede by a vigilante mob.
Nigerian Army troops on Operation Gama Aiki ambushed and killed four Boko Haram militants in Kukawa, Borno State.

column7: BYMGG: Benue Youth Movement for Good Governance
column17: The Benue Youth Movement for Good Governance (BYMGG) in Abuja protested against the handling of a corruption case against the former governor of Benue State.

Nigerian Army foiled an attempt by three female suicide bombers to attack Internally Displaced Persons, IDPs, in Monguno. Two of the suicide bombers were shot while the third blew herself up when pursued by soldiers.

Thousands of road users plying the East-West road were stranded for hours as hundreds of ex-militants from Bayelsa and Delta States disrupted traffic for hours along the Mbiama-Yenagoa section of the road. The ex-militants were protesting unpaid salaries.
An expatriate of unknown origin is kidnapped in Epe.

The patrol team of 157 Task Force Battalion of the Nigerian Army on 04/07 ambushed and killed a Boko Haram spy at Barwati village in Kukawa local government area of Borno State. The subject was shot while attempting to enter a secure area.
The NDA bombs a pipeline in Batan community in Warri South West Local Government Area of Delta State.
Ex-militants block roads in Benin City over non-payment of arrears.

No fewer than seven persons have been feared killed following fresh outbreak of violent hostilities between Inyima community in Yakurr Local Government Area and Onyadama community in Obubra Local Government Area in Cross River State. The clash over several days.
A melee between two ""cult groups"" causes two dead and twenty injured in Ondo town.
Hundreds of youths in Rivers State staged a peaceful protest along Port Harcourt streets against attacks on oil facilities in the Niger Delta region.

No fewer than seven persons have been feared killed following fresh outbreak of violent hostilities between Inyima community in Yakurr Local Government Area and Onyadama community in Obubra Local Government Area in Cross River State. The clash over several days.

No fewer than seven persons have been feared killed following fresh outbreak of violent hostilities between Inyima community in Yakurr Local Government Area and Onyadama community in Obubra Local Government Area in Cross River State. The clash over several days.

No fewer than seven persons have been feared killed following fresh outbreak of violent hostilities between Inyima community in Yakurr Local Government Area and Onyadama community in Obubra Local Government Area in Cross River State. The clash over several days.
Suspected NDA abduct an immigration official in Ikorodu.
A middle-aged robbery suspect was on Wednesday set ablaze by angry mob at Isoko quarters (Warri city) in Warri South Local Government Area of Delta.
Military and police clash in a market in Abeokuta while pursuing ""fraudulent customers."" Two injuries.
APC holds an anti-Governor Ayodele Fayose protest on 7/7.

No fewer than seven persons have been feared killed following fresh outbreak of violent hostilities between Inyima community in Yakurr Local Government Area and Onyadama community in Obubra Local Government Area in Cross River State. The clash over several days.

No fewer than seven persons have been feared killed following fresh outbreak of violent hostilities between Inyima community in Yakurr Local Government Area and Onyadama community in Obubra Local Government Area in Cross River State. The clash over several days.
Three people were killed in a communal clash between two communities (Okpoga and Edumoga) in Okpokpwu local government area of Benue State.
Police stop an attack by ""militants"" on Igando shortly after they began opening fire. Two fled, two were captured.

A reprisal attack between Fulanis and farmers have left four people dead and many others injured in Barakuta village in Bosso local government of Niger state. Many houses, four cars and 17 motorcycles were burnt during the attack. Investigation revealed that the crises began last Thursday when Fulanis killed a Gwari man who prevented them from raping a girl during the sallah celebration. In a revenge attack, the Gwaris gathered together and killed some Fulanis which led to the reprisal attack on the villagers.

A reprisal attack between Fulanis and farmers have left four people dead and many others injured in Barakuta village in Bosso local government of Niger state. Many houses, four cars and 17 motorcycles were burnt during the attack. Investigation revealed that the crises began last Thursday when Fulanis killed a Gwari man who prevented them from raping a girl during the sallah celebration. In a revenge attack, the Gwaris gathered together and killed some Fulanis which led to the reprisal attack on the villagers.
Eight people including two Boko Haram suicide bombers have been killed in a bomb attack in a mosque in Bornos southern town of Damboa.

Boko Haram attacked Rann village over two days killing 2 soldiers and 7 civilians. In response, military forces killed 16 Boko Haram. [The source] said two soldiers were killed when a suicide bomber drove into a truck and exploded. The remaining attackers carted away food and supplies.

Governor Ayodele Fayose supporters block streets in protest of against the freezing of his accounts with Zenith Bank by the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission. The rally was apparently in reaction to the All Progressives Congress (APC) led anti-Fayose protest held on Thursday.
On 8 July 2016, Boko Haram clashed with a local armed group in Gaskeri village near Dalori (Konduga, Borno) killing three from the armed group. They also looted foodstuffs and livestock.
""Herders"" attack farmers in Logo LGA over two days killing five, two the first day, three the second.

Boko Haram attacked Rann village over two days killing 2 soldiers and 7 civilians. In response, military forces killed 16 Boko Haram. [The source] said two soldiers were killed when a suicide bomber drove into a truck and exploded. The remaining attackers carted away food and supplies.
Students of the Alvan Ikoku Federal College of Education, Owerri, took to the streets to protest the planned demolition of a flyover by the Imo State government.
Fulanis attack farmers in Ukum LGA over the weekend killing five.
Fulanis attack farmers in Logo LGA over two days killing five, two the first day, three the second.
NDA bombs Exxons Qua Iboe oil Terminal causing it to close.

Fulanis kill 81 (accounting for those Ukum and Logo over this past weekend) over the ""past two weeks"" - source dated 11/07 - in at least 10 local government areas Benue state. The conflict arose over grazing rights.

Defusal: An attempt to bomb an oil well head in Gelegele community in Ovia North East local government area of Edo State was foiled by police on Monday. Two Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) planted near the oil well head were detonated by police in a controlled manner. No injury reported.
Three are killed by unidentified land grabbers in Agbowa on 11/07.

Clearing and forwarding agents on the platform of Association of Nigeria Licensed Customs Agents, ANLCA gathered at Nigeria Customs Service PTML Area Command Office at Mile 2, protesting a change in exchange rate making it impossible for them to serve their customers and still make profit.
Four people have been killed in a clash between the Fulanis and Gbagyis in the Lambata Buko town in Paikoro local government area of Niger State.
A land dispute between the towns of Kufai and Kulishi cause one death over two days.
Government pensioners protest over salaries in Uyo.

The various industrial unions in Ekiti State University, Ado Ekiti (EKSU) paralysed activities in the school to protest over salary. The aggrieved staff prevented vehicular and human movement in and out of the institution as they locked its two gates.
Different groups in Nasarawa State protested against the indefinite strike action by the workers across the state and urged the workers unions to recall members to work.

column7: NANNM: National Association of Nigeria Nurses and Midwives; Students (Nigeria); Health Workers (Nigeria)
column17: The National Association of Nigeria Nurses and Midwives (NANNM) University of Benin Teaching Hospital chapter protested the kidnap of their colleague.

The Nigerian Army said troops of the 119 Task Force Battalion stationed in Kangarwa, Borno State, repelled an attack by Boko Haram, killing 25. One soldier died in the battle (some sources claim 3) and 11 were wounded. The battle lasted three hours.

Suspected ""militants"" have blown up Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation, NNPC, pipelines at Ogijo in Sagamu Local Government Area of Ogun State, sending residents of the community scampering for safety after a loud explosion. The perpetrators were disguised as maintaince workers.
A land dispute between the towns of Kufai and Kulishi cause one death over two days.

Hundreds of aggrieved women from Gbaramatu Kingdom in Warri South West Local Government Area of Delta State protested the arrest and continued detention of 10 of their youths by the military for their alleged involvement in the bombings of oil facilities by the Niger Delta Avengers (NDA).
The students of the Kogi State University protest over a three-month closure of their school due to a strike. The protest lasted for two days.

Protests in Aba, Abia state, as tricycle riders blocked the Aba- Ikot Ekpene road protesting alleged extortion by the Police in the city. The protest which took off from Opobo junction saw some of the riders using their tricycles to block the Ovom street junction and waterside areas.
Protest against a decision to move a local market. The protest continued into the next day.
Fulani herdsmen attack Tambor Jumor in Girei LGA on 13/07, killing six.

Owerri women trooped out in their hundreds to protest the decision of the state government to relocate the Ekeukwu Owerri Market. The women, who were all clad in traditional mourning clothes had, as early as 8:00a.m assembled at Ekeukwu Owerri, along Douglas Road, from where they marched to Okigwe Road and sang solidarity songs. The protest began the previous day.
An official of the Federal Road Safety Corps (FRSC) was attacked by a mob in Mararaba after they mistakenly believe he harmed a motorist.

column7: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
column17: Students led by National Association of Nigeria Students, NANS, shut Lokoja, Kogi State capital, protesting the industrial action by lecturers of the State University since May. The protesters blocked vehicular traffic. The protest began the previous day.
Military forces ambush a group of Boko Haram near Gonuri. Surprised by the attack, the Boko Haram fighters abandoned their weapons and vehicles and fled. One reported injury.

A group of Muslim youths on Friday attacked St. Philips Catholic Parish, Baki Iku, close to Zuma Rock in Niger State. According to eyewitnesses, some Catholics had gone to the church to pray when they were attacked by the Muslim group who claimed that Friday was their day of prayer and that the church only had right to worship on Sundays. The youths were said to have destroyed the churches property, including doors and the windows. Some soldiers managed to get there later, but not before harm had been done to the building.

Protesters stormed the palace of Oluwo of Iwo, Oba Abdulrsaheed Adewale-Akanbi with a coffin after it is believed an alleged ""unqualified"" person is set to fill a vacant position of Aro of Iwo land. Police dispersed the group.
Gunmen abduct a monarch, kill his guard and wound his wife in Ojo.
In a Boko Haram clearance operation, a patrol team of 157 Task Force Battalion, 7 Brigade, ambushed and killed a Boko Haram spy at Barwati village, Kukawa Local Government Area.
On 17 July 2016, a communal armed group attacked and killed 3 suspected kidnappers in an exchange of fire at lallami village in Bali local government area of Taraba state Sunday night.

Scores of women under the aegis of Concern Group on Monday stormed the office of the Lagos State Governor, Mr Akinwumi Ambode, to protest the verbal attack on the Senator representing Lagos Central at the upper legislative chamber.
Dock workers protest in the Marina, Lagos area.

Troops of 114 Task Force Battalion of 28 Task Force Brigade carried out an exercise at suspected Boko Haram militant hideouts at Mbale and Madube on Monday. During the operation, the troops killed 5 Boko Haram, while some of them were believed to escape with gunshot wounds.

Military forces on Monday killed 7 Boko Haram and rescued 22 hostages including women and children while clearing Warpaya, Zenteleye, Mubarka, Jadawa and Yerwa villages. During the operations, they encountered and engaged elements of Boko Haram militants in Jadawa and Yerwa.

Military forces on Monday killed 7 Boko Haram and rescued 22 hostages including women and children while clearing Warpaya, Zenteleye, Mubarka, Jadawa and Yerwa villages. During the operations, they encountered and engaged elements of Boko Haram militants in Jadawa and Yerwa.
NDA on Monday blasted an oil pipeline belonging to the Shell Petroleum Development Company (SPDC) in Batan community in Warri South West Local Government area of Delta State.
Suspected Fulani gunmen attack and kill a traditional ruler in Bokkos LGA.

Nigeria's military says it has rescued 80 children and women held captive by the Boko Haram extremist group in Gangere, Kukawa. An army spokesman says they were freed Tuesday by troops who attacked a gathering of the [Boko Haram] at Gangere village in Borno state. He says 42 Boko Haram were killed and troops released 42 children and 38 women.

Rivers State chapter of the All Progressives Congress (APC) led hundreds of protesters who temporarily took over the complexes of the state High Court complex and House of Assembly complex, Port Harcourt after two elected APC members were not sworn-in as scheduled.
The residents of Utako village, Abuja, have protested against a week-long power outage in the area.

Monarch of Oluasiri community, Ibedaowei of Oluasiri clan in Nembe Local Government area of Bayelsa State, was attacked by five armed men armed with machetes. The monarch was left to die but recovered in hospital.
Youth in Bokkos Local Government Area of Plateau State on 19/07 barricaded roads and took to the streets in violent response to the killing of a traditional ruler the previous day.

The Alvan Ikoku College of Education, Owerri, has been closed down indefinitely following a rampage by students that resulted to the destruction of properties worth millions of naira. The students carried out a violent protest within and outside the campuses against the hike in school fees and poor electricity supply to the campus.
Protest in Port Harcourt over forced eviction.
Students of the state owned Niger Delta University, NDU, protested against the prolonged strike by the varsity chapter of Academic Staff Union of Universities.

Protesters, numbering about 50, stormed the National Assembly, protesting the utterances of Senator Dino Melaye (APC, Kogi West ), against Senator Oluremi Tinubu. It was alleged that Melaye had threatened to [assault] Senator Tinubu.
Several soldiers are missing and other wounded following an ambush at Guro Gongon village on 20/07. Several of the missing soldiers were found in the following days.

NINE persons on 21/07 sustained various degrees of injury following an invasion by gunmen who invaded the legislative chambers of the Ughelli South local government council during a legislative session by the lawmakers.

Hundreds of workers at the Abuja Urban Mass Transport Company (AUMTCO), under the Amalgamated Union of Public Corporations, Civil Service Technical and Recreational Services Employees (AUPCTRE) locked the entrance to the company located along Kubwa road over pay.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column17: 19 soldiers and 3 civilian JTF members were wounded in action while a few others were missing in action during a Boko Haram ambush is Nguro Gongon.
A police officer shoots and kills a commercial motorcyclist, possibly over extortion. Following the killing, a mob of vigilantes attacked and killed the police officer with stones.
A police officer shoots and kills a commercial motorcyclist, possibly over extortion. Following the killing, a mob of vigilantes attacked and killed the police officer with stones.

Four protesters were on 21/07 shot dead and three others severely injured by security operatives in Bokkos Local Government Area of Plateau State, as the operatives battled angry protesters to rescue Ardo (Fulani leader) of the area from being lynched. The violence is a response to the killing a tradition ruler by suspected Fulanis earlier in the week.

Property destruction: Suspected arsonists in the early hours of razed down the office of the Independent National Electoral commission, INEC, in Bori, headquarters of Khana local government area. This development is ahead of the July 30 rescheduled rerun elections in eight local government areas in the state.

The Nigerian Army says troops on Operation Lafiya Dole ambushed Boko Haram militants around Musafanari (Sambisa Forest) in Borno State. The ambush party killed two Boko Haram while two soldiers sustained gunshot wounds.
Property destruction: Oil militants (NDA) say they have blown up a gas pipeline in Nigerias southeastern Akwa Ibom state, but police blamed the explosion on a technical failure.
Between 10 and 14 persons were feared killed in Gaambe-Tiev in Logo Local Council of Benue State by suspected Fulani herdsmen. Several others were reported missing and many others left with injury.

Learning and other educational activities were on disrupted at the St Francis Caring Heart Mega School, Owaluwa in Owo local government area of Ondo State following a peaceful protest staged by non-teaching staff of the school over non-payment of their 13 months salaries.
A suspected Boko Haram member escaped death in the Mile Two (Oke Afa) area of Lagos State as he was almost lynched by a vigilante mob.
Pensioners in Edo State protested over the non-payment of their monthly pension spanning between 10 and 42 months in Benin.
Military forces gain control of Karetu on 25/07. No specific reports of violence.

Traders protested in the streets of Lessel in Ushongo local government area of Benue State to protest high and multiple taxation thrust on their businesses by government agencies. The protesters reportedly blocked roads.

Some officials of the Nigeria Customs Service, Federal Operations Unit shot and killed three residents in Ikeja. Shooting sporadically, the three were shot out of apparent anger after ""hoodlums"" resisted arrest.

Members of NDA attack Ewedogbon area of Totowu, a riverine community in Ishuti, Igando, old Alimosho Local Government Area. Multiple sources said many people were killed as the militants entered into peoples houses to ""torment"" them.

Heavy gunshots between unidentified displaced pipeline vandals and some security operatives (military/police) at the Igando Community. The displaced vandals had stormed the Obadore, Ewedogbon, Akesan Fatoki, and Egan communities of Igando, and left six persons injured over two days. The attackers were repelled the first day, but returned the second.
Indigenes of Oghara in Delta State protest against alleged forceful and illegal acquisition of their land by Nigerian Navy Logistic Command in their state.

Hundreds of placard-carrying people from Oraukwu community in Idemili South Local Government Area of Anambra State stormed the Government House, Awka, protesting the alleged imposition of one Emeka Onuorah as the traditional ruler of the town.
Various civil society groups on 27/07 protested alleged illegal recruitment and nepotism in some government agencies in Abuja.
Protest in Lagos over proposed water company privatization.

One student of Nasarawa State Polytechnic Lafia was shot dead and another injured in a clash between the students and the Nigeria Police in Police attempt to disperse the students who were protesting the death of a mate who was knocked down by a passing vehicle.

Heavy gunshots between unidentified displaced pipeline vandals and some security operatives (military/police) at the Igando Community. The displaced vandals had stormed the Obadore, Ewedogbon, Akesan Fatoki, and Egan communities of Igando, and left six persons injured over two days. The attackers were repelled the first day, but returned the second.
Police shoot and kill a trader for unknown reason in Kano.

""An attack on a humanitarian convoy injured one UN aid worker and another from an International Organization. Both were hospitalized as a result of the attack, which occurred on the road between Bama and Maiduguri. Travel to high-risk areas was temporarily suspended.""
Residents of Gbagyi Villa community in Kaduna protest the planned demolition of houses.
Residents of Ibeshe protest against the ongoing harassment of an individual known as ""Badoo.""
Boko Haram attacks a military-escorted humanitarian convoy wounding three civilians including a U.N. worker and two soldiers.
Military forces ""may"" have clashed with NDA vandals in ""Arepo and other coastal communities in Ogun State."" Causalities not known.
Small skirmish over control of a market following a court decision. Police intervened before the clash became ""bloody.""
Members of some Non-Governmental Organisations, NGOs and petty traders stormed the Lagos State House of Assembly, protesting against the state governments ban on street trading in the state.
Police open fire on a group of protesting NLC workers, killing two and injuring others.
Troops on blocking position in Pulka yesterday Friday 29th July 2016, ambushed and killed 2 fleeing Boko Haram fighters. It is equally believed one of the militants escaped with gun shot wounds.
Igbo youths in Kano staged a protest over the murder of a trader at the hands of police. The man was killed on 27/07.
3,000 are displaced and property destroyed following a communal conflict among farmers fighting or land in the Busi areas. The clash occurred ""over the weekend.""

King Iyerite Chiefson Awululu, the paramount ruler of Oluasiri community in Nembe Local Government Area in Bayelsa State, narrowly escaped death on Sunday July 31st after he was attacked by armed men who invaded his residence, cut him mercilessly with machete and left him for dead.
Fulanis attack Kodomun community, Demsa Local Government Area, killing between 20 and 30. The attacks lasted over two days.
Fulanis attack Kodomun community, Demsa Local Government Area, killing between 20 and 30. The attacks lasted over two days.
Eleven are killed during a series of Fulani attacks around Godogodo.
Military forces thwart a Boko Haram attack on the village of Yauri, outside of Maiduguri. Five Boko Haram reported dead.
Five persons were killed Tuesday in what is believed to be the latest outbreak of violence between Share and Tsaragi communities in Ifelodun local government area of Kwara state.

Some youths in Ogoni land in Khana local government area in Rivers state are currently staging a protest against plans by the state government to dredge the river in their community. According to the youths, the river is their only source of water. They allege that the state government has not done Environmental Impact Assessment.
A group of woman protest insecurity in Ninte village.
Pensioners protest non-payment of pensions at a government house in Makurdi.
Shiites protest for the release of Sheikh Ibrahim El-Zakzaky in Kaduna.

column7: NULGE: Nigerian Union of Local Government Employees
column17: The National Union of Local Government Employees (NULGE) grounded business activities in Benin, as they protested the non-payment of their salary.
Igbos continue their protest following the murder of a trader in Kano.

column7: WACOL: Women Aid Collective; Women (Nigeria); Aid Workers (Nigeria)
column17: Enugu Women, under the auspices of Women Aid Collective, protested the delay in signing into law the Gender Equality Bill before the state assembly.

Five are dead in a suspected case of mistaken identity as military forces clash with a local militia of Kpaidma, each believe they were herdsmen attackers. Update: Numbers were updated later the following week recording the death of 11 soldiers and seven civilians.
Unidentified gunmen kidnap two Chinese workers in Agada (Agwada). The two were later rescued.
Kidnappers abduct a lawmakers father while he travelled between Okpoama to Egweama in Bayelsa State.
Unidentified gunmen kidnap two Chinese workers in Agada (Agwada).
Suspected NDA militants attacked a group of soldiers, killing three in Nembe LGA. The attackers carted away armaments.
Five persons have been declared missing and a woman is shot and killed after Enwhe and Igbide communities of Isoko South Local Government Area of Delta state clashed over a disputed plot of land.

Scores of persons from a leprosy advocate group took over Emmanuel Uduaghan way (SUMMIT) in Asaba Delta State in protest of the backlog of their stipends and reduction in their daily meals by the state government.
Traders protest for two days over the closure of a market.

A mob attacked the palace of the Oluwo of Iwo and attempted to set it ablaze after a suspected kidnapper was taken to be housed in the building. Earlier, the mob had attempted to lynch the suspect before a group of civilians took him to the palace.
Villagers of Ugborodo staged a three days of protests outside a Chevron facility in Escravos to seek better jobs.
Traders protest for two days over the closure of a market.
Participants of a town hall meeting protest food shortage in their area.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram establishes a base in Bauchi Forest (Burra area, Bauchi).
Electrical workers protest over alleged anti-labour practices.

column6: NDGJM: Niger Delta Greenland Justice Mandate
column17: Members of NDGJM blow up a pipeline in the Delta region.
Villagers of Ugborodo staged a three days of protests outside a Chevron facility in Escravos to seek better jobs.
After a police officer and a meat seller are shot during an argument, a group gathers to protest the violence.
Unknown gun men said to be numbering about four have killed a lecturer with the University of Mkar. It is speculated the attack is politically motivated.
Villagers of Ugborodo staged a three days of protests outside a Chevron facility in Escravos to seek better jobs.
Ex-pat Turkish citizens protest in Abuja against their countries coup attempt, calling for support of President Erdogan.
Abia State health workers have locked the gate leading into their premises to protest the non payment of their six months salaries by the state government.
No fewer than seven persons were feared dead in Akokwa community in Ideato North council of Imo State, following a bloody clash between the Hausa/Fulani community and the indigenes of Akokwa.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces rescue 88 hostages, kill three members of Boko Haramk in Bama LGA.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces repel a Boko Haram attack on Kangarwa on 14/08. 16 Boko Haram dead, weapons recovered.

column7: Government of Nigeria (2015-); Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-)
column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks a UN convoy escorting immigration officials at Gwajibo village in Dikwa Local Government. Some militants were killed as well as civilians and 3 Immigration officials were also wounded. Deaths reported in the headline as scores.

column7: NARD: National Association of Resident Doctors; Teachers (Nigeria); Health Workers (Nigeria)
column17: The National Association of Resident Doctors (NARD), Ahmadu Bello University Teaching Hospital (ABUTH) chapter, staged a peaceful demonstration over uncleanliness.

column7: AWUMMA: Association of Wuye Ultra-Modern Market Allottees
column17: Traders, under the aegis of the Association of Wuye Ultra-Modern Market Allottees (AWUMMA), protested in Abuja over what they termed as harassment by policemen.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Agreement: 8000 Boko Haram members of Boko Haram surrender to military forces at a camp in Gombe State. Date(s) not known.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram killed five traders in an ambush on a highway near Gamboru, on the border with Cameroon. The immigration officers were injured in the ambush.
Ondo State APC members protest an alleged imposition of a governorship candidate by a national leader of the party.

Some of the 2000 candidates recruited and trained in 2014 by the Nigeria Immigration Service (NIS) staging a peaceful protest to demand for their reinstatement, at the entrance of the Secretary to the Government of the Federations office in Abuja on Tuesday (16/8/16). The reason for their dismissal is not known.

Policemen believed to be attached to the Police Mobile Force, PMF 55 Squadron, Aba, have clashed with residents of Unity Garden Estate, Osisioma Ngwa council, Abia State, over who has the right to occupy the estate. Injuries not known.
The over 200 farmers marched to the Ogba/Egbema/Ndoni Local Government Council headquarters to register their complaints on the destruction of their farm crops by suspected herdsmen.
Students go on a violent demonstration, blocking roads and attacking police over insecurity in their area. The protest lasted two days.
Workers of a petroleum refinery shut their facility down and block its entrance over non-payment of their salaries.
Taxi drivers protest alleged intimidation by the police.

column8: Police Forces of Nigeria (2015-) Prison Guards
column17: Prisoners in Abakaliki riot, clash with guards. 19 deaths reported.
NDA destroys a pipeline in Delta state on 19/08.

column6: NDGJM: Niger Delta Greenland Justice Mandate
column17: A state owned oil pipeline is destroyed by explosive in Udu LGA. NDGJM claimed responsibility. NDA also destroyed a pipeline elsewhere in the state.
A student is shot and killed by police during a otherwise peaceful demonstration against insecurity in the area. The protest was reportedly violent the previous day.

column8: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 19 Aug 2016, a military air raid on Boko Haram positions in Sambisa forest area (Gwoza, Borno) killed 300, including Boko Haram several commanders (known as Abubakar Mubi, Malam Nuhu and Malam Hamman). Additionally, Boko Haram leader Abubakar Shekau is believed either injured or killed.
Six are killed in a Fulani attack on Godogodo village on 20/08. Two days later the attackers besieged nearby Ningon village, near Gwantu, killing two and injuring one.
A man is killed in Ligari by unidentified gunmen for unknown reasons.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Kuburvwa (Kuburihu) village, near Chibok, killing 11 residents and abducting others.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram fighters riding on bicycles sacked Shawa village in Askira/Uba LGA of Borno state in the early hours of Sunday. Though no dead body has been found, [witnesses] said several villagers were missing.
Suspected Fulani attack Gwantu killing a small child.
Six are killed in a Fulani attack on Godogodo village on 20/08. Two days later the attackers besieged nearby Ningon village, near Gwantu, killing two and injuring one.

Workers in Borno State under the aegis of the Nigeria Labour Congress (NLC), on Tuesday staged a peaceful rally over the recent killing of two of their colleagues by the police during a similar protest session in Nasarawa State on 29/07.

Socio-economic activities at the heart Katsina metropolis were disrupted for hours as workers in Katsina state took to the streets over two Nasarawa State workers killed by suspected security operatives during a recent solidarity protest organized by national leaders of the Nigeria Labour Congress (NLC) in Nasarawa.
Students of Students of Fidei Polytechnic in Gboko area protest for unknown reason.
Eight are killed by a vigilante mob in Zamfara over charges of blasphemy.
Airline workers protest planned airport privatization in Lagos.
Unidentified gunmen attack a bus stand in Enugu for unknown reason. One reported dead.

Civil servants in Adamawa staged a protest in front of the Government House Yola calling for the removal of three government officials from office due to their anti-worker stance. The protesters, led by the state chairman of the Nigeria Labour Congress (NLC), Mr Dauda Maina, shut the entrance to government house for several hours.
The Edo State chapter of the Nigerian Labour Congress ( NLC) staged a protest over pay and alleged inhumane working conditions.

At least one student was reportedly killed after the second day of protest by the Students of Fidei Polytechnic in Gboko area of Benue State turned violent. It was not clear what the students were protesting.
Thousands of members of the Islamic Movement of Nigeria (IMN) staged a peaceful procession in Kaduna, demanding for the release of their leader, Sheikh Ibraheem El-Zakzaky.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Troops of Operation Lafia Dole have killed two senior Boko Haram commanders and several other insurgents (numbers not known) at Darul Jamel on the fringes of Sambisa forest in Borno
Protesters for and against Muhammad Abubakar, governor of Bauchi State, clashed at the All Progressives Congress (APC) national secretariat.

Armed men suspected to be herdsmen attacked the Ndiagu Attakwu community, Nkanu West Local Government Area of Enugu state, killing a seminarian, identified as Lazarus Nwafor, while four other members of a family sustained severe injury - one of whom died later in the hospital.
Hundreds of female IDPs embarked on peaceful protest barricaded the Maiduguri-Kano/Jos Road in Maiduguri over shortage of food supply to the Arabic Teachers College camp in the state capital.
In a clearance operation military forces raid militant camps in and around Sapele, killing 5 and injuring others.

Thousands of villagers from communities in Southern Kaduna staged a protest in Gwantu, Headquarters of Sanga Local Government Area, of Kaduna state against what they said was unrelenting deadly sieges on their communities by armed herdsmen and the confiscation of their lands for Cattle Grazing Reserves.
Fulanis attack Dinya community in Gassol local government area on 27/08 critically injuring 7.
Youths attack Ibadan Electricity Distribution Company officials with dangerous weapons following three days of power outages. The victims suffered severe injuries.
A human rights lawyer was assassinated by unknown gunmen in Aluu.
Inmates at Kuje Medium Prison riot. Police respond with tear-gas.
Lagos State university students protest at the office of the governor over non-accreditation of medical and dental programmes in the institution.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) on Tuesday destroyed a new camp being operated by the Boko Haram sect between Malam Fatori and Kangarwa in northern Borno State. The attack which was conducted overnight followed intelligence reports. Causalities not known.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces and Boko Haram clash in Ala Lumshe, near Marte. Following a period of battle air forces drove back the insurgents. Causalities not known.
Members of the BringBackOurGirls campaigners on Tuesday staged a protest at the road leading to Aso Rock, Abuja, by sitting on the road and sealing their mouths with cellotape.
Members of a football team protest to the governor over several months of unpaid salaries.

column6: NDGJM: Niger Delta Greenland Justice Mandate
column17: Niger Delta Greenland Justice Movement (NDGJM) launched Operation Crocodile Tears and blew up the Ogor-Oteri major delivery line, operated by the Nigeria Petroleum Development Company (NPDC) and Shorelines Petroleum in Ughelli North Local Government Area of Delta State in the early hours of Tuesday.

Members of the suspended University of Lagos Student Union (ULSU) executive Wednesday protested what they described as an ""unjust rustication"" of the union members. The protest took place at the schools senate building.

The Academic Forum of the Islamic Movement in Nigeria (AFIMN) protested the December 12 and 14, 2015 killings of their members and the continued detention of their leader, Sheik Ibrahim Zakzaky in Abuja.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: In-fighting between Boko Haram factions - those allied to ISIL backed Abu Musab al-Barnawi and those of Abubakar Shekau - over a leadership tussle in Zuwa village (Marte district, Borno), killing an unspecified number.

Food vendors angered by Kaduna state government from Rigasa ward in Igabi Local Government Area, under the free school feeding programme staged a peaceful protest, alleging that they have been unofficially replaced by officials of the LG Council.

column7: CATE: Coalition Against Terrorism and Extremism
column17: The Coalition Against Terrorism and Extremism (CATE) protest near government and military buildings to protest against planned negotiation with Boko Haram.

column6: Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 1 Sept 2016, in-fighting between Boko Haram factions - those allied to ISIL backed Abu Musab al-Barnawi and those of Abubakar Shekau - over a leadership tussle in Yele and Arafa (Manguno, Borno). In Yele, the Barnawi faction killed three people from the Shekau camp, injured one and took one with them, while several were killed in Arafa.
Two Chinese nationals are kidnapped in Odeda LGA. The pair was rescued in the following week.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Nigerian Air Force (NAF) destroyed a Boko Haram camp at Tumbun Rego in Northern Borno. Causalities not known. Source dated 02/09.

A coalition of civil society groups protest at the US Embassy in Lagos against what they termed Amnesty Internationals interference in war against terrorism in the country, describing the interference as a grand ploy to frustrate the countries security agencies.
Unidentified gunmen abduct 15 oil workers outside Port Harcourt along Omoku/Elele road.
The Chairman of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) in Okitipupa local government area of Ondo State, Mr Niyi Pirisola, was Friday assassinated by suspected hired killers at his home.
Women of Ikot Umoessiem community at the weekend embarked on a peaceful protest to express their dismay over incessant destruction of their crops and farmland by herdsmen.
Residents protest the poor state of a local road at the weekend.

Students protest at a Benin City government house after they learned an upcoming emanation coincided with an election date. The students, believing this would disenfranchise their vote, wanted the exam moved.
Workers of Irepodun and Oke-Ero Local Government Areas of Kwara on Tuesday protested over unpaid seven months arrears of salaries.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Arrests: Military forces arrest a Boko Haram commander (Muhammed Bulama) and two others in Gujba LGA.
Armed youths of Odiemerenyi community, Ahoada East attack a group of oil inspectors after an extortion payment is denied.

column7: NULGE: Nigerian Union of Local Government Employees
column17: Thousands of workers in the 16 Local Government Areas of Kwara State on 06/09 embarked on mass protest in Illorin over unpaid salary arrears.

At least 6,500 Internally Displaced Persons (IDPs) of Arabic College camp in Maiduguri caused traffic logjam on Maiduguri -Jos road when they protested against starvation. The protesters came out of the camp and blocked the highway as they complained that they were tired of burying their children due to lack of food in the camp.

Some supporters of President Muhammadu Buhari clashed with members of the #BringBackOurGirls group, as the campaigners made their way to the Presidential Villa in Abuja. The supporters of the president believed the campaigners meant to undermine the APC.
Militants (possibly kidnappers) ambush a group of operatives of the Federal Special Anti-Robbery Squad on 07/09 who were investigating a spate of recent attacks in the area. Casualties not known.
Militants (possibly kidnappers) attack residents of Igando. Casualties not known. Date not clear, on or before 07/09.

Scores were 07/09 injured and at least one killed (Vanguard claims 3) at the Lagos State government-owned abattoir at the Oko-Oba area of Agege, following a bloody clash between the Hausa and Fulani communities in the area.
Suspected Fulanis attack Golgolfa on 08/09 killing two.

Unrest was reported on 08/09 in Okpella, Estako East Local Government area of Edo State as supporters of the Peoples Democratic Party, PDP clashed with those of the All Progressives Congress, APC. It was gathered that the incident started brewing in the early hours when some PDP supporters were alleged to have threatened to carry out attack on any Okpellan supporting the ruling APC in Okpella.

column6: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-) Joint Task Force
column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two soldiers of the Multinational Joint Task Force, MNJTF, were on Thursday killed in an explosion while fighting Boko Haram insurgents in the northern part of Borno State near the Cameroon border, location not reported.
No fewer than 3,000 Ishiagu women on 09/09 staged a peaceful protest against the destruction of farm crops by herdsmen to the Palace of the traditional ruler of the community.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Members of Boko Haram attacked a motorist along a highway connecting Maiduguri and Monguno (at Kulukawuya village, 50 kilometres from Maiduguri) killing a driver and wounding passengers.

column6: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-) Joint Task Force
column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Members of the MNJTF clear 12 villages and kill four members of Boko Haram during operation in northern Borno.
A mob lynches a suspected thief in suburban Abuja.
Following an attack on Golgolfa, Fulanis attack several other villages in the LGA. Several houses were destroyed.
Fulanis attack Golgolfa two days following a similar attack in the area. One death reported.
Property destruction: A PDP office is attacked by vandals on the night of 10/09. No reported human injury.

Military forces averted a would-be suicide bomber as she approached a check point in Dikwa. Security forces, responding on suspicions, opened fire on the suspect, causing her pack to explode. In addition to the death of the bomber, two military members were injured mildly. The alliance of the bomber is not known.
Youths riot after a traditional ruler not of their choosing is selected. One civilian bystander is killed the melee.
Following a series of earthquake tremors the previous day, residents of Koi protest for government aid.
Traders protest the death of a colleague after an attack by Ijaw youths.

column6: NDGJM: Niger Delta Greenland Justice Mandate
column17: Niger Delta Greenland Justice Mandate, NDGJM, in the early hours of Tuesday, blew up the Afiesere-Iwhrenene major delivery line to UPS/UQCC, operated by Nigeria Petroleum Development Company, NDPC/Shorelines Petroleum in Ughelli North Local Government Area of Delta State.

Several people have been killed in a ongoing two day communal clash between Ochon community in Obubra local government area and Ofutop in Ikom local government area of Cross River State. The clash is believed to be over a land dispute. Fatalities reported, though numbers not known. (coded 3 fatalities per day of the clash)

Several people have been killed in a ongoing two day communal clash between Ochon community in Obubra local government area and Ofutop in Ikom local government area of Cross River State. The clash is believed to be over a land dispute. Fatalities reported, though numbers not known. (coded 3 fatalities per day of the clash)
Occupants of a four-storey building at Idumota Market in Lagos Island on Tuesday protested an alleged illegal eviction from their offices by a developer.
Ijaw youths attack stalls in a market place, burning them. One woman died in the attacks, sparking a protest.
Protest at the television college of the Nigerian Television Authority (NTA) in Jos, capital of Plateau State demanding that an indigene be appointed to head the college.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces attack an attack Boko Haram at three locations in Geidam LGA - at Jororo, Tombaeji and Gajire - killing four.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces attack an attack Boko Haram at three locations in Geidam LGA - at Jororo, Tombaeji and Gajire - killing four.
Unidentified gunmen attack a television station in Onitsha, sparking a gun battle with police. No loss of life, though there was property destroyed. The reason for the attack is not known.

Several people have been killed in a ongoing two day communal clash between Ochon community in Obubra local government area and Ofutop in Ikom local government area of Cross River State. The clash is believed to be over a land dispute. Fatalities reported, though numbers not known.

Several people have been killed in a ongoing two day communal clash between Ochon community in Obubra local government area and Ofutop in Ikom local government area of Cross River State. The clash is believed to be over a land dispute. Fatalities reported, though numbers not known. (coded 3 fatalities per day of the clash)
Hospital patients protest over a prolonged staff strike.

column7: NAPSS: National Association of Plateau State Students
column17: NAPSS protests over the transfer of a teacher.
Suspected herdsmen operating in Ubulu-Unor community, Aniocha South local government area of Delta State shot and injured two farmers on their way to their farmlands.
Protests in Umuahia and Aba over an election ruling.
[Fulani] herdsmen attack Nandu and Kabamu villages in Sanga Local [recently]. No fewer than 38 persons were killed in the separate attacks, others missing.
[Fulani] herdsmen attack Nandu and Kabamu villages in Sanga Local [recently]. No fewer than 38 persons were killed in the separate attacks, others missing.
Residents protest over the planned demolition of houses.
Protests in Umuahia and Aba over an election ruling.
Parents of students of the Federal Government Girls College, Benin City, Edo State, staged a peaceful protest over school fees hike.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Air forces flying F-7NIs conduct a series of air strikes at Tumbin Gini and Tumbin Kayewa in northern Borno. ""Many"" casualties.
On 16 September 2016, unidentified gunmen fatally attacked a local armed group member in Omoku (Ogba/Egbema/Ndoni, Rivers).
APC youths protest over an alleged plan to tamper with a primary election result. Exact date of the protest not clear.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram opens fire on a group of churchgoers in Kwamjilari Gana, eight dead.

column6: NDGJM: Niger Delta Greenland Justice Mandate
column17: NDGJM blow up a pipeline in Ughelli.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Talari, beheading the village leader, his son and shooting two others.
Twenty houses destroyed and two dead during a clash between two militias over control of land in Odukpani.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Nigerian Army encountered Boko Haram members foraging for food, ambushed troops of the Operation Lafiya Dole escorting commercial vehicles from Damboa to Maiduguri at Sanda general area, Borno State. Six civilian dead, three soldiers injured.
Two factions of the APC clash in Asaba. Several arrests reported.
Youths protest the death of a hunter they suspect died at the hands of police.
APC and PDP supporters clash during a rally for the latter. Injuries not known.

Property destruction: Gunmen dressed in military camouflage on Wednesday night burnt down the home of former leader of the Rivers State House of Assembly and chieftain of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Dr. Chidi Julius Lloyd at Akpabu community in Emohua local government area of Rivers State.

column6: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-) Joint Task Force
column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Multinational Joint Task Force (MNJTF) has recaptured Malam Fatori, a border town on the shores of Lake Chad, from Boko Haram after a fierce battle. Members of the Islamic Movement of Nigeria, IMN, protested in the streets of Abuja, demanding the immediate release of their leader, Sheik Ibraheem El-Zakzaky, who has been by the military since last year December. Fifteen Boko Haram dead (Premium Times). Following the battle, West African arm of the Islamic State (ISIS) claimed Boko Haram killed forty military members, though the military denies this number.

Members of the Islamic Movement of Nigeria, IMN, protested in the streets of Abuja, demanding the immediate release of their leader, Sheik Ibraheem El-Zakzaky, who has been by the military since last year December. Police used teargas to disperse the group.
Pensioners protest over pay in Owerri.
A vigilante mob attacks and kills a suspected motorcycle thief in Pankshin.
Vigilantes attack a suspected thief. No fatality reported.

column7: CDD: Coalition in Defence of Democracy
column17: Hundreds of protesters under the aegis of Coalition in Defence of Democracy (CDD) protested at the precinct of the National Assembly, demanding the immediate suspension of embattled former chairman of the House of Representatives Appropriation Committee over a question of the budget.
NDA destroys a pipeline in Bonny LGA.
Parents of students of the Federal Government College, Ilorin, staged a peaceful protest over school fee hike.
Protest in Enugu North over the alleged seizure of ancestral land by the state government. The protest occurred ""at the weekend.""

The traditional ruler of Mbayongo district in Kastina Ala local council of Benue State, Tyoor Awuha Alev, has been killed by unknown gunmen. He was shot dead at his palace in Vingir village around 8:00p.m. on Sunday.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram ambushed a convoy late on Sunday near Bama, 70km southeast of Maiduguri, resulting in the deaths of an army officer, three soldiers, and three attackers

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacked an army position at Logomani, 110km northeast of Maiduguri city, killing four soldiers. The military claimed 22 Boko Haram died in the fire fight.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks the village of Kubirivour, Boftari and Kuburmbalah, near Chibok. Eight fatalities.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Kwang village, near Daggu, battling a unnamed local militia group. The attackers were repelled. Casualties not known.

column17: Hundreds of workers, under the aegis of the Senior Staff Association of Nigerian Universities (SSANU) of the Federal University of Agriculture Abeokuta (FUNAAB), Ogun state on Monday protesting against university management.
Unidentified gunmen attack the home of a traditional ruler, assault and kill his son.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: The Nigerian military has lost an officer and three other soldiers with 19 others including three members of militia groups (not named) seriously injured in a Boko Haram ambush in Borno State. The attack began with the detonation of an IED, followed by an attack.
Students parents protest after exam results were not released on schedule.
Property destruction: Fulanis burn homes in Antang on Godogodo-Gidan-Way in Jemaa Local Council of Southern Kaduna.
Fulanis attack Dogon Daji, killing three and destroying houses.
Truck drivers protest taxes and levies.
Hundreds of employees of Aero Contractors Airline Wednesday staged a peaceful protest over the closure of the airline by the Asset Management Company of Nigeria (AMCON) in Lagos.
NDA and members of ISN: Imo Security Network clash in Ohaji/Egbema, one death reported.
Violence between APC and PDP members broke out during a voting exercise in Irrua.
Fulanis shoot and kill two and kidnap a priest during a raid on Nnewi.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces clash with Boko Haram at Bulabulin, kill nine and wound others.

column6: NDGJM: Niger Delta Greenland Justice Mandate
column17: Members of NDGJM blow up a pipeline in Ughelli South.
Seven vehicles have been burnt by youths from Ohaji/Egbema LGA following the alleged killing of a man by the Imo State Security Network the previous day.
Supporters of the PDP protest a court ruling which declared a rival APC candidate an election winner.

column7: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
column17: The National Association of Nigerian Students (NANS), University of Lagos, protest over school mismanagement.
Students of the Kogi State Polytechnic, Lokoja, staged a protest and demanded for the removal of the rector of the institution over poor access to amenities. The students blocked roads.
Residents and military clash over land use in the Iddo Sarki area.
PDP supporters protest Edo governorship poll result in Benin City.
Military forces clash with members of the Bakassi Strike Forces at Efut Isigi, Akpabuyo LGA in Cross River State. Seven reported dead.
24 soldiers are captured during an encounter with CML in the Bakassi waterways. Seven CML killed during the battle, a claim they deny.
Contract staff with mobile telecommunication company, MTN, in Ilorin, Kwara State, have protested termination of their appointment allegedly in violation of an earlier agreement.
Unidentified gunmen attack a police armoury, cart away weapons and kill four officers.
Gunmen kill a traditional ruler in Vingir village.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Arrests: Military forces arrest a Boko Haram commander in Kwaya Kusar LGA.
PDP supporters protest Edo governorship poll result in Benin City.
Members of the Islamic Movement (Shiites) accuse members of the military of abducting a member in Dustin-Ma.
Four members of the All Progressives Congress (APC) were killed in the Gokana local government area of Rivers state. The party speculated the states governor masterminded the killings.
Residents protest an alleged land takeover by a Chinese company.

Youths believed to be loyalists of the National Chairman of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Chief John Odigie-Oyegun protested against national leader of the party Asiwaju Bola Ahmed Tinubu. The protest took place at the national secretariat of the APC in Abuja.
Health workers protest non payment of salaries.
Trade unions in the aviation sector staged a peaceful protest at the Murtala Muhammed Airport, Lagos over the proposed concession of the four major airports in the country.

Business and commercial activities in Akure, the Ondo State capital, were halted as armed supporters of the gubernatorial candidate of the AAPC, Chief Rotimi Akeredolu, and those of Engineer Olusegun Abraham, who was defeated at the primary poll, fought. It was learnt that trouble started when some youths stormed the APC secretariat in the morning, demanding resignation of the National Chairman of the APC.
When a food service company threatens to relocate out of Nigeria its employees protest.
Sovereign Rights Coalition (SRC) staged a protest at the Embassy of Iran in Lagos, demanding an end to the diplomatic relationship between Nigeria and Iran.
A 42-year-old man, was beaten and stripped naked a mob when they allege he uses magic.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Troops of the Operation Lafiya Dole Thursday at about 6.30 a.m., intercepted a male suicide bomber on the outskirts of Maiduguri and neutralised the bomber and later the bomb he strapped on himself.

Protesting Ijaw youths accused President Muhammadu Buhari of secretly giving the order for the bank accounts of former President Goodluck Jonathan to be frozen, alleging that the order was indicative of his ""vindictiveness"" towards the former first family. The protesters blocked an expressway.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two suspected female suicide bombers were shot dead by soldiers as they attempted to attack a military base in Gwoza, Borno state. Perpetrators were Boko Haram suspects.
Residents attempted to attack the Durbar station of the Nigerian police in Oyo Town on Thursday, after a police traffic warden allegedly caused the death of two persons.
Federal University of Technology workers protest against the actions of their Vice Chancellor, attack journalists covering the event.
An APC chieftains wife is abducted in Omuo-Oke.
PDP supporters again protest an election result in Benin City.
The entrance of the Turkish embassy were paralyzed after students barricaded the entrance in protest against the detention of some Nigerian students by security forces in Ankara.
Gunmen assassinate a police escort of an APC member in Mbieri.
Federal University of Technology workers protest against the actions of their Vice Chancellor, block roads. The police later dispersed the group.
University of Lagso students, attempting to disrupt ongoing examinations, assault a police officer.
A group within the Islamic Movement of Nigeria (IMN), the Save Zakzakys Life Group (SZLG) in Abuja protested against the continuous detention of the leader of the movement.
Violent protest after an election member of the state assembly is not permitted entrance to the legislative building.
Church worshippers stone man to death over a land issue.

column17: Boko Haram attacks Kwashebe village, killing five residents and injuring others before looting foodstuffs.

Hundreds of protesters disrupted activities at the main entrance of the National Assembly, asking the Department of State Services, DSS, and anti-graft agencies to raid federal lawmakers in order to recover more public funds. Simultaenously, groups in Abuja converge to protest the state of the economy, specifically the fall of the naira.
Rioters set Awajir Police station ablaze after a motorcycle rider was killed during a police stop.

Aides of Senators and members of the House of Representatives protested against non payment of their September salaries and allowances by the National Assembly management. At the same time, police protest over their pensions.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Air raids in the ""last one week"" target Boko Haram position sin Smabisa Forest, claiming the lives of ""many.""
Shiites exchange gunfire with security forces in Funtua following a religious procession that was considered illegal. At least three people dead

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A suspected Boko Haram IED targets a military escort in the Mura Garage area of the city, killing between 10 and 18.
Irate youths (Sunni) attacked a group of Shiites during a procession in the Anguwan Rogo area. Several injuries and the destruction of a worship building destroyed.
Sunnis attack a group of Shiites during a religious procession in Sokoto state. One or two deaths reported, depending on the source.
Residents protest over waterfront slums.

column6: NDGJM: Niger Delta Greenland Justice Mandate
column17: Members of NDGJM blow up the Oviri-Otor trunkline in Delta State.
Two men suspected to be handset snatchers were burnt to death by a mob in Mararaba, near Abuja.

column17: CESYD accused the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) of complexity in a recent gubernatorial poll in the state, and protested at the INEC office in Abuja.

Sunni/Shiite violence continues, two Shiites killed and ten injured as they are attacked while rebuilding a school in Tudun Wada.
Security forces intercept and gun down a suspected suicide bomber in Madagali. The suspects alliance not described by source.
On 15 October 2016, a local armed group attacked vehicles transporting Fulanis in Godogodo (Jemaa, Kaduna) leaving 14 dead.
Police and military clash in Nkwagu, near Abakaliki, on Saturday evening. Injuries reported.
Fulani militia attack the predominantly Christian town of Godogodo. 29 dead are reported the next day
An armed group attack vehicles transporting Fulanis, fourteen dead. Following the attacks, Fulanis in the area rioted into next day. Police intervened to quell the violence.
Twenty, identified only as ""herdsmen"" attack Galwyi community in Chikun LGA, killing two and stealing cattle.
On 17 October 2016, IS West Africa attacked a joint military position of Niger and Nigeria in Gashager, killing 20, injuring at least 13, and seizing weapons and military equipments.

column17: Thirteen are wounded when Boko Haram attacks a military location in Gashigar. The forces exited the area the following day.
Nigerian forces have killed seven oil militants and pirates (neither identified) suspected to be responsible for an unrest in the oil-producing region of Cross River over three days.
Numbering 500, slum dwellers in Lagos have stormed the office of the state governor over the planned demolition of slums in the state.
Three mobile police officers on patrol were shot dead in the early hours of Monday on a road between Plateau and Kaduna states at Hawan Kibo.
Nigerian forces have killed seven oil militants and pirates (neither identified) suspected to be responsible for an unrest in the oil-producing region of Cross River over three days.

column17: Military and Civilian JTF raided a location of Terwase Agwaza militia in Tor Donga, killing 10 and injuring others.

column17: Looting: Boko Haram attacked, looted and burned Goptari, near Chibok. casualties not known.

Nigerian forces have killed seven oil militants and pirates (neither identified) suspected to be responsible for an unrest in the oil-producing region of Cross River over three days.
Some indigenes of the Federal Capital Territory, FCT, barricaded the main entrance of the National Assembly protesting a quit notice allegedly issued to them by the Nigerian Army.
Commercial bus drivers in Kano protest over a use of a certain paint by Kano State Road Traffic Agency (KAROTA).
Non-academic staff at Lagos State Polytechnic protest after the rector tried to break a labour strike.
Unidentified gunmen stormed the Ibeshi area of Ikorodu killing a pregnant woman, her two children and another man for unknown reason.
A pregnant woman is attacked and killed by an armed group described only as militants. Four others injured.
One killed, several houses destroyed when members of a vigilante militia clashed with a group of locals Ejinya Abakpa and Ejinya Eheche communities in Ankpa local government area of Kogi State.

Military forces establish a base in Buratai.
Herdsmen attacked Ossissa community, killing two and wounding another.
Hundreds of protesters barricaded the Asaba-Ughelli expressway to express their anger over an attack by herdsmen the previous day.
Villagers gather in protest to demand herdsmen vacate the area.

National Agency for Food and Drugs Administration workers protest over the ""plight of workers.""
Health workers protest the reinstatement of a medical director.
A group of 100 protest at a Lagos court after Ex-president Goodluck Jonathans wifes bank account is frozen following money laundering claims.
