column17: FONGON protest at the National Assembly, accusing judges of corruption. At the same time, legislative aides protested at the National Assembly over unpaid allowances.

column7: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
column17: National Association of Nigerian Students, NANS, logo marched on the Enugu-Onitsha expressway in Awka to protest alleged extortion by officials of the Anambra government.

column7: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column17: Members of NURTW and a local motorcycle group clash in Igando over a tax or levy issue. Twelve injured.
Protest after Patience Jonathans (former First Lady) assets are frozen over money laundering claims.
Members of the PDP violently protest a electoral office decision in Ondo town. One student is injured when he is struck by a police tear gas canister. A similar protest took place in Akure.
The Kogi State chairman of Maiyati is assassinated by unknown assailants at his home in Lokoja.
PDP youths violently protest over the inclusion of a name on an electoral ballot.
PDP supporters continue a ballot protest in Akure. It is not known if the protest was violent.

column7: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
column17: Members of NANS against protest over alleged extortion payments ""at the weekend.""

column17: Military forces foil a Boko Haram suicide attempt in Gubio, shoot eight assailants.

column17: Military forces clear several Boko Haram camps in Marte LGA, and rescued 38 of their prisoners. Six Boko Haram fatalities reported.

column17: On 1 November 2016, a Boko Haram truck carrying a suicide ordinance exploded after the vehicle was denied access to a military checkpoint, killing its eight occupants.

Members of the Islamic Movement of Nigeria (IMN), who took to the streets of Abuja, to protest the continuous detention of the their spiritual leader, Ibrahim El-Zakzaky are teargassed by police after they were refused a demonstration approval.

At least three persons were wounded and two others arrested following fracas that broke out during the conduct of elections into the executive positions of the Ekiti state chapter of the Nigeria Union of Teachers (NUT).

PDP supporters of Osisioma Ngwa Local Government Area of Abia State protested attempts by party leadership to conduct a second ward of primaries.
Protesters marched to the Presidential Villa insisting that several judges who had been indicted step aside.

column17: Military forces repel a Boko Haram attack at Malam Fatori, killing 14. Five soldiers reported dead.

column17: Military forces cleared the Boko Haram controlled areas of Geram, Bulankassa and Chukungudu on the ""southern fringes"" of the Lake Chad region and rescued 85 hostages ""at the weekend"". One soldier believed dead in the operation.
A vigilante mob lynches a suspected thief in Afikpo.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Troops of 27 Task Force Brigade, Nigerian Army have killed 37 [Boko Haram] in Borno south during a clearance operation nicknamed 'Operation Karya Gwuiwa.' The villages cleared included Ajigin, Golgore, Njibulla, Doksa 1, 2 and 3 villages. One prisoner rescued.

column17: Troops of 27 Task Force Brigade, Nigerian Army have killed 37 [Boko Haram] in Borno south during a clearance operation nicknamed 'Operation Karya Gwuiwa.' The villages cleared included Ajigin, Golgore, Njibulla, Doksa 1, 2 and 3 villages. One prisoner rescued.

column17: Troops of 27 Task Force Brigade, Nigerian Army have killed 37 [Boko Haram] in Borno south during a clearance operation nicknamed 'Operation Karya Gwuiwa.' The villages cleared included Ajigin, Golgore, Njibulla, Doksa 1, 2 and 3 villages. One prisoner rescued.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Akwada, 10 kilometres from Chibok, killing two soldiers in a gunfight. The attackers also torched the village.

column7: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
column17: Students under NANS protest in Awka at the weekend over alleged extortion by officials of the Anambra government.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: One soldier and 13 Boko Haram dead after the latter staged an attack in Kangarwa.

No fewer than six people from Ndi Okereke Abam in Ovukwu autonomous community, Arochukwu local government area of Abia State, sustained from bullet wounds and machete cuts in a clash with herders (Vanguard reports they were Fulani).

At least 350 shanties were burnt in a three day communal conflict between Yoruba speaking and Egun speaking residents of Otodogbami area of Ikate, Lekki Phase 1 area of Lagos. The clash was triggered by claims of supremacy over the landed area between the Egun people; mostly indigenes of Benin Republic and the Yoruba people in the community. Between four and ten fleeing residents were reported yo have drowned.
Youths in Akpabuyo and Ikot Nakanda LGAs of Cross River protest against alleged ""marginalization"" by a local cement company.
Youths in Akpabuyo and Ikot Nakanda LGAs of Cross River protest against alleged ""marginalization"" by a local cement company.
Attackers described only as ""suspected militants"" blew up a pipeline in Batan community of Warri South West and open fire on a group of company security guards. No causalities.
LAGBUS (red bus) operators block the Ikorodu road at Majidun Creek to protest the governments ban on them.
At least three children were on Monday beheaded in Dissol village of Gassol Local Government Area of Taraba State, perpetrators not known.

Hundreds of protesters stormed the national headquarters of the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) and demanded for the immediate resignation of the chairman of the commission after he allegedly refused to investigate a claim of voter fraud.
NDA use explosives and destroyed a oil pipeline near Warri. A similar attack occurred in the area last week.

500 protesters from several communities around Warri blockaded a site operated by SPDC, the Nigerian subsidiary of Shell. The protesters claimed the oil company had not lived up to their agreement with the surrounding community.

At least 350 shanties were burnt in a three day communal conflict between Yoruba speaking and Egun speaking residents of Otodogbami area of Ikate, Lekki Phase 1 area of Lagos. The clash was triggered by claims of supremacy over the landed area between the Egun people; mostly indigenes of Benin Republic and the Yoruba people in the community. Between four and ten fleeing residents were reported yo have drowned.

At least two soldiers are feared dead after a bomb explosion along Banki - Usmanari - Kumshe road in Borno State. About eight soldiers were also injured in the explosion which occurred at about 8:10 a.m

One is killed and three injured during violence at a PDP primary. The victim, who was set alight by a group of protesting delegates, was a member of staff of Isialangwa North Local Government Area. A witness said trouble broke out when some delegates who came for the poll at the council headquarters in Okpuala-Ngwa, rejected the list presented by the party officials that came to conduct the exercise.

Some traders at Drug Market Onitsha Bridgehead, Anambra State, blocked the entrance gate of the market in protest of proposed relocation of the market to Oba in Idemili South Local Government Area of the state.

Security forces clash with NDA at the Batan-Egwa creeks in Warri South-west Local Government Area of the state. Causalities not known. NDA had detonated explosives on oil pipelines over two days in the area.
Protest as police fail to arraign alleged land grabbers in Oko-Olomi community in Ibeju Lekki, Lagos.

At least 350 shanties were burnt in a three day communal conflict between Yoruba speaking and Egun speaking residents of Otodogbami area of Ikate, Lekki Phase 1 area of Lagos. The clash was triggered by claims of supremacy over the landed area between the Egun people; mostly indigenes of Benin Republic and the Yoruba people in the community. Between four and ten fleeing residents were reported yo have drowned.

A youth in Ayama, an outpost of Aladja, Udu Local Government Area, was reportedly shot dead by men from neighbouring Isaba, Warri South West, Delta State in communal conflict. A second victim was reported missing.
Violence against residents of Ayama by militia from Isaba continued; several houses destroyed and seven villagers abducted.

column17: Parliamentary Staff Association of Nigeria (PASAN) locked out members of the state House of Assembly in protest over unfulfilled demands bothering on staff welfare.

Militias from Onweonweiya and Mkpumaekweoku militias of Izza LRA clashed at of Ebonyi State - three deaths reported.
The students of Akwa Ibom Polytechnic protested against an increment of fees by the schools authority.

column17: Dasa and Duwabayi, both in Monguno Local Government Area, were attacked by the Boko Haram insurgents over two days. 22 deaths reported.
At least two villagers have been killed and a dozen others abducted when attackers, only described as insurgents attacked a village in Askira/Uba local government area of Borno State.
The Ambrose Ali University (AAU), Ekpoma, Edo State, was shut down indefinitely following a violent protest by the students over alleged hike in school fees.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Dasa and Duwabayi, both in Monguno Local Government Area, were attacked by the Boko Haram insurgents over two days. 22 deaths reported.
Members of NDA destroy an oil pipeline in Nembe.
Protesters block the entrance to the National Assembly, calling for the prosecution of the alleged corruption of judges. The protest lasted for two days.

No fewer than 600 residents of Otodo Gbame, a predominantly Egun waterfront community in Lekki protested the destruction of their homes by hoodlums and policemen, alleged to be working with the state government. The protesters marched to the state house in Alausa.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: One lieutenant colonel and eight soldiers dead after a Boko Haram attack on government forces between Bita and Piridang, Borno State.
A young boy is burnt to death by a vigilante group after it was suspected he had stolen food.
One dead and another injured in a clash between members of APC factions in Kano.
Protesters block the entrance to the National Assembly, calling for the prosecution of the alleged corruption of judges. The protest lasted for two days.
Indigenes and residents of Umunneochi LGA protest over a petition written by a member of the community against a company located in the area.
NUP pensioners protest over unpaid pensions, gratuity in Ife-Ife.
Youths of Ugborodo protested at a Shell Oil facility from 16/11 - 25/11 over ""neglect.""

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A group described as ""local hunters"" rescue eight Boko Haram prisoners in Sambisa Forest as they fled a ""fierce battle"" between the sect and military forces. The battle and rescue occurred ""last week"" (source dated 23/11). Details limited, including location and causalities.
Pensioners block roads in protest on non-payments.
Youths of Ugborodo protested at a Shell Oil facility from 16/11 - 25/11 over ""neglect.""
Residents protest poor road maintenance.

column7: PDP: Peoples Democratic Party; APC: All Progressives Congress
column17: Members or supporters of the APC and PDP attempted to forcibly enter the State Assembly Complex from adjoining roads, but were dispersed by police with tear gas and live bullets. The APC supporters said that they were at the assembly to inform the speaker of their opposition over his refusal to swear in a member, while the PDP loyalists said they were there on a courtesy visit to the Speaker.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military air forces bomb a Boko Haram position at Ngoshe. Causalities not known.
Youths of Ugborodo protested at a Shell Oil facility from 16/11 - 25/11 over ""neglect.""
Unidentified gunmen abduct 40 in Maru LGA.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 18 November 2016, 5 suicide bombers targeted a police checkpoint and a bus station near a Maidguri transit camp (Borno) in the eastern suburbs, killing four of themselves and two civilian self-defense fighters. The fifth bomber was arrested.
Militia of Ediba and Usumotong communities in Abi LGA clash over two days, claim[ing] many lives.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two suicide bombers in the early hours of 18/11 killed themselves at a police checkpoint near the Federal High Court Complex in the Jiddari Polo area of Maiduguri, after police officers on guard tried to stop them from advancing towards their post. A third bomber was arrested. No other causalities. Later investigations led authorities to believe a secondary target may have been a Catholic Church.
Militia of Ediba and Usumotong communities in Abi LGA clash over two days, claim[ing] many lives.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacked Thlaimaklama village in Chibok Local government area of Borno state ""at the weekend"", destroying several homes.
Youths of Ugborodo protested at a Shell Oil facility from 16/11 - 25/11 over ""neglect.""

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces gun down a Boko Haram suicide bomb as he attempted to detonated a pack near an IDP camp in Maiduguri. A similar attack was carried out near the camp the day before.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military air forces bomb a Boko Haram position at Kangarwa. Causalities not known.
Youths of Ugborodo protested at a Shell Oil facility from 16/11 - 25/11 over ""neglect.""
A former minister of foreign affairs, Ambassador Bagudu Hirse, was kidnapped by three gunmen in Kaduna.
Youths of Ugborodo protested at a Shell Oil facility from 16/11 - 25/11 over ""neglect.""

column6: Military Forces of Nigeria (2015-) Security and Civil Defence Corps
column17: Gunmen dressed in military camouflage killed four members of the Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps in the oil producing region of Omoku.
One dead and eleven injured when a group of hunters known as ""Agbekoya"" attempted to raid a police armoury in Ogbere.
A wealthy Tiv farmer and his brother are killed by unidentified assailants near Chakumi village in Abaji Area Council of the FCT.
Teachers of Junior Secondary School (JSS) Kuje protested in the school after the principal allegedly slapped their colleague.

Three persons were injured while two vehicles were destroyed when two rival groups protesting for and against the recent bill passed by Edo State House of Assembly, amending a Pension bill, clashed at the popular Oba Ovonramwe Square, Benin City.
A vigilante mob pursues a suspected thief who stabs one member of the mob before getting beaten to death.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Military forces ambush a Boko Haram group at Goneri, Kukawa LGA, capturing two trucks. Several members of Boko Haram were reported injured as they fled.
Youths of Ugborodo protested at a Shell Oil facility from 16/11 - 25/11 over ""neglect.""
Striking Federal Polytechnic workers protest, blocking several roads in Ado-Ekiti.
Residents of Arepo Community in Ogun State marched in demonstration to the head office of Ikeja Electricity Distribution Company, at Alausa, to protest over three months power outage.

Business activities were grounded at the headquarters of the National Insurance Commission, NAICOM, as a result of a protest staged against the commission's management by workers. There was a similar protest in Lagos.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Huyum, Sabongarin Huyum and Wasada on motorbike, killing five villagers and looting their property.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Huyum, Sabongarin Huyum and Wasada on motorbike, killing five villagers and looting their property.
Youths of Ugborodo protested at a Shell Oil facility from 16/11 - 25/11 over ""neglect.""

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram attacks Huyum, Sabongarin Huyum and Wasada on motorbike, killing five villagers and looting their property.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two are killed in a Boko Haram suicide attack on a Maiduguri motor park.
Workers of NAICOM protest activities of management in Lagos.
Youths of Ugborodo protested at a Shell Oil facility from 16/11 - 25/11 over ""neglect.""

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: On 24 November 2016, a local armed group and Boko Haram clashed in Shawa (Damboa, Borno). 2 members of a youth local armed group and scores (coded as 20) of suspected members of Boko Haram were killed.
Youths of Ugborodo protested at a Shell Oil facility from 16/11 - 25/11 over ""neglect.""
Four persons were killed while several houses including the house of the village head were burnt, when unknown gunmen attacked Mile One Village in Tafan District, Kaduna State on Friday.
Clash between APC and PDP supporters in Owo. One death reported.
Two are killed and several houses burnt over two non-consecutive days during a clash between the Ebira and Bassa kwomu speaking peoples Ikende.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Boko Haram elements attempt to ambush government officials along Bama road in Gwoza LGA, between Pulka and Maiduguri. The officials, who were escorted by soldiers, provided resistance and fought off the attackers. 30 Boko Haram dead.

Six unidentified gunmen, ""at the weekend"" shot and killed an oil magnates aid. Several others reported injured. It is not clear if the violence is related to an ongoing land dispute between the Abagana and Ukpo communities in the area, which some investigators suspect.

column6: NDGJM: Niger Delta Greenland Justice Mandate
column17: NDGJM, on the morning of 27/11, blew up a pipeline operated by the Nigerian Petroleum Development Company, NPDC in Otu-Jeremi, Ughelli South, Delta State.
A loyalist of former Vice President Atiku Abubakar is installed a Jada district head, leading to protest from the local community, who preferred an election.

column7: SSANU: Senior Staff Association of Nigerian Universities; Labour Group (Nigeria)
column17: One person died during a protest by some workers of the Federal University of Technology Akure (FUTA). The protesters who were said to be members of the Senior Staff Association of Nigerian Universities (SSANU) were demanding the termination of the Vice Chancellor of the University, Prof. There is no mention of police intervention or violence against civilians by the demonstrators.
Police protest non-payment of their allowances in the Funbi-Fagun area of Ondo town.
A Chinese miner is attacked and killed and another injured by gunmen in Alogani. The motive for the attack ins not known.
Two are killed and several houses burnt over two non-consecutive days during a clash between the Ebira and Bassa kwomu speaking peoples Ikende.
A vigilante mob set ablaze two suspected armed robbers at Umuguma, new Owerri, in Owerri West council area of Imo State for allegedly snatching a handbag.

Suspected former militants attacked Umuokeduru and Imeni communities, both in Ohaji Egbema local government area, killing 11 and burning buildings. Authorities believe the attack many have been motivated by alleged partiality in the State Amnesty Programme.

Athletes staged a protest at the National Stadium, Surulere to express their displeasure with the Sports Ministry and the Cross River State governments failure to organise the National Sports Festival.
Residents of Ikosi, in Kosofe Local Government Area, Lagos, blocked the main entrance of Ikeja Electric (IE), Ikeja, protesting over two months of power outage in their area.

Members of the opposition Peoples Democratic Party, PDP, in the Nigerian Senate have staged a protest walk out from the chamber, following uproar that trailed the defection of Yele Omogunwa to the ruling All Progressives Congress.
Youths under the aegis of Concerned Igbo Youths (CIY), go on a rampage to protest an investigation into the former First Ladys finances.
Aggrieved bank customers attack and nearly lynch its managing director in New Haven before police were able to free the man.
Fulanis attack Ozu-Item, causing life threatening injuries to scores of farmers.
Members of the IM (Shiite) block the entrance to the national assembly in protest of the detention of their leader, Sheik Ibrahim El-Zakzaky.

An unidentified armed group attacked the campaign office of Senator Shehu Sani (APC) representing Kaduna Central Senatorial District and attacked members of the Senators social media team. The attack may have been related to APC infighting.
The Nigerian national women's football team fold a six-day sit-in protest over pay at a Abuja hotel.
Youths protest alleged extortion in a government student stipend programme.

column7: CGGCI: Coalition on Good Governance and Change Initiative; Women (Nigeria)
column17: CGGCI protesters gathered at the Abuja division of the Federal High Court against the judgement that detained leader of the Shiite Islamic Movement in Nigeria (IMN), Sheik Ibraheem El-Zakzaky be released without condition. The Nigerian women's football team continue their occupation of an Abuja hotel to protest unpaid wages

Residents of Odutan Street in Ketu area of Lagos gathered at the Ikeja Electricity Distribution Company (IKEDC)s office to protest blackout in the community, as well as what they termed crazy billing for services not enjoyed by them.

Protest at the National Assembly against harassment of former President Goodluck Jonathans family members by the Department of State Services (DSS) and Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) over alleged charges of corruption. The Nigerian women's football team continue their occupation of an Abuja hotel to protest unpaid wages
2 killed, 2 injured, 3 missing in hostilities between militias of Igbide and Okpolo-Enwhe towns in Isoko South LGA, Delta. The dispute arose over land.
Lecturers at the Nigerian Institute of Leather Science Technology, NILEST, lock the entrance to the school and block roads in protest of a payment issue.
Militia from Imakun Omi attack civilians from Atijere over oil deposits. Date, casualties not known. Source dated 12/7. The attack led to a protest in Akure.
The Nigerian national women's football team fold a six-day sit-in protest over pay at a Abuja hotel.

column7: Civilian JTF: Civilian Joint Task Force
column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: 54 members of Boko Haram, two soldiers and two members of the Civilian JTF are killed ""over the course of a week"" in Sambisa Forest. Military and JTF deaths occurred at Bita - other locations and dates not known.

Residents of Atijere community in Ilaje Local Government Area of Ondo State staged a protest against a recent invasion by gunmen from Imakun Omi in Akure. The attack is believed to be motivated by the areas oil deposits.
The Nigerian national women's football team fold a six-day sit-in protest over pay at a Abuja hotel.
No fewer than 1,000 residents of Sapele Local Government Area of Delta State protest poor electricity supply to the area by Benin Electricity Distribution Company.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two suspected Boko Haram suicide bombers struck a Madagali market on 09/12, killing at least 57 and injuring 177. 59 dead including bombers
A Ogbe-Ijoh carpenter is beheaded in Aladja, Udu Local Government Area by suspected Ijaw youths. Additionally, two houses and two cars were destroyed.
The Nigerian national women's football team fold a six-day sit-in protest over pay at a Abuja hotel.

column7: MAJAN: Maritime Journalists Association of Nigeria
column17: Members of MAJAN stage an 11 hour protest against traffic congestion in Apapa. The protest took place in Apapa, as well as ""the entire Lagos metropolis"" - along Apapa road by 7.00am and terminated at the premises of Murhi International Television (MITV) by 6.00pm.
Members of the APC and PDP clash in Opobo/Nkoro LGA in 10/12, reasons unknown. Three APC youths reported injured.

column7: MAJAN: Maritime Journalists Association of Nigeria
column17: Members of MAJAN stage an 11 hour protest against traffic congestion in Apapa. The protest took place in Apapa, as well as ""the entire Lagos metropolis"" - along Apapa road by 7.00am and terminated at the premises of Murhi International Television (MITV) by 6.00pm.

Soldiers are accused of ""mass arrests and killings"" during a voting exercise in Tai and Gokana LGA on 10/12. It is alleged the army connived with some politicians (PDP, suspected) to influence the outcome of the vote. Military forces deny these claims.

Protesters from 36 affected communities in Gagarawa, Taura, Suletankarkar and Gwiwa local government areas took their protest to the State High Court in Dutse, the headquarters of Jigawa state, expressing anger that their 12,000 hectares of farmland had been taken by the state government and sold to a foreign investor for cultivation of sugarcane.
Protest in Ahoada West against the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) over alleged bias in a recent election.

Soldiers are accused of ""mass arrests and killings"" during a voting exercise in Tai and Gokana LGA on 10/12. It is alleged the army connived with some politicians (PDP, suspected) to influence the outcome of the vote. Military forces deny these claims.
A police officer is beheaded during election related violence in Omoku.

column6: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: Two girls, aged ""seven or eight"" detonate suicide packs on their person at a Maiduguri market, killing themselves and wounding at least 17 others. Boko Haram suspected.
Ijaw youths shot and cut off the head of an Urhobo youth residing at Aladja, Udu Local Government Area in revenge of a beheading of a Ogbe-Ijoh carpenter on 09/12.

Police allegedly shot and killed an Okada rider and injured two others over refusal to pay a N50 bribe. Following this, other Okada riders attack the area police station causing police to use tear gas to disperse the group. Two injuries reported from the following unrest.

column6: NURTW: National Union of Road Transport Workers
column8: RTEAN: Road Transport Employers Association of Nigeria
column17: Two sustain gunshot wounds when RTEAN and NURTW clash in Igando on 12/12. The clash is said to have been caused as a result of the refusal of motorcyclists and tricyclists to pay imposed levies.

Police allegedly shot and killed an Okada rider and injured two others over refusal to pay a N50 bribe. Following this, other Okada riders attack the area police station causing police to use tear gas to disperse the group. Two injuries reported from the following unrest.
Youths kill a man for being a homosexual in Gudu District, Abuja.
An army colonel is found murdered inside his quarters at a military school in Ibadan, reasons not yet known.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A commanding officer and several soldiers (numbers unknown) are killed in a Boko Haram IED ambush outside of Gudumbali.

column8: Islamic State (West Africa) and/or Boko Haram - Jamatu Ahli is-Sunnah lid-Dawatai wal-Jihad
column17: A senior military officer is killed in a Boko Haram IED explosion along a road in Kukawa LGA, near Baga.
Members of NUP protest the state government for non-payment of arrears.
""Last week,"" (source dated 20/12) suspected Fulani herdsmen attacked Ungwan Rana, Gadani village, Gwagwada district of Chikun Local Government Area, killing 15.

One person was reportedly killed and several others injured by an explosion in Adadama Community, Abi local government area of Cross River State on 14/12. The blast occurred during a renewed conflict with neighbouring Amagu community of Ebonyi State.
Midwives protest a period without pay around the governors office in Ikeja.
Members of the Nigerian national women's football team hold a sign carrying protest at the National Assembly over unpaid salaries on 14/12.
""Last week,"" (source dated 20/12) five persons were allegedly killed in Kachira village in Kaura Local Government Area in a Fulani attack.
Pensioners barricade the entrance of the Ministry of Finance in Abuja over non-payment of gratuities and other pension entitlements.
A group of three or more persons kidnap and torture two young girls they suspect of witchcraft in Gombe State. One reported dead. Date, location unknown. Source dated 12/12.
A traffic officer is beaten to death by a group of okada riders in Apapa after they were banned from and area.

column7: PENGASSAN: Petroleum and Natural Gas Senior Staff Association of Nigeria
column17: PENGASSAN workers of Mobil Producing Nigeria Unlimited, an affiliate of ExxonMobil, protested against the sack of 145 Nigerian workers and violation of expatriate quota by the company on 15/12 in Lagos (Victoria Island).
Protest over police ""high-handedness"" following a legislative re-run election in Port Harcourt.
On 15 December 2016, IS West Africa militants attacked and killed 8 African coalition forces killed in Metele.
Airline passengers protest lost or abandoned luggage at the airport.

Students demonstrate against the demolition of the Madrasatul Imamis-Sadiq for Islamic Studies, a 35 year-old school located at Wakill Road, Sabon Gari Nasarawa, in Kaduna South local government area.
A group of military forces in Bula Bello go on a ""rampage"", firing their weapons and threatening to kill their officers over unpaid salaries.
